name: Gorgon
description:
Gorgon is a checkers-like game, which is played on a 8x8 board. Each player starts with 16 Gorgons - 8 on each of the two back ranks.

On each turn a Gorgon moves diagonally forward, sliding to an adjacent empty square.
A Gorgon may petrify an opponent`s Gorgon by jumping over it to an empty space on the other side. A petrified Gorgon is unable to move and blocks the space it occupies for the remainder of the game. Jumps may be in any of the five non retreating directions: vertically, diagonally forward, and sideways. Multiple jumps are possible. The first and last row of the board are considered to be connected. A Gorgon leaving one edge will be re-entered at the appropriate space on the other edge.

The first player that cannot move, loses.

Note: The game can be played without forced jumps (standard) or with forced jumps (variation).

Gorgon was implemented on Super Duper Games (only without forced jumps).

name: Mekawing
description:
FREE Print & Play version available in spanish and english:
Spanish Version: https://goo.gl/MnCGkW
English Version: http://www.drivethrurpg.com/product/144392/Mekawing-Z--Open-...

It's been centuries since Humanity left the Earth after exhausting all its natural resources. Escaping to the stars was Humanity's solution, settling in space colonies all around the Solar System. Under the banner of Corpnations, the new post-Humanity has forgotten almost everything form its time on Earth, only having to turn back as a strange energy grows in their old home planet...

Mekawing is a Mecha Tactical Board Game in which two opposing wings battle each other in different scenarios.

Providing a total Cinematic Experience, Mekawing mixes the detail of miniature gaming, and the action/counter-action of card gaming to create a unique gaming experience. This is done with both wing creation and deck construction rules and mechanics.

Each player picks their Ace pilots which provide Wing Points from which they buy mechs - Mekas - for their wings. Players have three factions to play, each faction providing a selection of meka types and equipment configurations; focusing on melee combat, ranged combat, or special support.

Additionally, each player builds his/her own Duel decks with cards that show each meka's fighting style, and Upgrade cards that grant special actions and abilities to their Mekas, provide bonuses and/or create special battle situations; giving each wing its own tactics and strategies.

During play, players choose a scenario, build the map using terrain tiles, and use their mekas to gain control of the battleground using their meka's equipment and Action Cards.

Want to now the story behind Mekawing? go to https://mekawing.wordpress.com/2015/04/28/ficcion-mekawing-r... (content in spanish).
categories: Card Game, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Diceland: Horus Promo Die
description: This was a promotional die given away for the 2002 Origins Game Fair in Columbus, OH. It is a pretty standard Diceland die, with a jump special ability, and a weak, weak attack. Horus is a fighter for the Gypsy Queen army.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Wrath of Ashardalon Boardgame – Kobold Champion Promo
description:
The Kobold Champion is a promo card that was being given out at PAX West 2010 to go with the Grey Hag promo card (which was previously available at Gencon and was also handed out at PAX)

---

Kobold Champion is a Reptile creature. AC of 16 and HP of 3

Tactics:

-If the kobold is within one tile of a hero, it moves adjacent to the closest hero and attacks that hero with a short sword. After the attack, pass this card to the second player on your left.

-Otherwise, the kobold moves 1 tile toward the closest Hero. After the move, pass this card to the second player on your left.

Attack is +8, Damage is 2 (Miss: 1 Damage)

Worth 4 Experience
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Chronopia: Firstborn Watchtower
description:
From the back of the box:

The Firstborn Watchtower is a 3D expansion set, that takes the concept of fighting in and around buildings to a new level, offering a wealth of new opportunities for future battles in Chronopia. it begins with the Firstborn Watchtower but where will it end - in the Ringholds of the Dwarves or in the Tombs beneath a Stygian Ziggurat? This product will allow you to take your battles to new heights and hidden depths.

Contents:
• A full color card model of a Firstborn watchtower: on eight sheets of card for you to construct.
• Two exclusive new miniatures; only available with this boxed set: The 'Enlightened' of the Firstborn and the 'Stalker' from the ranks of the Devout.
• A 32 page booklet containing comprehensive new rules for using buildings on the battlefield and fighting indoors or underground. A scenario designed around the Firstborn watchtower with descriptive text and battle photographs to put the tower and the new rules in context.
• New templates and counters to help you fight in and around buildings.

Note: This is not a stand-alone product; a copy of the main Chronopia rules is required to use the additional rules included in this box set.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Battle of Kyuden Tonbo
description:
Brand new introductory set for Legend of the Five Rings. Features the Dragon Clan and Lion Clan in two pre-built decks ready to play right out of the box. A lavish rulebook quickly teaches new players everything they need to know to start defending the Empire of Rokugan.

The set also comes with many choice rares for the current environment, giving players a quick foot up in the game! Combine with the free Imperial Gift set (150 cards free!) and you'll be serving with honor in no time!

(publisher blurb0
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: BattleTech Record Sheets Volume Two: Medium 'Mechs
description:
From the back cover:

"50 tons of devastating firepower. Nothing can stand in a BattleMech's way, except another 'Mech! This book compiles for the first time the BattleTech statistics for the variant Inner Sphere & Clan 'Mech designs. Some are rare, others unique, and each could be that extra surprise you need for victory.

BattleTech Record Sheets Volume 2: Medium 'Mechs contains medium 'Mech variants from the 2750, 3025, and 3050 eras of BattleMechs. Included are record sheets for over 45 'Mechs, each with full technical statistics. Included are:


CRB-27 Crab
Hop-4C Hoplite
KTO-19 Kintaro
STN-3L Sentinel
WVE-5N Wyvern
Dragonfly B OmniMech
Fenris A OmniMech"


User comment:

This record sheet pack is one of four that cover all of the 'Mechs detailed in the BattleTech Technical Readout: 2750, BattleTech Technical Readout: 3025 and BattleTech Technical Readout: 3050. It also includes the current Combat Values for the 'Mechs, as at the time of printing.

Although the copyright date states that this publication is copyright 1991, it was actually published in 1990.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Gods Along the Nile
description:
GODS ALONG THE NILE is a card-driven game based on the many colorful gods of ancient Egypt. Each card represents one of 54 different gods and the three most important aspects [represented by icons] that each God represented. Each player represents a Temple Priest and starts with 3 cards, 5 scarabs [money], and a player card referred to as the TEMPLE. Each turn, players draw one or two cards, which are played to that player’s Temple. The card icons determine where they may be placed on the Temple in order to maximize sets of Canopic Jars. For each matching icon you receive one Scarab. For each SET of Scarabs you receive 2, 3, or 4 Jars. At the end of each of the three rounds of play, for each set of four different Jars - you gain one Pharaoh. Rounds stop when the deck is emptied or three cards with special CHAOS icons are showing. At the end of the game, the Priest with the most Pharaohs wins.

The game is designed for 2-4 players, but comes with 15 extra cards and an extra Temple to add a 5th player.

name: The Human Race
description:
Earth - Present Day
The day started off so well for the humans, but then the sky darkened as a higher intelligence showed its face. These aliens are here to have a little fun, it's a race-to abduct the most humans. Can the humans strike back, or will the aliens have their way?

The Human Race is a competitive alien abduction game, a cooperative military defensive game, or both!

Alien Abduction
You and your alien opponents must move your spaceship pawns around the hex-filled game board to abduct the specific human target as indicated by the deck of target cards. While a player is abducting a human, opponents may move on to the next target or try to steal the human abductee from the alien abductor by attacking them. But look out! The humans aren't going to take this sitting down, the military is after you too. There are also bonuses to help you along on your journey. The alien with the most points when all the humans have been abducted wins!

Military Defensive
You will control the Earth denizens in a last-ditch effort to keep your peeps safe! Blast the heck out of the alien menace and end their sick game once and for all. Move jets and tanks around the board in order to quell the situation while moving human targets to safety. Rob the aliens of their prizes or their spaceships and save the day!
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Last Samurai
description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #13.

Seinan Senso is a campaign level wargame of the Satsuma Rebellion (1877).
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satsuma_Rebellion
Designer's note writes that the game was designed with reference to basic engine of Paths of Glory and deck building concept from Dominion.

Players control either imperial Japanese Army or Rebels of Satsuma Domain. Players manage military operation and resources represented by the card.

The winner is determined by the collapse of morale. Morale will be reduced by the difference of the holding number of important spaces. Satsuma Domain player will also win that morale will not collapse until the final turn.
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Reverse Charades: Sports Edition
description:
Reverse Charades: Sports Edition, an expansion pack for Reverse Charades, consists of 220 cards that feature sports-themed words.

Game play remains the same as in the base game, with players divided into two teams. On a turn, all but one player on a team give charades-style clues to that one person left out, and that person guesses as many words as possible in sixty seconds. After each player on both teams has had a shot at guessing (and both teams have had the same number of turns), the team with the most words guessed wins.

name: Octopus' Garden: Large Harlequin Shrimp
description:
A promotional expansion for Octopus' Garden.

Beauty Score 2. Add all Large Harlequin Shrimp to the tile pool. The Large Harlequin Shrimp may be placed in any empty space or on any plain Oyster. Sea Stars will not move onto any tile containing a Large Harlequin Shrimp.

name: Octopus' Garden: Boxer Crab
description:
A promotional expansion for Octopus' Garden.

Beauty Score 3. Add all Boxer Crabs to the tile pool. You may only Place the Boxer Crab if you already have at least one Anemone in your garden. Place the Boxer Crab on top on an Anemone- the two tiles behave as one now, and may be moved to any adjacent empty space during the Move Sea Stars phase. This duo blocks Sea Stars, just as Coral does. If an Anemone tile is moved this way, a placed Clownfish remains in the Garden even if their initial placement conditions no longer exist.

name: Octopus' Garden: Research Sub
description:
A promotional expansion for Octopus' Garden.

Beauty Score --. Put 1 Research Sub in the draw bag for each player. When the Research Sub is drawn, do not place it in the Market. Instead, have each player immediately take 1 Pearl from the supply for every different colour Coral in their Garden. Discard the Research Sub and finish refilling the Market.

name: The Duke: Specter Promo Tile
description:
This promotional item for the The Duke core game, adds a a new playing piece that acts as a moving terrain piece with special abilities, while still maintaining the the major goal of the game, which is to capture the opponent's Duke tile. It introduces one new tile to the game with additional or special rules.

The special rules for this terrain piece allow it to capture playing pieces from either opponent.

This promotional release was given to those who supported the Kickstarter campaign in 2012, and will possibly be available later at special events held by or attended by the company.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval

name: QuickDraft
description:
QuickDraft is a fast tactical card game about drafting the best cards for your hand, maximizing your Victory Points and disrupting your opponents plans.

To reach this goal, the players have different card types at their disposal.
There are coloured cards with different victory point values and quantities and there are white cards offering a wide selection of effects - ranging from improving or copying another card to stealing cards from another player and bonus victory points if specific conditions are met.

The game plays in three phases:

During the Drafting Phase the players are selecting a total of nine cards for their hand using a drafting mechanic like in "7 Wonders" or in "Magic: the Gathering" sealed tournaments.

During the Playing Phase the six of the nine cards collected during the first phase are played and the different card effects are resolved.

During the Counting Phase each player determines how many victory points he has using all the cards he has in front of him (+ eventual bonuses from cards on his hand).

The player with the most victory points wins the game.







Though QuickDraw is a multiplayer game, there are rules for a solo game included where a single player trys to beat 10 levels of increasing difficulty.







One deck of cards (60 playing cards) is enough to accomodate up to 5 players. If however, two decks of cards are combined, up to 10 players can play QuickDraw.







In January 2013 the second edition of this game was published by the Gamecrafter. The game now features a new card type - black cards, new card effects on the white cards and offers several new strategies by strengthening the coloured cards.
This new version also includes a Hold'em variant - essentially offering two different games in one small package.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Off the Dead: Chapitre 1 – Morts à Venice Beach – Promo Zombie
description:
Promo card included in the first 533 limited copies of the first edition and also given with Plato Magazine 39 (June 2011)

the card is a 2 strengh zombie with a special power.
When the zombie is revealed ignore the event table and roll a dice, on a 1 or 2 your survivor can't do any action until he is beaten or until another survivor throw him an item.

name: Bionic: Nano Edition
description:
Bionic: Nano Edition is a super compact paragraph driven adventure game. It is set in a dark cyber-punk future where corporations on the cutting edge of cybernetic augmentation technologies rule, and a grass roots movement driven by a desire to preserve some semblance of humanity resists from the shadows and gutters of society.

16 chits that indicate a range of numbers, icons and keywords, a character board, and a handful of wood cubes form the backbone of Bionic: Nano Edition. These are used to track your stats and resolve conflicts as you explore the Bionic Universe through one of the adventures designed for Nano Edition.

Each adventure provides a few cards for items, contacts and identities unique to that adventure as well as an adventure booklet. The adventure booklet (sometimes more than one) is the meat of your adventure - a paragraph driven micro-RPG. The goal of each adventure is different, but the fundamental game-play is the same: Make choices and flip chits to resolve conflicts.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Bulwark
description:
From publisher description:

Heroic Co-operative Deck-Building!

Be a hero valiantly coming to the aid of a stronghold as a vast army bears down on it! Use the resources of the stronghold and your own unique abilities to keep it from overwhelmed.

Build a deck of cards to play with as you go and do your best to defeat the foes as they appear.

Choose one of 3 heroes - Arpad of Lhun, Zsuzsa Slatewalker and Sandor the Wise - to help a besieged settlement.
Face one of 2 pre-built armies, the Goblin Horde or the Fire Lizard Crusade, or customise your own.
Set how challenging you want the defence to be.
Save Fort Briggs!

In Bulwark, players use "Heroism" to purchase cards for their hand, and play those cards to upgrade their hero and fight monsters.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Mage Wars: Hurl Rock Promo Card
description:
First distributed at Origins 2013

Attack card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Dungeon of Deadliest Evil
description:
The mad sorcerer Grislyk has stolen the Book of Lore from the elves and hidden it in his dungeon lair. As the elven warrior maiden Kora, you must brave three increasingly dangerous levels to recover the Book, destroy Grislyk’s magical Black Crucible, and slay the wizard himself. Magical artifacts will help you evade Grislyk’s traps and slay his army of goblins and skeletons, but you will also need your wits and a bit of luck, for knowing when to search, when to fight, and when to run is the only way to survive the DUNGEON OF DEADLIEST EVIL.

Dungeon of Deadliest Evil is a solitaire adventure game that takes all the essential elements of a classic dungeon crawl, like slaying monsters, finding powerful artifacts, and exploring a multi-level dungeon, and packs them into an easy-to-learn game that sets up and plays in 20 minutes.

Gameplay is based on a simple dice allocation mechanic. You have three abilities, Speed, Combat, and Defense, and at the start of each turn you must assign one of three dice (a d4, a d6, and a d8) to each of them. While the game involves a good deal of luck and dice-rolling, judicious dice allocation is the key to success. Victory is achieved by destroying the Black Crucible, retrieving the Book of Lore, slaying the evil wizard Grislyk, and finally leaving the dungeon alive.

name: Iron Horses
description:
ALL ABOARD!

Iron Horses throws you back into the 19th century when Railroads dominated commerce. Climb aboard any one of Lydon Rail Company’s four railways and race to be the first train to successfully deliver $1,000,000 in resources! Be wary of what lies ahead, as setbacks are bound to happen! Tariffs will slow our delivery, maintenance will stop you in your tracks and hijackers are eager to steal your payload! Fix what you can, deliver the goods and attain victory!

Gameplay Overview:

Each player chooses one of four unique railways each with a unique advantage. During a turn, a player has up to 4 available actions, Draw, Transport, Remedy, and Sabotage, each of which will either bring you closer to victory or slow down your opponents. Your main goal is to accumulate $1,000,000 in resources before another player beats you to it. Denominations range from $25,000 to $250,000, so keep a look out for highly valued resources. But it isn't as simple as drawing and transporting resources...Setbacks can bring you to a halt. Remedy them quick to keep moving! Game play is quick, with each player allowed up to 3 actions per turn! You may draw, transport and sabotage in a turn, Draw twice and then remedy, or if you are feeling notorious, Sabotage three times! A 2-player game usually lasts about 10-15 minutes. Add a third and expect a bit longer.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That
publishers: (Unknown), Rampage Games LLC, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Futbol Mesa
description:
Manage a football club and not let go until the last detail. Manage your players transfers, hire a coach, tactics, lineups, youth team, club stores, expand the stadium, shareholders, reservations, training, finance, sports betting...

THE GOAL OF THE GAME:
The goal is not to win the league, the goal is to be the player with the most manger points at the end of the game although naturally win titles helps to get points. Get points with reforms manager, hiring employees ...

TURN:

1- Round:
Renew the newspapper, calendar and the transfer market.
2 - Stage Management:
The first player place an employee in an area of ​​board and it goes the other players.
3 - Previous: Use training cubes and investments cubes to improve athletically and improve economically.
4 - Match: Roll the match dice and then play up to 3 players to execute personal movement to alter the result.
5 - End of the round: Rate the game, betting and renew your team's bench.

name: Jaque!
description:
This game is composed by 30 cards divided in 6 suits, each one with 5 cards (values 2-3-4-5-7)
On a game only 3 suits will be used, randomly or chosen by the players.

On a round each player receives 7 cards and the remaining one is kept hidden.
On a turn the starting player plays a card on his side of the player area. The other player must play a card of the same suit if possible. I he doesn’t have one he must play a card with the same number. The highest card wins the movement and the winner will begin the next movement with any card of his hand.
If a player can’t play a valid card (suit, then number) then the round is over and the other player wins the round. The winner will receive points equal to the multiplication of the value in his last card played and the number of movements in the round.
A round can also end when all 14 cards are played. Then the winner of the last movement will earn points equal to the value of the hidden card (no multiplication here).

The game ends when someone has 50 points or more. That player will be the winner.

There are also some cards with special abilities for and advanced game.

name: Havok & Hijinks: Gen Con Promo Card
description:
This promo card was created for Gen Con 2013 and was given to players who sat for a demo of Havok & Hijinks.

Ready Side:

Play: Your dragon gains an affinity of your choice
Crash: If an event with an affinity is flipped, your dragon gains that affinity and you may resolve the event for your dragon (the original dragon resolves it after)

Tired Side:

Crash: If an event with an affinity is flipped, your dragon gains that affinity and you may resolve the event for your dragon (the original dragon resolves it after)
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Age of Craft Expansion #1: Blueprints and Visitors
description:
This expansion for Age of Craft introduces two new sets of cards, Blueprints and Visitors, along with new rules for their use. It also includes two new random cards that can be used with the base game rules.

Blueprints begin in a face down stack. Each player is dealt two random Blueprints at the beginning of the game and can choose to purchase more during the building phase. Blueprints can either be events, which are discarded after use, or they can be buildings that are constructed in the same manner as the buildings on offer in the common supply. There is no limit to the number of Bluprints that a player may purchase.

Visitor cards are goals that offer points to the player who meets their requirements. Two Visitor cards are drawn randomly at the beginning of the game. Once a player has obtained a Visitor card, an opponent may take it by surpassing the requirements met by the owner of the card.
publishers: Chicken Dice Games (チキンダイスゲームズ)

name: Head Honcho: Jet Combat Over the Yalu
description:
Head Honcho is an introductory level mini-game on air combat set during the early years of the Korean War. The game is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh, with graphics by Bruce Yearian, and is published by High Flying Dice Games.

Head Honcho: Jet Combat over the Yalu is also the Consimworld Donation Drive Gold Level game for 2015. Head Honcho features such aircraft as the F-86, the F-84, F9F Panther and other aircraft of the war, all battling the Communist MiG-15s for air supremacy.

Head Honcho is not meant to be the most accurate of air warfare simulations. Rather, players should find this an entertaining diversion that still captures the “essence” of the violent and tense nature of Korean War jet combat. Similar to other minigames using this design (Dueling Eagles, Fighting Eagles), I also hope Head Honcho serves as a vehicle by which newcomers to the hobby of simulation gaming can be introduced.

name: Ascension: Archival Expert Promo Card
description:
Starting in June 2015, Stone Blade Entertainment announced a new incentive program for hobby retailers. The company will now offer exclusive monthly promo card kits to participating retailers.

Archival Expert is the card for June 2015.

Cost: 5 Runes

Mechana Hero

Choose One: You may acquire a Construct this turn without paying its cost OR draw a card

3 Honor
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Spin Doctor: The Card game of Dirty Politics
description: Spin Doctor: The Card game of Dirty Politics is a card game for 2 to 6 (or more) players wherein the players take on the role of candidates running for President of the United States. During the course of the game, players will accumulate votes by collecting state cards while at the same time thwarting their opponent’s ability to do the same by putting them in scandal, winning debates, being underhanded and generally behaving like a mud slinging politician!

name: Yunnan: Dian Mu Temple
description: Yunnan: Dian Mu Temple is a postcard expansion for Yunnan that features a new building on one side and the rules for use of the building on the reverse side.

name: Friend or Foe
description:
Recover the Summit, Rescue the Captive...

He’s been waiting, waiting for days. Hands tied, captured by enemy forces. He’s confident you will save him. You wouldn’t leave him to languish at the hands of his captors. Would you? Will he be rescued first? Or will his enemies destroy your clan to rescue their own captive?

You must make the treacherous journey across the Karrowlands. The Karrowlands are perilous; a vast and unending land stretching from the desolate desert to the arctic ice, from the rolling grasslands to the fields of lava. Recover the summit. It’s the only way. But who will be there waiting for you? Gwythral, the tameable dragon? Maneeri, the mountain giant known for taking captives of his own? Ragnash, The Wolf of the Underworld, who devours everything in his wake? Or perhaps your enemies have set up an ambush of their own? You must fight.

Control locations to gather resources. Deploy extra recruits. Battle the unsuspecting foes. Advance towards the enemy base. Will you team up with local kinsmen, or will you venture out alone? Choose your clansmen wisely.

He sits and prays for you, his compatriot, to come to rescue him; to save the day. He knows the journey will not be easy. Will you recover the summit and rescue the captive? Or abandon him to your foes. Only time will tell.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Ta bouche
description:
Ta bouche is a card game from 1 to 5 players.

Includes: 110 cards (50 'Thoughts' cards, 50 'Retort' cards, 10 scoring cards), 1 dice.

Each player draws a card. One of the players read out loud one of the Thoughts lines: the other players, each at their turn, must use one of their 'Retort' lines to snap back the silliest or funnniest retort.

The player who fails to do that, or gives the lamest retort (after a decision by the reader), is shouted out: "Ta bouche" and loses 1 point on the score track.

At the end of a round, the player with the most points loses the game.

This is the familial variation of the game "Taggle". It's different from the classical version in the sense that the thoughts lines are adapted for the youngest, while "Taggle" is more 'adult' and could not please all parents.

name: Burn The Heretic
description:
You have joined a sinister cult. You must learn how to greet the senior figures, called the Keepers, and condemn Heretics.

Game play consists of turning face-up cards from the Acolyte deck, which show the characters in the cult. Four of the characters will be Keepers. This deck also includes random Revelation cards which change the Keepers and the way to greet them, and causes characters to be condemned as Heretics, or pardoned.

The penalty for making an incorrect response or being too slow to make the correct response is to collect the face-up Acolyte deck. The winner is the player who has collected the fewest Acolyte cards after two rounds.

name: Ice Nutz Pro Hockey
description:
Ice Nutz Pro HOckey is a realistic fast paced, simulation game played using dice and charts. Pro player's offensive and defensive abilities directly impact the action on each & every roll of the dice. Play head to head or solitaire and coach your favorite team to victory by maximizing your team's strengths while exploiting your opponent's weaknesses.
Ice Nutz features precision passing, skating, shooting, checking, rebounds, breakaways, glove saves, line changes, penalties, power plays, shootouts, injuries, even fighting...It's all in here! Play head to head or solitaire. Play a full season, or just the playoffs...maybe with the right breaks you can claim the Cup as your own!

name: Storyteller Cards: Fantasy
description:
Storyteller Cards: Fantasy are a playing card deck, designed to inspire creativity in gamers, role-players, writers, artists, teachers, parents and children. They were designed by Jason Tagmire and illustrated by Campbell Whyte.

Each card features an illustration with 4 unique elements. There is a character, holding an item, completing an action, in a location. Each of these elements can be used to create something new, get you out of a mid-project slump, or just to have some creative fun with family and friends.

The cards also feature additional icons in the corners to help you dig a little deeper into storytelling, creating, and gaming. The icons represent a rank, suit, mood, season, letter, and color.


The Storyteller Manual: Fantasy edition includes rules for different ways to play. From strategic coloring to push-your-luck storytelling, there are game variations for everyone. Many variants are story based gaining points for each card played, best poker hands and matching card elements, but others include strategic coloring (where players must complete illustration quadrants to earn points), and endless possibilities (where the players create and change the rules in a race to 30 points).

name: Garden of Bees
description:
Protect your hive. Conquer the garden. Garden of Bees is a lively dice rolling board game for 2 to 6 players!

Welcome to the Garden of Bees. You are a mighty queen bee and will claim this garden as yours and yours alone. Oppose other queen bees and their armies. You will risk everything on the whim of nature and the challenge of pollinating flowers. Raise your army of loyal bees, bide your time and find the perfect moment to battle. You will be the queen of the garden.

Garden of Bees is a dice rolling game where players build an army of bees to eliminate other players. Players must make dynamic choices to find the best strategy. This game engages all players and requires them to be vigilant to find victory. The flow of each round allows for tactical decision making and tongue biting dice rolls.

The game is won by eliminating players until there is only one remaining. Each round players gain honey which they can use to try to harvest flowers for more honey, buy event cards to change the flow of the game or buy bees for their bee army. Players can use their bee army to attack other players and take them out.

name: Munchkin: Playmat – Spyke's Christmas Wish
description: Munchkin Playmat: Spyke's Christmas Wish is a 28"×14" playmat that includes spots to keep track of your Class, Race, level, and all your monster-slaying gear, and it features an in-game bonus: You can draw an item from the treasure discard pile for free once per game; you've been good this year!

name: Incaico
description:
Incaico is a competitive card game in which players populate their villages in order to collect resources, construct buildings and monuments, develop commerce and impose their military might.

At the beginning of each round, players draft resource, building, monument, worker, warrior and other types of cards into their hands. Low-level cards with no cost can be immediately added to a player's village. Other cards demand resources - stone, wood, gold and/or "charqui" - or a minimum number of workers in the village.

The player with the most Sun points at the end of four rounds is the winner. Sun points are earned in a number of ways:


having workers in your village,
having resources in your village,
constructing buildings and monuments,
fulfilling unique requirements (having three of a certain card, for example), and
having a larger army than your neighbours, forcing them to pay Sun point tributes.


Players will also learn some basic words in Quechua and Aymara, two Incan languages which are still spoken today.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trading

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Orassin Expansion Pack
description:
The Orassin is a Xindi-Insectoid starship. This Xindi warship is well armed with torpedoes and pulse-firing phase cannons. The Xindi-Insectoids are a highly aggressive race and have made an alliance with the equally hostile Xindi-Reptilians.
This expansion adds a new ship and a new set of cards to Star Trek: Attack Wing.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Mercs: Recon – The Cleaner
description:
The Cleaner is a Kickstarter exclusive add-on figure for the Mercs Recon: Counter Threat or Mercs Recon: Assassination Protocol games.

It consists of:
1x The Cleaner miniature
1x The Cleaner stat card

This can be used to replace an Op-For event in game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Mercs: Recon – Assistant to the Regional Manager
description:
This is a Kickstarter exclusive add-on for the Mercs:Recon Counter Threat and Mercs:Recon Assassination Protocol games.

Contains:
1x Assistant to the Regional Manager miniature
1x Assistant to the Regional Manager stat card

This can be used to replace an Op-For event in the game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Simurgh: Call of the Dragonlord – Limited Promo Cards
description: The limited promo cards expand Simurgh: Call of the Dragonlord, adding more diversity to this expansion. They require Call of the Dragonlord and they can simply be added to the box.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Senior Staff Resource
description:
The Senior Staff Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in the "Yesterday's Enterprise" episode Organized Play Event. It is considered a Resource, and costs a variable number of Squadron Points.

When using this resource, every ship in your fleet can field an additional Elite Talent for every Crew assigned to it. Each extra talent is assigned to a specific Crew and is discarded if it's associated Crew is discarded. The total cost of the resource is 1 Squadron Point per extra Elite Talent that you field via the resource.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Red Lion
description:
Description from the publisher:

Most of us take our local Pubs for granted - yet throughout history they have played an important part in Britain's social life and the landscape of town and country. But the names and signs of Pubs have a rich and fascinating story to tell, which is celebrated in this highly original card game. Easy to learn and tremendous fun to play!

Players start with a hand of 5 cards and must play them all to win. To play a card you must play a pub whose symbol matches the last card played. Symbols form suits and there are 11 in the game. There are also some special cards to spice things up for the next player (miss a turn, reverse play direction). A series of 3x cards (eg 3 Barrels) also require the next player to pick up 3 cards. This can be defeated with another 3x card causing the next player to pick up 6 and so on.

When down to the last card, the player must call "time gentleman please" or "last order" or gain a penalty card. When the last card is played, the winner scores the value of all other players remaining cards. Rounds continue until target score (eg 50) is achieved.

name: Spellfire: Booster Pack, Set 1
description: June 1994 - These boosters were also released with the first edition double decks. They had 14 cards that could be found with standard decks, plus every pack had one of 25 chase cards. These chase were the first AD&D champions. It also had 6 cards names for people at TSR: Gib Ekim (#4), Gib Evets (#11), Gib Htimsen (#13), Dori the Barbarian (#12), Red Zeb (#19), and Fejyelsae (#7). This tradition would continue for many boosters to follow. This is also where we found the first "instant defeat" champions: Lovely Colleen (#22), and Gloriana (#3). Now, that seems to be all you see in tourney decks. This too continues throughout Spellfire's History.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trading

name: Mario Kart 7: Super Sound Racing Game
description: In this board game adaptation of the popular video game franchise, players take turns as they attempt to be the first player to cross the finish line, after completing two laps. To do this, players take control of the steering wheel which acts as dice in the game. Depending on which of three colors your playing piece is sitting on the game board, that indicates how many times you turn the steering wheel left or right. The steering wheel will then tell you how many spaces to move your playing piece. As in the video game, item boxes are scattered around the game board which grants items as players land on them. Some are instant use items, while others are used later.The steering wheel is also used to determine if items are used successfully against opponents. When hit by an item, players spin the steering wheel six times and the wheel will tell you if the outcome is successful or not. Successful hits push the affected player to the edge of the game board marked by blue spaces.

name: War Games Rules 1000 BC to 1000 AD
description:
User summary:

War Games Rules

These rules were used for the Ancient games in the 1972-1975 National Wargames Championships and were officially adopted by the Society of Ancients, the special society for Ancient and Medieval wargammers.

For the third edition:

The third edition of these rules were used for the Ancient games in the 1972-1973 National Wargames Championships.

New material provided for more varied situations for battles such as attacks on fortifications and ship to shore fighting.
This edition aslo changed the ground scale and the subdivision of light infantry and super heavy cavalry troop types.

For the fourth edition:

The third edition of these rules were used for the Ancient games in the 1974-1975 National Wargames Championships.

Minor changes to the rules were made to close up loopholes in the rules exploited in the previous two years of play. Some additional explanations were also provided to make the rules more accessible to new comers to wargaming.

name: Quadrigae
description:
Description from the publisher:

Chariot races had, in the ancient Rome, lot of followers. Not only the people frequented the races, but emperors, senators, intellectuals, writers crowded the circus.
The Aurigae, who drove chariots with two, three, four, sometimes eight or ten horses, where idols of the crowd, but the people didn’t support particularly the driver, but one of the four traditional teams.
Quadrigae (demo version) reproduces the Roman chariot races through a fast system which gives you the chance to revive a whole day at the races in an evening. The charioteers, each one with his own name and characteristics, assume the role of the captain looking for the victory or of a helper who try to facilitate his captain blocking and attacking the adversaries. Not all of them will arrive whole at the end: some will fall without damage but humiliation, some others will remain stunned and out of the races; the unluckiest… will die. As the owner of a team (Dominus factionis) you’ll decide the tactics of the race and sign on your register the won races, good results and injuries.
The quadrigae (chariots) move along a 100 x 28 cm board reproducing the Circus Maximum. Each chariot can make two phases of advance and one phase (optional) of aggression. The movement consists in an automathic advancement of 2 steps and a bonus of 1 step depending on the strengthness of the chariot.

name: Spires: Deluxe Expansion pack
description:
During the Kickstarter for Spires they offered a Deluxe Content expansion pack. It was only available in a few of the pledge levels.

Content:

8 New Scroll cards (the graphic in the Kickstarter said 7)
1 Rule card
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Red Dragon Inn: The Basilisk's Gaze
description:
A promo from the kickstarter for The Red Dragon Inn 6: Villains.

4 alcohol content

If you gain Alcohol Content from this Drink on your own turn, put it on top of your Character Deck, you can't play cards and you Ignore all effects. Discard this card at the beginning of your next turn.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Munchkin Collectible Card Game: Booster
description:
Munchkin Collectible Card Game is a combat game in which players level up turn after turn, put loot into play to give themselves benefits, and attack (or bluff attacks!) against one another. Eliminate the other player first, and you win!

Each Munchkin Collectible Card Game: Booster contains twelve randomized cards from the hundreds of cards in Season 1.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting

name: Tali
description:
Tali is the historic Roman version of Knucklebones. Featuring the tactile feel of simulated Bones and upgradeable to metal historically based coins. Helping bring History back to life. Tali, recreates the knucklebones game of gambling as the Roman's used to play it. Two games in one, Tali includes the historic rules played 1000 years ago as well as a micro role-playing game version with more player options and complexity.

Knucklebones is the ancestor to dice, before there were dice, the knuckle bones of sheep (or sometimes goats) would be used as it had a regular shape of four possible sides to land on.

The Romans would sometimes mark the knuckle bones with different roman numerals on each side, I,III, IV and VI. The roman numerals would then be used to score the throw of the bones.

Players ante into the game similar to modern gambling games. Once to play and then for each round. Every round each player will get to throw the bones. You score when getting at least one VI. The player who achieves either a Venus or the highest total will win the round and the coins in the round pot.

The Venus throw will win the game pot and the round pot (each face, I, II, IV, and VI).

A micro role-playing game has been added to the historic base game, in which each player selects a historic character from 1000 AD to play. Each character is given a rich background and a set of powers / capabilities to help them win in Tali.

Are you feeling lucky? Are the gods with you tonight?
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Voting

name: World Dumbination
description:
For decades our planet has been monitored by alien species. Worried by recent events, enormous alien spaceships are sent towards earth. Announcing they come to save us from our self-inflicted fate, people rush to get on-board the spaceships. But the aliens will only let the smart people on-board, leaving the less gifted behind. Most of the leaders get in, but some didn’t make the cut, for more or less obvious reasons.

In World Dumbination you play as these five leaders that didn't make it on-board. You can choose to play as the leader of USA, Venezuela, Turkey, and Russia – or, of course, North Korea! It’s never been easier to conquer the world. Will you make it to world domination, will you all destroy the planet in a nuclear super-shower, or will you collectively achieve world peace!

World Dumbination is a fun asymmetric strategy game for 2 to 5 players. The game was inspired by world leaders arguing like small children sitting in a sandpit, and that is the idea for the cover art.

Even if there are a lot of military leaders remaining, you need to build your military forces from scratch. Reaching your first goal makes you able to draw stronger cards. Each nation has two first goals option and the goals are different for each nation.

Find the best strategy to move your forces and build military bases (that decide the strength of your units). The players choose and place cards to reveal them all at the same time. Play action cards to attack your opponents to gain victory points, or play project cards to get some advantages as well as victory points.

You also have to constantly watch your ego and popularity levels that you can control with card actions. With too little self-esteem you don’t dare to do any action. Too much ego makes you crazy and focused on only one target (you have to almost be crazy to use the nuclear bomb). If you get to unpopular, you as a leader can be overthrow by your own government. Getting very popular increases you income since your people work harder for you.

There are geniuses (those who wouldn’t get on the spaceships) still hiding on Earth. Finding one or two of them would also help you in your quest for world domination. You can also find things that the aliens left behind.

In case the players get too clever, there are Dumbness cards in the mix to make sure some kind of stupidity will take place. Will anyone win the Nobel Peace Prize? Maybe some briefcases with secret codes got mix up during the last world meeting, or will the bombs fly uncontrollable around since none of the leaders have any knowledge of geography!

You win by having the most victory points in the end. The game ends when a player has reached 15 victory points, or when 4 nuclear bombs has been disarmed and removed from the game. Yes, this is a war game you can win by making world peace! You will also find a party alien, fake news, reality shows, abandoned spaceships and cute kittens threatening to start a nuclear war in this game!

There are some interesting new mechanics in the game, but the main thing in this game is the fun factor! This game is designed for a lot of interaction between players and the surprisingly events that shows up add a great deal to the silliness. And the more players, the more fun!

name: Flipside: The Card Game
description: Flipside is a game that uses a special deck of double sided cards. In your turn you take a card, return a card, flip one or flip all of your cards. After that if the value of your cards equals the value of the cards remaining in the centre you win!

name: Vs System 2PCG: The MCU Battles
description:
Vs System 2PCG is superficially similar to the original Vs. System collectible card game, but is a completely rebuilt game that takes some inspiration from the original. Combat has been streamlined, the turn structure is different, the resource system has been revamped, and the game is no longer collectible, with cards instead being released in a non-random format. A single box contains a full play-set of all cards.

Each player starts with a Main Character, such as Captain America, Iron Man, or Loki and a deck of 60 cards. During the game, you’ll play resources and recruit Supporting Characters like Falcon, Baby Groot, or Nebula. You’ll organize your formation between your Front and Back Rows, you’ll make solo and team attacks against your enemies in order to stun and KO them. You’ll play Plot Twists to enhance your team or hurt your opponent’s. You’ll play locations and activate your team’s super powers. Your Main Character will earn Experience Points and Level Up to dominate the battlefield. Finally, you’ll KO your opponent’s Main Character (or they’ll KO yours).

Each turn, you’ll go through the following four phases in order. Then, the next player takes a turn.
1. Draw Phase - Draw 2 cards from your deck
2. Recovery Phase - Any stunned characters are recovered and then readied.
3. Build Phase - Play a resource or Location. Then using you total resource points recruit new characters form your hand based on their cost.
4. Main Phase - The longest phase consisting of multiple combats as you attack your opponents characters trying to stun and KO them.

The first issue of the Earth 199999 Arc, Vs System 2PCG: The MCU Battles is also the first Giant-Sized Issue of 2018. It not only creates a new Universe for vs System 2PCG is also introduces two new teams. The MCU Heroes and MCU Villains. This 200 card Giant-Sized Issue is perfect step on point for new players as this comes with a full set of cards with images straight from the movies, counters, and a full color rulebook.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: B-Sieged: Sons of the Abyss – Promo Heroes: Eivor the Knoble, Thorlak the Barbarian, and Donatto the Cook
description:
Originally these heroes were only available during the B-seiged: Sons of the Abyss Kickstarter campaign. For the 2018 CMON Expo 3 pack sets were given away as promo sets in the swag bag.

This box numbered BSG-KS04 includes the three heroes Eivor, Thorlak, and Donatto.

BSG-KS04 promo introduces three brand-new Heroes to defend the Citadel of Modhelm: Thorlak, the barbarian; Eivor, the noble; Donatto, the cook

Thorlak, the Barbarian is all about channeling his inner rage! With his Uncontrolled Wrath Special Ability, he's able to roll 2 extra dice when he attacks Zone 1 (for a total of 3 dice, as each Hero is able to roll 1 die innately) - enabling him to clear many Krohns storming the walls as he bellows savagely. His Base Strength of 3 ensures that he's strong enough to deal with Elite enemies and Mölens without needing Bonus Strength. But all of his savagery comes at a price: Thorlak can't store Permanent Cards, and therefore can't equip Armor or Weapons.

As a veteran of many battles, Eivor, the Noble boasts a Base Strength of 2, which enables him to deal with the Elite versions of Krohns and Gargohs from the very start of the game. Eivor's Persuasion starting Special Ability grants an extra Gold when he visits the Palace - and this extra Gold may be given to another Hero if he chooses to do so. With this ability, the entire group of Heroes may benefit, as the extra Gold that's shared can make the difference, enabling a Hero to use a vital Resource Card! Lastly, as a lord of the city, Eivor can more quickly level up due to lower Food costs requirements, which will make him an even more valuable asset in the siege!

With his Cook Extraordinaire Special Ability, Donatto gains an extra Food everytime he visits the Barn in the Citadel, and this extra Food may be given to another Hero of his choice. Having the famous chef on the team will ease the pressure to get Food each Season for the entire team.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: B-Sieged: Sons of the Abyss – Promo Heroes: Dahlia the Peasant, Viggo the Captain, and Astrid the Princess
description:
Originally these heroes were only available during the B-seiged: Sons of the Abyss Kickstarter campaign. For the 2018 CMON Expo 3 pack sets were given away as promo sets in the swag bag.

This box numbered BSG-KS03 contains the promo heroes Dahlia, Viggo, and Astrid.

BSG-KS03 promo introduces three brand-new Heroes to defend the Citadel of Modhelm: Viggo, the captain; Dahlia, the peasant; Astrid, the princess.

Viggo, the Captain is a powerhouse! With his Base Strength 2, he has enough damage to kill Elite Krohns, Elite Gargohs, and Orcs right from the beginning. But more importantly, his starting Special Ability Legendary Vigor allows him to ignore up to 2 hits per round, in true tank format! It makes Viggo ideal to soak up damage where it's needed the most: be it while protecting a vital building or battling Assault Units in a side of the wall that's swarmed with enemies!

Growing up in a farm gave Dahlia, the Peasant not only a deal of hardships to overcome, but also a solid dedication to work and a strong will. 'Stoicism', her starting Special Ability, represents Dahlia's natural skill to overcome troubles and frees her up from the requirement of gathering food by the end of each season. That means that her actions can be better spent in other areas of the Citadel and it makes it easier for her to get new Special Abilities. Lastly, she also has a Blue Permanent Card slot, which allows her to use one piece of Weapon or Armor.

Astrid, the Princess is unique in the fact that she doesn't have a starting special ability. Instead, Astrid's Special Ability slots have lower Food requirements, enabling her to acquire new Special Abilities quickly and easily. Due to her military knowledge, Astrid has 2 Permanent Card slots, meaning she can don combinations of Weapons and Armor that will give her an edge in combat.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Getting Started With Warhammer 40,000
description:
Getting Started With Warhammer 40,000 contains the basic ruleset for playing games of Warhammer 40,000, with each phase broken down into simple explanations. There’s even a mission included to get everyone playing right away.

Everything you need to get started in the galaxy of Warhammer 40,000, this magazine is the for the absolute beginner who’d like to dip their toes in the hobby of collecting, building, painting and playing with Citadel miniatures. It explains in easy to follow terms how to get started, and even comes with a free push-fit Primaris Space Marine Intercessor miniature.

Contained in the 104-page magazine:


A history of the Warhammer 40,000 setting – the story so far, the state of the galaxy and the dramatic history that led to it;
A guide to the armies you can collect and play with in Warhammer 40,000, showing you their motivations and introducing their histories;
Guidance on collecting Citadel miniatures – while you can simply pick up any that catch your eye, for many the hobby is about specific armies or types of miniature. This guide includes three example collections for inspiration, with a further showcase of beautifully-painted miniatures from a variety of armies;
A detailed Battle Report – watch as the heroic Ultramarines take on the vile Death Guard in a tense fight to the end;
A guide to some of the most famous war zones of Warhammer 40,000, and the epic battles that took place there;
An introduction to painting Citadel miniatures using the Citadel Paint System, with a guide to paints, brushes and step-by-step instructions showing how to paint a variety of miniatures – including your free Intercessor!

name: Tanks: Churchill Tank Expansion
description:
From the package insert back:

Designed to be protected against any anti-tank gun in existence, the Churchill proved nigh on unstoppable in battle, shrugging off hits from German anti-tank guns and climbing terrain the Germans thought impassable to tanks.

This pack contains:
1x Unassembled Churchill tank
1x Churchill tank card
1x Churchill CS tank card
1x Hero card
2x Crew cards
2x Upgrade cards
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Battlefront Miniatures Ltd, Gale Force Nine, LLC

name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Killzone: Wall of Martyrs
description:
On apocalyptic war worlds and amidst savagely contested galactic strongholds, miles-long trench lines stretch to the horizon studded with bunkers, weapons batteries and redoubts. Mighty bulwarks of stone and steel loom forth from the shattered earth, resisting the onslaught of foes and providing shelter for those who know only war.

The Wall of Martyrs Killzone Environment is an expansion for Kill Team – in the packed box, you’ll find a gameboard, scenery, and exclusive rules that use the unique nature of the Wall of Martyrs terrain to introduce dangerous new missions and powerful effects to your games. Included:

- A double-sided Kill Team gameboard measuring 22” x 30”, printed on heavy, durable card stock. 1 side depicts an urban environment with a street bisecting sets of ruins, and the other an open plain pock-marked by craters;
- An 8-page booklet containing descriptions of the trenches and fortifications used across the Imperium to hold back aggressors, the manner in which kill teams use these networks of defences to their advantage, and an example of a Wall of martyrs environment built from the scenery included in the box;
- 12 Wall of Martyrs Tactics cards – these can be used by any Kill Team faction, with 7 cards providing interactions with the Wall of Martyrs scenery and 5 being used specifically by Scout, Comms, Veteran or Leader Specialists;
- A Wall of Martyrs Environment card, which provides 6 different rules allowing interaction – positive and negative – with the scenery;
- 4 Wall of Martyrs Mission cards – designed to be used in conjunction with the gameboard and scenery, this is a set of 2 Matched Play missions and 2 Narrative Play missions, which are split between attacker and defender;
- An Imperial Bunker, a set of 2 Imperial Defence Lines and an Imperial Defence Placement – these miniatures are supplied on dark grey plastic.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Gaius Acastian: Deathwatch Commander Set
description:
Even before he rose to lead a brotherhood of the Deathwatch, Acastian of the Ultramarines was known for his calculating demeanour. It is said that he can calculate the number of warriors needed for a victory with but a quick glance at the battlefield. With the resources of an entire Watch Fortress at his disposal, he has waged war in the Vigilus System, personally leading 8 missions to victory, most recently crossing swords with the Drukhari.

Add a Commander – a powerful hero character with unique abilities and rules – to your Deathwatch kill team with this set. It contains a multipart plastic Watch Master miniature, a set of cards packed with exclusive rules and a sheet of tokens for use in-game:

- A Watch Master: this multipart plastic kit represents Gaius Acastian – or the Commander of any Deathwatch Kill Team. Wielding a guardian spear and a clavis – a device which can interact positively or negatively with any machine the Watch Master turns his attention to – he wears heavy Deathwatch armour and stares impassively through an optical implant that dominates his face.
- A datacard for Gaius Acastian, featuring his characteristics, weapons, abilities and specialisms, along with a card featuring his background
- A card featuring Gaius Acastian’s skill tree – Watch Master specialisms which can only be used by that character
- 3 Librarius Discipline psychic power cards
- 6 Deathwatch Commander Tactics cards, including 2 Tactics exclusive to this set
- A sheet of tokens for use in games of Kill Team – this includes 1 Move/Charge token, 1 Fall Back/Advance token, 1 Ready/Shoot token, 6 Tactic/psychic power tokens, 3 wound tokens, and 3 objective tokens

— description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Justice League Ultimate Battle Cards
description: Gather together, the team of super Heroes or super villains the most powerful, go to defeat all your opponents. Your action cards will improve your attacks, defend you, recover your health, eliminate opponents, steal energies. But beware of event cards that can change the course of the game. There is a competitive game mode and a team game mode. The last team in play wins the game.

name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Cthugrosh
description: A truly alien and inexplicable godlike creature from a dimension beyond human ken, Cthugrosh was summoned to Earth by the depraved sacrifices of his occult worshipers, all of whom were slain upon his arrival. Heralded as a bringer of apocalypse, Cthugrosh is one of the greatest Lords of Cthul, an entity that draws power from carnage and whose gluttony for life’s energy seems inexhaustible. Alien as his mind is, it is also immensely powerful, capable of tremendous feats of telekinesis and unleashing mind-rending surges of pure energy.

name: Promenade: Curator Expansion
description:
The Curator Expansion is a set of six cards that can be used to modify exhibition invitations. During setup, randomly place two curators face-up at the top of the museum and remove the rest from the game. To use the curator during show action, place a meeple on the card and activate its ability. There are three meeple spaces per card (each card can be used three times during the game), and players can use the same curator more than once. Meeples cannot be retrieved during the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game

name: Winterborne: Loyalty Promo Pack
description: The Winterborne Loyalty Promo Pack is composed of one Banner set of three cards and one Wyld card. These items are introduced into the game as per the normal rules.
categories: City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: Star Sprint
description:
Star Sprint is a cooperative dice game inspired by classic dungeon crawlers but pared down to be played in under 20 minutes. Players will roll dice, explore tiles, collect treasure and fight enemies.

The game comes with a deck of 35 cards, players will shuffle the deck then place all cards face down, forming 5 rows with 7 cards each. Players start on the spacecraft card. Your objective is to collect the six star rings and return to the spacecraft.

The first player will roll three action dice. These dice can be spent to move or attack. Flip over each card when moving to reveal any star rings or enemy encounter cards. If an encounter card is revealed, players end their movement on this card and must place the appropriate number of enemies. Roll enemy dice and place them on the furthest card in the direction of the arrows. The value rolled is the enemies health. Players can continue using any unspent action dice to move and attack as normal. At the end of either players turn, all enemy dice will move one card closer to the active player, if any enemy dice are adjacent to the player they will attack for one damage each, spin down the player die to track health. If either player’s health is reduced to zero, game over.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Twilight of the Soldier Kings: Wargame Rules for the Battles in the Age of Frederick the Great 1730-1780
description:
The Twilight of the Soldier Kings rules is a set designed to fight large historical battles on a reasonable sized table and with a reasonable number of figures in the era of Fredereick the Great (1730 to 1770). The player is the army commander seeking to marshal the full forces that their historical counterpart had to achieve victory and not some colonel or brigadier controlling a few battalions or squadrons in the fight for some sector of a battlefield. The concentration is on the 'big picture' rather on relatively unimportant details. The rules reward historic tactics and practices while making typical 'gamer' tactics obsolete. So, players will want their forces to be in at least two lines with a reserve and not strung out in a line as is commonly done in other rules.

The system is intuitive and easy to pick up. The units are around 2,500 infantry, around 1,200 cavalry and 12 to 20 guns and so the units are often a brigade of around 4 infantry battalions or 8 to 12 cavalry squadrons. The scale is flexible with all distances, ranges, movements based on half of the frontage of the units you use. For example, if your units have a frontage of perhaps 100mm (4 inches) the standard measurement unit in the game will be 50mm (2 inches). There is no figure removal so you can base you units as you wish, with any number or size of figures on a base, etc. As long as the units are the same frontage it does not matter and indeed neither does it if the armies involved are based differently.

While any unit size can be used if the frontage of a unit is in the region of 120mm then most battles can be fought on a table 1.8m by 1.2m (6 feet by 4 feet) or similar. Most standard battles should be playable in a typical afternoon or evening playing session. It is possible to play 'Manoeuvre' battles in which the attacker has extra options to attack but will usually require a larger table. In a standard battle the armies are on table in their half of the table and generally facing up to each other. While in a manoeuvre battle the defending army is in active and placed in the centre of the table with a wide area empty of troops around them. The attacking army can then attempt to march around the defending army to attack from one or more different directions. Alternatively the attacking army can arrive on table in sections from all edges of the table in a converging attack. Of course these manoeuvres might not work or can be delayed or the inactive defenders can activate and react to the situation.

The rules include scenarios for the battles of Mollwitz (1741), Kolin (1757), Krefeld (1758) and a generic Manoeuvre battle based on the battles of Hochkirch and Zorndorf (both 1758).

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Phantom Division
description:
Phantom Division is a fully co-operative tactical dexterity game set in a sci-fi world of impending danger. The game features the adventures of members of the elite Phantom Division defense force united to protect a remote colony world against an implacable enemy. The game supports solo play and features neoprene playmats for smooth flicking.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Flicking, Grid Movement

name: Gierki Małżeńskie: Kalambury
description:
Gierki Małżeńskie: Kalambury (Marriage Games: Charades) is a charades tournament for couples. In 2-4 pairs variant, couples compete with each other. There is also a one couple variant in which partners compete against each other.

There are four types of challenges (described on cards): draw, show, describe using only words starting with "p", draw something whose name begins with a given letter.

Gierki Małżeńskie: Kalambury is one of the Gierki Małżeńskie ("Marriage Games") series. It is a stand-alone game, but the cards can also be used in the base Gierki Małżeńskie game.

—user summary

name: First Martians: New Upgrades
description:
Let’s escape this planet for a moment, shall we? And once you’re on Mars, why not make sure your buildings are perfectly adapted for whatever future might bring? To make it easier we’re publishing new alternative building upgrades for you to use when playing First Martians. Print them out, and at the start of the game throw a coin for each building separately to decide which card (the one from the base game or the printed one) will be used during your game. Good luck!

This print at home mini expansion includes seven new upgrade cards and seven upgrade tiles.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Claim Kingdoms: Royal Edition
description:
You rule over a small region in a deserted corner of the kingdom. It is time to change that and expand your influence. You travel across the land and try to convince the different factions to join your side. Play the game of domination wisely, win enough factions for your course and you will soon rule over the kingdom!

Claim Kingdoms Royal Edition is an updated extended version with over 30 unique factions. The game gets even more challenging with the War Maps having special action fields which have new abilities. Will the Farm work in your favour or are you gonna lose points? Especially at the ruins, you don’t know which treasure you will find.
Claim Kingdoms Royal Edition has an easy setup: Choose your factions, put the number of war maps equal to the number of players on the table and the battle of power can begin! What is your strategy to win over the different factions?

—description from the publisher

name: Saddam Moves South
description:
Saddam Moves South (SMS) is an operational level two player wargame covering a hypothetical Iraqi invasion of Saudi Arabia in 1990. The assumption here is that after the Iraqi army overran Kuwait in the first week of August 1990, Saddam Hussein continued the offensive to grab the vital oilfields of Saudi Arabia. In response, the United States leads a coalition of states to stop the Iraqis and then retake lost territories.

The game system is based on that of Desert One War, which models ground, air and amphibious operations. For the Coalition, the central game system is Air Transport Points (ATP) which represent strategic airlift capability. The assumption is that the scenarios cover the opening stage of an intervention, before the US can mobilize full-scale sealift. Therefore, airlift will become the primary means for moving units into the theater and providing logistical support.

The Iraqis are closer to their lines of communications, but their ability to conduct sustained offensives is restricted by planning and logistical considerations, modeled in the game by making the capture of certain objectives a prerequisite for sustaining their offensive. Another factor is that the decisive mobile campaign which the Coalition conducted in 1991 was in part the result of extensive preparation of the theater of operations via logistical buildup, intelligence and in-theater training during the period August 1990 to January 1991. The campaign in the game models the situation where the Coalition must build up in the face of a continuing Iraqi offensive.

Published in Strategy & Tactics magazine #339 Mar-Apr 2023

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 3-10 days
Hex: 21.75 miles / 35 kilometers
Units: Group to Division

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" full color map
One dual-side printed countersheet (228 9/16" counters - with 4 blank counters included)
One 16-page rulebook

Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-15 hours

Note: Players will need to provide one 6-sided die for game play.

name: Gloomhaven: Twilight of the Lost Cabal (Promo Scenario)
description:
This is a digital, single-scenario promo item for Gloomhaven.

The scenario was available as part of the 2020 Secret Cabal Kickstarter campaign.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Yarrr Har Hunt
description:
Yarrr! It's time to find some treasurrrrrrre!

Yarrr Har Hunt is a co-operative family game for players of all ages to play together. You are a band of pirates working together to follow the clues and reveal the buried treasures hidden around Shell Island.

At the start of the game, treasure chest cards are placed face-down beside the board with a series of secret clue cards on top. The first clue for each chest is revealed and an X-marks-the-spot token placed on the board at each clue's location.

On their turn, players draw a shell from a bag to determine how many spaces they can move. If a player lands on space marked with an X token, they collect that clue card. The next clue card in the hunt is revealed and the X token moved to the new clue's location. If a player collects the last clue in a hunt, they uncover the treasure chest and reveal the treasure inside. Players can also choose to give their movement shell to another player who may be closer to a clue or treasure.

If a player draws a ship shell, the pirate ship moves one space closer to shore. When it reaches the island, it's time to go- The hunt is over and any unfound treasure is lost.

Yarrr Har Hunt is designed to allow very young players with limited game experience to play side-by-side with older kids and adults. The surest path to success is for all players to share turns and work together to divide the finding of clues and treasure. A typical game lasts 15 minutes.

—description from the designer

It’s a treasure hunt race: players help Captain Casey and her crew discover the Shell Island Treasure by uncovering clues. But be quick: the ship will soon be back to end the hunt! Players work together and problem solve to figure out where the treasure is hidden. This cooperative game has all players working together to win!


Uncover clues together to discover the Shell Island Treasure!
Kids learn communication, simple strategy, cooperation and shared-decision making.


—description from the publisher

name: Second Great War at Sea: Caspian Princes
description:
This is alternative-history naval campaign from Avalanche Press' Second Great War setting, with Imperial Russian and Ottoman Turkish flotillas waging a war that never happened on the Caspian Sea.

Caspian Princes is a complete Second World War at Sea game. You get everything you need right here in this little package (or in the attached download) including the complete Second Edition rules and charts for Second World War at Sea. There are 30 die-cut and silky-smooth playing pieces (10 “long” ship pieces and 20 standard-sized square ones) and a small (8.5x11-inch) map of the Caspian Sea. Plus scenarios and story.

name: Helionox: Catastrophic Events Pack
description:
10 cards to use in your copy of Helionox to make it more difficult. These were a Kickstarter promo Item referenced in the rules.

Contents:
2 Transhuman Colony Revolt (Martian)
2 The Last War (Old World)
2 Thanatos 273 (Ceres)
2 The Siege on Imbrium Citadel (Lunar)
2 Collapse of the Chitrani Rift (Europan)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Zurvivors Cooperação
description: Zurvivors Cooperação is a 2 player game that brings a cooperative mode to the universe of Zurvivors for the first time. With great intelligence and totally silent in order not to attract the zombies, the two players must make combinations of items and actions in a coordinated way to be able to rescue evidence that incriminates the giant corporation behind the incidents, in addition to finding the abandoned motorcycle in order to escape.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: You Said You Could Draw
description:
Put your skills under a blindfold with a whole new spin on the drawing game: You Said You Could Draw! everybody knows that one person who can draw anything, this game levels the playing field.

HOW TO PLAY
IT”S SIMPLE AS 1-2-3-4
1. ROLL - The artist takes the big drawing board and blindfold and takes the first card, rolls the dice to see what word he secretly has to draw.
2. DRAW - Once the artists feels he is ready, he reveals the drawing to everyone. Based on what level you are playing, clues are given if applicable. You can’t use numbers, symbols or letters in your drawings. If there are questions in the group about answers take a vote.

3. GUESS - Once the artists feels he is ready, he secretly writes a player’s name, who he feels will guess correctly for a bonus. The artist then reveals the drawing to everyone. Based on what level you are playing, clues are given if applicable. The other players secretly write on their boards what the artist drew. After everyone has made their guess, one by one, everyone reveals their guess and the artist reveals the answer. The artists then reveals his guess on the player who guessed correctly. Points are awarded on the main board accordingly.

4. SCORE
1 Point-For the artist if at least one player guesses correctly.
1 Point-Bonus For the artist if secretly selects the player who guesses correctly.
1 Point-For all players who guess the correct answer.
3 Points(The star mark word)-The artist and all players who guess correctly
2 Points-If all players guess correctly except for one player, that player subtracts 2 points from their score.

The objective of the game is be the person to score 20 points.

-description from designer

name: B-17 Flying Fortress Leader: Expansion #1
description:
B-17 Leader Expansion #1 is an expansion for the B-17 Flying Fortress Leader solitaire game. This expansion adds new gameplay to the original core set with new campaigns and aircraft groups to play, new alternate targets to attack, and new airfield cards to fly from!

New components include New Campaigns (Eastern Front Campaign, USAAF War Campaign); New Aircraft (4 New Fighter groups, 2 New Bomber groups); New Strafing Targets; Airfield Cards; Updated Fighter Groups; VP/SO Tracker; and a counter sheet.
