In the original print run, a d10 die (Kickstarter stretch goal) with the aircraft silhouette in the "10" place was included.

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Open Drafting, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Kinmen 1949: The Battle that Saved Taiwan
description:
This game is a two-player game with the theme of the landing operation on Kinmen Island by the People's Republic of China (PRC) army on October 25, 1949. One player is in charge of the PRC army and the other player is in charge of the Republic of China (Taiwan) army.

In historical fact, although the PRC army, which had gained momentum in the previous victories, landed, the lack of preparation and training for the landing operation was remarkable, and only about 9,000 people were able to actually land on Kinmen Island. On the other hand, the Taiwanese army expected the PRC army to land on Kinmen Island, and was waiting for the PRC army with 40,000 troops, including reinforcements from the 18th Army (however, most of the 18th Army arrived after the battle was over). Also, for the PRC army, which had no anti-tank equipment, the M5A1 light tanks of the Taiwanese army were a threat.

In this way, looking back on history, it was an inevitable landing operation, but it is not without the element of "what-if". If the PRC army had more boats ready for landing, if command and control were good, if they chose a different coast for the second landing... In this game, by introducing such "what-if" into the game, the PRC army is also given the possibility of winning.

Issue game of "Banzai Magazine EX" #3.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control
publishers: Bonsai Games, Kuro Neko Design Workshop

name: Chamber of Wonders: Clockwork Freaks
description:
A 12-cards expansion for Chamber of Wonders.

Chamber of Wonders: Clockwork Freaks introduces a set of twelve new clockwork wonder cards to be included in the main deck of the game.

These wonderful mechanical artifacts are used exactly like any other wonder in the game, yet they came to life when they are displayed in your Chamber of Wonders, allowing players to immediately copy the action of one of the available Contacts in play.

This set can be used with any number of players and it is integrable with any of the other Chamber of Wonders expansions.

—description from the designer

name: TBH: NSFW Expansion
description:
168 unique adult-themed dilemma cards for use with TBH: The Game of Honest Answers to Outrageous Questions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Arcana of Love: Spicy Deck
description:
The Spicy Deck is best for those looking for intense experiences, helping you fulfill fantasies related to possessive domination and arousing submission, also by using sensual gadgets. This game fires up hidden passions and desires.

This deck is ideal for those who wish to feel in total control, empowered or dominated, and who wish to fulfill more specific and refined fantasies.

The deck contains 55 cards with various tasks, challenges and undressing cards, which may be freely mixed with the Passionate and Spicy decks. Each card is embellished with fine erotic photography and inspirational quotes.

The game ends when one of the players (the game was designed for an unlimited number of players, but of course it will be played mostly by couples) is naked and an "arcana" card is played. That player loses the game.

NOTE: It's a reimplementation of Arkana Miłości: Dominacja. Not only the graphics changed, but also a lot of cards were added/removed/changed.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Interrupts, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game
publishers: Let's Play, Rebel Sp. z o.o., StarHouse Games

name: Critical Care: The Game
description:
Critical Care: The Game lets you bring all of the intensity and teamwork of the ICU to life on your kitchen table. Designed by an ICU doctor, the Critical Care is based in real medicine but accessible for a broad audience.

Featuring:

Cooperative gameplay for 1-4 players taking on the role of ICU doctors; discharge all of your patients to win, but beware the threat of a Code Blue that can end the game for everyone!
No medical knowledge required- but each of over 250 unique cards has a plain-English description of real ICU medicine
Select from 8 unique patients and 25 ICU Diagnoses such as Sepsis; patients are at risk for 50 unique Complications, allowing for endless replay value as the game builds on these combinations
Heal patients and recover with over 100 unique Therapy cards, everything from potent medications to invasive procedures
Bring in additional expertise with over 20 unique Specialists like the Cardiologist or Pharmacist to turn the tide in your favor
Watch out - your pager goes off every turn. A 2am consult from the Emergency Room can throw off your best plans!


Gameplay
Each day in the ICU, the game's engine tries to add Injury and Crisis tokens to patients and players race to remove these tokens. Each patient can sustain Injury to five different systems: brain, heart, lung, blood, and inflammation. In addition, each patient has a Crisis track representing the intangibles of being sick in the hospital: how much the patient is suffering and how close they are to death. As Crisis tokens accumulate, patients are more likely to develop complications. If all available slots for injury tokens or the Crisis Track are filled, the patient undergoes a Code Blue and the team has a chance to work together to save the patient or else the game is lost.

The game is played over a week: seven Days in the ICU. Each Day is broken up into several phases. First, Rounding and Complications happen simultaneously for all players; during Rounding, any cards already on the patient take effect, adding or removing Injury and Crisis. Then, Complications are drawn for each patient; the injury they have already sustained determines what Complications they get, just like in real life! After Rounding and Complications, players take individual turns called Shifts. During each Shift, a player draws and resolves a Pager card and then draws up to 7 Therapy cards and plays up to 12 hours of Therapies. Pager cards represent real life in the hospital, such as when nursing is short-staffed or the CT scanner breaks down. Therapy cards have beneficial effects for patients, often removing Injury or Crisis tokens. Many instantly remove Injury/Crisis; tokens removed this way are added to your experience pool, which may be used for a variety of purposes including bringing in consulting Specialists in the next phase. In the Specialist Phase, players pool experience tokens to consult Specialists and bring them into the ICU. Specialists have active and passive abilities to bend the rules in your favor; for example, the Surgeon prevents complications from invasive procedures. After the Specialist phase, the Day counter is advanced and the phases repeat, starting with Rounding, until either all patients are cured & discharged from the ICU (win), patients survive until the end of Day Seven (win), or any patient dies (lose).

Critical Care is brought to you by a diverse team of doctors, board game designers, experts in patient language & graphic design, artists, and writers as well as a phenomenal team of sensitivity reviewers who bring in an additional focus on health equity and the patient & family experience of the intensive care unit. We hope Critical Care gives you an immersive experience of the ICU that is fun and authentic but never disrespectful.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Solomids
description:
A solitaire game of stacking, sliding & swapping Looney Labs pyramids to match up monochrome trees. Create all 15 trees to win!

‘So you’re ready to fly in my forces?’ the Emperor said, sliding a scrambled Solomids setup across the table. ’First you must prove your pyramidian prowess. Win without swapping and you shall command an entire cavalry! A one-swap victory, and you’ll captain your own ship; swap two and it’s off to cadet school for you! But lose…‘

Using a flat playing surface, and a Looney Labs pyramid set comprised of 9 pyramids (3 smalls, 3 mediums, & 3 large) each of 5 different colors, totaling 45 pieces; win the game by assembling one small-medium-large stack of the same color (called a tree or tree-trio) at a time, attempting to form three complete ‘rainbow stashes’ (five tree-trios, one of every color).
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Relative Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Factory Funner: Precision Reservoirs
description: Deal these reservoirs, instead of those from the base game, equal, or handicap skilled players.

name: Likes
description:
Likes is a party game in which we will discover the tastes of others.

Do you think you know the people around you? Are you one of those people who see other people at first? Put it to the test!

In the Likes card game you will be able to see first-hand that people are never known as well as we like to believe. Try to guess the tastes and hobbies of other people through the images on the cards. At first everything will depend on your intuition, but little by little all people will become an open book for you. Of course the feeling will be reciprocal.

Likes is fun while we get to know each other!

name: Kitten Box
description:
Roll and organize the scattered boxes faster than anyone else so the kitten can go in, then you'll earn the title as "the best personal cat servant!"

Kitten Box is a puzzle game for 1 to 6 player which requires players their spatial perception and sequential thinking to solve the problem.

First, you open a challenge card and place two boxes and the kitten figure on their starting position. Then, everyone rushes to find the way to organize two boxes in one (by rolling the smaller one into the bigger one) and then bring them in front of the kitten. (So, the kitten may jump in and make itself cozy!)

Players CANNOT physically touch the boxes when they do this, but they may use their personal drawing board to mark their plan how they will roll the boxes.

Once it's done, players will take turn proving their solution from who claimed the shortest way. Whoever gets it right, takes the challenge card. When a player collects certain number of cards depend on the number of player, wins the game.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Line Drawing, Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Tome: The Light Edition – The Gold Codex
description: Upgrade your Tome collection with 3 new Elements. Includes 6 Basic Wood spells, 6 Basic Insect spells, and 6 Special Gold Spells.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Nightmare Cathedral: Nightmare Cat
description:
GameFound Exclusive add on nightmare for Nightmare Cathedral.

Nightmare Cat adds a 9th nightmare to be mixed and matched with the 8 from the base game. Originally free to those who followed the campaign before launch, this was later an add on option for the campaign and not to be available in the very limited retail release that Nightmare Cathedral will see.

name: Sherlock Piratas: Pasados por agua
description:
In each Q case, you try to solve a mystery case with 32 clues, with players revealing one clue at a time until all cards have been revealed or discarded.

Choose a card from your hand and place it on the table, so all players can read or see the entire information.
We recomend you read out loud all shared info when you place it on the table. If you play a clue that happens to be irrelevant
to the case, you lose points at the end of the game, but be careful! Some clues are vital to resolve the case.

You can share and expose your theories at any moment and talk about the cards you have in your hand but you cannot show them to the other players and you may only read out loud the words written in bold or the text framed inside an image:

At the end of the game, when all clue cards have been revealed or discarded, you must check carefully all the available information and prepare a theory of what happened, working all together. Then, open the questionnaire and answer all questions. During this phase of the game, you can speak freely about your discarded cards, or the information you remember of them. Each right answer will add two points.

—user summary

After finding Greybeard's legendary treasure, The Nocturne and his crew sink somewhere in the Salt Isles. Captain Hooktip gives the order to abandon ship. What has caused the sinking? Where is the treasure?

—description from the back of the box (translated)

Tras encontrar el legendario tesoro de Barbagrís, El Nocturno y su tripulación se hunden en algún lugar de Las Islas Saladas. La capitana Puntadegarfio da orden de abandonar el barco. ¿Qué ha provocado el hundimiento?, ¿dónde está el tesoro?

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory

name: Happy Little Dinosaurs: Caught Cosplaying Promo Card
description:
TeeTurle/Unstable Games convention promo card

Name: Caught Cosplaying
Card type: Emotional Disaster
Text: You stop to grab a coffee on your way to the convention. No one understands your elaborate costume.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Number, Party Game, Prehistoric
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Catch That Mouse
description:
The goal of Catch That Mouse is simple: be the first to lose all your cards. But to do that, you'll have to be fast and sharp-eyed.

You take turns flipping a card and putting it on the central pile. As soon as a Mouse card appears after a Cheese card, you will all try to catch the mouse. The player to last slap, takes the pile.

An easy to learn, yet very entertaining game. The presence of decoys (objects that look just like cheeses and animals that look like mice) makes it easy to make mistakes.

—description from publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game

name: 56k Samurai
description:
You’re a 56k Samurai, a Console Cowboy, a Digital Hired Gun in the data wars. Your employer needs you to run a sabotage mission: break into Oni Corp. servers and install a virus. Are you savvy enough to do the job and get paid or will your location get traced and your door kicked in by corporate security?

---

56k samurai is a solo game Print and Play card game which lasts between 10 to 20 minutes per game. During the game, the player will manipulate their console, a set of 6 cards laid side by side. The player manipulates cards by executing their commands attempting to rotate all 18 cards to their cracked state to win. Each card will have a command at the top. To execute a card, slide it up slightly to indicate it’s been executed. Then perform the command. Each of these commands must be executed to move on but the order they’re executed in makes all the difference.

All even numbered cards have alarms on them which will alert security personnel to your intrusion. Too many alarms at a time and you’ll be traced. Then it’s game over, man. Game over.

-description from designer
mechanics: Chaining, Multi-Use Cards, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Heroes of Normandie: Big Red One Edition – Errata
description:
With this Errata pack you will be able to update the content of all V2 products related to the Heroes of Normandie – Big Red One Edition Kickstarter.


The update sheet clears up a few rule points.



The punchboard corrects a few counters (7) and brings the American army an M16 MGMC, an M8 Scott, and a Heroic Pin up. The German army also gets a heroic Pin up with this corrective punchboard.



The corrective sticker sheets will allow you to update your booklets (Core Box BRO rules booklet & scenario booklet + Battlepack#1 Bloody Omaha booklet + Solo mode rules & scenarios booklet). Indeed, with these stickers, there is no need to reprint the latest version of the rules at home. We avoid waste and improve our products so that you get the best gaming experience. Our game books have so many elements, rules, and other things to consider that even with two fantastic proofreading teams, one for each language (3×2 people), a few mistakes still slip through.


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Dragon Castle: New Challenges
description:
The Dragon Castle is shrouded in dark legends. Do you dare to venture into its heart as a powerful magus, a fierce woman warrior, or an elusive female thief? Upgrade your character, fight monsters and overcome the pitfalls lurking at every step. Only the mightiest hero has a chance to defeat the dragon himself and get the most valuable treasure!

Dragon Castle: New Challenges is improved over Dragon Castle not only by the design, but also in the rules, which have made it a much better and more balanced game. Above all, there is another dueling system (which almost eliminates the element of chance). The game as opposed to the original version offers extensive character development.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Maze, Mythology
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Betwixt and Between: The Faery Queen's Whim
description:
The Faery Queen's Whim is the final expansion for Betwixt and Between that introduces thematic Whim Cards with different events and requests for every round of the game. The expansion also comes with 7 unique familiars that may accompany your Mystic on their adventure. Join path with a cunning crow, a loyal dog, a quick hare, an adventurous cat, a spiky hedgehog, a sneaky fox, or a loyal horse!

—description from the publisher

name: Имаджинариум: Одиссея (Imaginarium: Odyssey)
description: Одиссея ("Odyssey") is even more recognizable images in a new interpretation: superheroes, monsters, Papa Carlo and even Lenin. A real challenge for those who think outside the box and see the new in the familiar!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Ninja Sloths: Sorcerer's Expansion Pack
description: Originally intended to be an expansion for Ninja Sloths allowing 2 extra players, the Sorcerer's Expansion pack was upgraded to a fully playable base game that can be integrated with the original Ninja Sloths base game. This expanded stand-alone expansion includes the Backer's Choice expansion Action Card, and numerous backer suggested cards.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: San Marino 1944
description:
When the next Allied offensive began on September 12, its goal was Rimini and San Marino. The Germans knew perfectly well that the loss of Rimini would cause the Allies to exit the Po River Valley and so they had to do everything to slow down and stop this attack on the coast. But the Allies also attacked in the direction of San Marino – straight across the hills. They also used ar­mo­red divisions, which were expected rather on the coastal plains.

—description from the publisher

The game simulates the military actions that took place on the Italian Peninsula in the area of San Marino in Autumn, 1944.

Units represent: regiments, battalions, and brigades.

The game uses the WB-95 system by Taktyka i Strategia.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Zone of Control

name: Trick Dumpling
description:
Welcome to the kitchen of the dumpling masters, Trick Dumpling! Keeping in mind the motto "Quantity over Quality", fill your little steamer with as many dumplings as possible. Wait, that coworker next to you looks like a slacker? Well, they're rumored to be the owner's nephew, so you'd better not bother them. Well, unless they're the spy next door.

Trick Dumpling differs from the usual trick-taking game in that the highest numbered cards are discarded when the total of the numbers in each suit exceeds a certain number. The reason for this is that the steamer is very small and can only hold up to 10 dumplings, as the restaurant has saved on capital expenditure.

(maximum) 10 dumplings per dish!
Compete with other cooks to complete the perfect dish of dumplings by reading the dynamically changing strength of the cards. But don't forget to check your secret identity. If you're the owner's nephew, or a spy snuck in from the shop next door, you won't have to work so hard on your dumplings, will you?

—description from the publisher

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Deathgorge – Daggok's Stab Ladz
description:
Daggok Finksteala is on a murderous mission to decapitate the brightest and best fighters within the Deathgorge. With each head he takes, his kunnin' increases – or so he believes – and he means to gather enough smarts to make him a Killaboss. His warband, da Stab-Ladz, shares his vision and assists him in his underhanded ambushes with their savagery and kunnin'.

Daggok's Stab-Ladz is an aggressive warband that rewards players who use their kunnin’ to complete special Scheme gambits with extra Glory points. Hurrk da Howla is Daggok's herald and bears a horn called the Roar of Kragnos after the terrifying noise it makes when sounded. Grakk da Hook uses his bita-flail to yank enemies off-balance, and Jagz da Bleeda – a sadist feared even by other Kruelboyz – explodes into violence when a weakness is exposed. This set includes a full Rivals deck to use straight out of the box, and the models are all push-fit – so you can get playing in no time.
This set includes:
- 4x push-fit Daggok's Stab-Ladz miniatures – no glue required to assemble, cast in green plastic
- 4x double-sided fighter cards, one for each member of the warband – Daggok Finksteala, Hurkk da Howla, Jagz da Bleeda, and Grakk da Hook
- 1x Daggok's Stab-Ladz background and plot card, with additional rules for using Daggok's Stab-Ladz

Plus, a 32-card Rivals deck consisting of:
- 10x Daggok's Stab-Ladz upgrade cards
- 10x Daggok's Stab-Ladz gambit ploy cards
- 12x Daggok's Stab-Ladz objective cards

These push-fit miniatures can be assembled without glue and are supplied unpainted
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Magic: The Gathering – Outlaws of Thunder Junction
description:
Saddle up for MTG Outlaws of Thunder Junction, the thrilling Wild West showdown you've been waiting for. This Magic set unleashes a stampede of notorious villains from across the Multiverse, converging on this dusty frontier plane for riches untold. Join forces with the cunning outlaw Oko and his gang as they execute a heist that could shake the foundations of the entire Multiverse.

Rumour has it an ancient vault lies hidden in Thunder Junction, overflowing with treasures ripe for the taking. But every outlaw worth their salt wants in on the action, including Oko's estranged son, Kellan. Buckle up for family feuds, double-crossings, and a thrilling Outlaws vs. Outlaws showdown to decide who will claim the ultimate prize.

Outlaws of Thunder Junction delivers a whole new bag of tricks for seasoned Magic players and newcomers alike. Wrangle trusty Mounts for daring escapes, and unleash the full potential of the Plot mechanic to turn the tides in your favour. Draft decks overflowing with desperados, magical artefacts, and maybe even a card or two that will literally let you get away with murder.

Whether you're a hardened veteran or a greenhorn just getting your spurs, Outlaws of Thunder Junction welcomes you to the wildest, most unpredictable ride in the Multiverse. So, what are you waiting for? It's time to break the law, gamble for glory, and make your mark on the history of Magic: The Gathering!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Player Elimination

name: HUANG: The Royal Palace
description:
After the unification, the royal palace of the state of Qin became the palace of the first emperor Qin Shi Huang. The palace was a magnificent building, and it can be added to the game using the following rules:

The royal palace can be established on 4 yellow Governor tiles if these form the corresponding shape. The same rules apply for the royal palace as for pagodas, including the '2 green Trader tiles' and 'Peasants’ Riot' rules.

The royal palace does not provide victory points. Instead, if at the end of your turn you control the yellow Governor leader in a state with the royal palace, draw up to 7 tiles behind your screen.

name: Poland 1939
description:
From Panzerfaust Publications in 1971 originally published in Panzerfaust Magazine #49 in October 1971,the game Poland 1939 designed by Ted Buyniski.

These early issues of Panzerfaust were mimeographed and all the components were printed in the magazine, more of a game kit - you had to photocopy the components to actually play it because maps and counters were printed on the reverse side of the pages of rules.

The components are:
3-pages of rules.
The color map is on 8 - 8.5" X 11" sheets of ivory paper. The counters are on two of the map sheets in red for the Germans and the all to familiar purple for the Poles.

name: Fleet Commander: Nimitz – Yamamoto
description:
The expansion features the "Yamamoto" AI cards, giving Japan an enhanced AI to give its forces a whole new level of decision-making.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Mitsuhama
description:
Mitsuhama, a.k.a. 三津浜, is a game of buying and selling fish based upon the traditions in the port city of Mitsuhama. In the game, players are buying fish at auction, storing them in their warehouses, and then selling them to local restaurants.

On each turn, one player rolls four dice, corresponding to the four types of fish in the game, and places some or all of these up for auction. In real-time, the other players bid an amount of money they would pay for these fish. The auctioneer can choose to accept the highest bid or pay that bid themselves. Money from the auction is paid to either the auctioneer or the highest bidder, and can be paid by fixed value money cards, bartered with fish, or both. If the money card(s) paid from one player to another player are larger than the bid, no change is provided.

In each game, five restaurants are available for selling fish to. These are double sided and chosen randomly each game. Any players who gained fish from an auction in a turn are able to sell fish to the restaurants. Each player has a number of "employee cubes" used to track the amount of each type of fish in their warehouses, and when selling to a restaurant, one of these employees is removed from the warehouse and used to mark the income the player will receive from the restaurant at the end of the game.

The game will end when a predetermined number of employee cubes have been placed on a restaurant. The player with the most money wins, and this is a combination of the money cards in hand, fish remaining in warehouses, and income received from the restaurants.

The designer's family lives in Matsuyama, a city with some ports including Mitsuhama, and the painting on the cover of the box is one of the port made by his grandfather.

name: Star Fleet Marines: Module II – Last Stand
description:
The next STAR FLEET MARINES module is LAST STAND, portraying desperate battles by isolated units on faraway planets, fighting without hope that rescue can arrive in time.

New scenarios include: Last Stand on Fang Hill, the Siege of Nucklow, the Siege of Phen Dien Du, Dragons’ Den, Tank Battle in the Zasu Pits, and more.

New units include: outposts, heavy transport shuttles (able to land tanks and other armored vehicles on enemy planets), ground weapon vehicles, and ground bombardment shuttles.

New rules include external passengers and new terrain (depressions, cliffs, mountains).

New counters include: Hydran light infantry and heavy armor, Romulan tanks, and more.

24 pages, 280 die-cut counters
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: Young Jacob Marley
description:
Young Jacob Marley is a game of Victorian moneylending. You and your fellow clerks are newly enlisted in the service of the famous Jacob Marley. Your task is to earn the maximum profit by lending Marley's money to the citizens and businesses of London. You hope that by doing so, you might catch young Marley's eye and earn his undying friendship. You have a feeling this might come in handy one day...

Young Jacob Marley is a significant retooling of the classic game Jacob Marley, Esquire, which is also a game of cutthroat money lending in Victorian London. Imagine that.

name: Tawantinsuyu: The Inca Empire – Tantrum House Promo Tiles
description:
2 promotional tiles that were obtainable through the "Tantrum House Board Game Media: Season 7" Kickstarter campaign.

Adds 1 Passive Building and 1 Production Building to the game.

Passive Building
Tile ID: Z21
Cost: 1 corn, 1 stone
Effect: When you place a Priest, you may convert a potato to a gold.

Production Building
Tile ID: P21
Cost: 2 corn, 1 stone
Effect: 1 gold, 1 corn, 1 stone
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Building, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Mediterranean Fury
description:
The Battle of Cape Matapan

From MDG:
"Mediterranean Fury is a simulation of the three battle between the Royal Navy and the Italian Regia Marina south of the shores of Crete.

The 11 x 17" map covers the eastern Mediterranean Sea at 20 nautical miles per hex. The 230 counters show individual ships and air squadrons."
publishers: High Flying Dice Games, Microgame Design Group

name: Волк идёт! (The Wolf is Coming!)
description:
Волк идёт! ("The Wolf is Coming!") is a family board game in which all players will need to team up and throw a great birthday party for their friend Wolf. The recipe for such a party is known to everyone - cakes, candles, balls, gifts... But the Wolf is already going home, and the surprise is not ready! Squirrel, Badger, Fawn and Magpie need to hurry up, because if the Wolf comes to an empty house, he will be upset that his friends have forgotten about him. So they run through the forest, looking for goods and gifts - the main thing is to get ahead of the birthday boy and be the first to be at his house with everything you need.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Dash Arena
description:
Jetpack powered handball in Space!!

Dash Arena is a two-player game in which players lead team of athletes in fast and chaotic sport of the far future. You will roll dice and move your figures with goal of scoring 5 or more points before your opponent. You score points by scoring goals (3 points) or by tackling opposing disk holder (1 point).

At the beginning of your turn, you will roll 3 dice. One die at a time, you will use those dice to move your figures. Number on die determines how many spaces figure must move. Figures move in a straight line, except if something makes them change their direction. After moving all of your figures, your opponent will do the same and so on.

Dash Arena has rules for basic and advanced game. Advanced game rules are just an upgrade to basic game rules. We recommend that you play a few games with basic rules only.

—description from the publisher

name: Silent Death Forces: Universal Night Watch
description:
From the back cover:

A ball of panic surged in Justin's throat as the wounded Muskellunge appeared within the Ink Cloud off the port side of his Rattler. Though his HUD wouldn't track through that black chemical soup, he opened up with his Splatterguns. No hit.

Seconds later his boards lit up as the commander's Falcon achieved an accurate scan pinpointing the exact location of the Muskellunge deep within the cloud. This time his Splatterguns did their work with grizzly efficiency, leaving the Muskellunge a mangled corpse hanging in the dark space.
Through sharing resources, technologies, and intelligence, the Twelve created a brotherhood for the defense of mankind. The Universal Night Watch was founded for the sole purpose of insuring humanity's survival against the assault of the Night Brood, horrors from beyond Terran space. There are no forces with better training or equipment, and none more willing to risk their lives for mankind's.

UNIVERSAL NIGHT WATCH includes:
• New weapons and technology for fighting the Brood
• 12 Universal Night Watch Scenarios
• 2 New Brood Ships
- Muckworm
- Vartak
• 1 escort class ship
- Falcon
• 6 new Terran fighters
- Hornet
- Praying mantis
- Equalizer
- Rattler
- Javelin
- Firebat
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Bohnenspiel
description:
Bohnenspiel (Bean Game) is an old German game for two players that belongs to the Mancala family of pit and seeds games.

As for the other games in the Mancala Family, the goal of the game is to accumulate more seeds in player's storehouse than the opponent.

This is done by landing the last seed you are "sowing" in some pit bringing the total number of seeds in that pit to two, four or six. All previous pits containing two, four or six seeds are captured as well.

name: Mahjong Rummy
description:
Mahjong Rummy is a gambling game for 4 players. Each player gets 20 tiles at the start of a game. 32 tiles are left over and are unused for the rest of the game. Players try to be the first to get rid of all their tiles, and if none can achieve this, the winner is the player with the least points left in their hand. Numbered tiles score according to their face value. J, Q and K score 10. Aces score 15.

On a player's first turn, he/she must play a straight flush from his/her hand (at least three tiles of the same suit in sequence, jokers allowed). After that players can play any meld (at least three of a same number of any suit, or at least three numbers of the same suit in sequence) or add to other players' melds.

Mahjong Rummy has 112 tiles - 2 sets of 4 suits from Two to Ace (2 x 4 x 13 = 104), plus 8 jokers.

name: Paint the Roses: The Cheshire Kitten
description:
"Hello gardeners, I am a kitten - The Cheshire Kitten! I love to frolic in a variety of shrubs. Can you plant my dream garden?"

In Paint the Roses: The Cheshire Kitten the Cheshire Kitten joins the magical world of Paint the Roses looking to play in shrubs with diverse colors and shapes. In this promo, you will get be able to advance the gardeners up to six spaces forward if you can create specific lines of colors and shapes the Cheshire Kitten desires.

This was a promo released for those who were a part of the early campaign email sign-up for the Paint the Roses Kickstarter Campaign.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based, Puzzle
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Hexagon Grid, Tile Placement

name: 18Kaas
description:
The gameshop 'de Joker' in Utrecht, Netherlands, released 18kaas, an 1830 style 18xx-game in Holland (different from Rob & Paul's 1839 and different from Theo Jansma's version), available in fold-able or hardboard and mounted map style, party proof version (1830: Railways & Robber Barons components required). In 2004 another 100 copies were available.

Though this uses components of 1830 this is not an expansion, but is a separate standalone game.

name: American War of Independence Scenarios 1
description:
A selection of scenarios for British Grenadier! miniature wargame rules. Follows a format similar to the scenario books published for General de Brigade.

The scenarios included are:


White Plains (1776)
Oriskany: Twilight of the Iroquois (1777)
Brandywine: Cornwallis's Attack (1777)
Brandywine: Knyphausen's Battle (1777)
Bemis Heights (Second Saratoga) (1777)
Monmouth: Washington Saves the Day (1778)
La Vigie: France's Bunker Hill (1778)
Camden (1780)
Hannah's Cowpens (1781)
Hobkirk's Hill (1781)


Also included are rules addenda, a colour insert with wargaming flags and a revised playsheet.
48 pages + 4 page card playsheet

Expands:

British Grenadier! Gaming the Wars for America 1775-1783
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Mecanisburgo: Expansion 1 – Moon and Ceres
description:
As the war intensifies the corporations are looking beyond our planet to gather allies and resources for their plans for domination. Their most obvious targets are the Moon and Ceres, where recently found Golden Cavorita deposits of extraordinary quality have created the "Cavor Fever" in entrepreneurs and executives.

This expansion adds two planetary boards and new markers to the game. Players can now explore the Moon and Ceres by sending agents using two government spaciobuses to travel there. The Moon includes 3 locations to visit and control. Ceres includes 1 new location to control. Also agents can become Directors or Consuls for several locations which give political benefits.

The expansion also includes markers for Golden Cavorita and Victory Points that are awarded for control of several of the locations.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Battle of Kawagoe: Hojo Ujiyasu's gamble
description:
Issue game in Command Magazine Japan #104

Operational level wargame of the Kawagoe battle during the Warring States Period (戦国時代 Sengoku jidai) in Japan. The Kawagoe battle is one of the three major surprise attack in Japanese History.

Players control either Hojo clan or the Allied force of Uesugi clan and Ashikaga Shogunate. Each player manages command allocation, movement and combat. Both force has different characteristics. The Hojo clan has small but powerful trained units. They also have special activation chit for Hojo Tsunasige. He was commander of Kawagoe castle and made effective sortie. The allied force has large units many more than Hojo clan's units. Their command control was inefficient because their army was a patchwork of clans.

Winner determined by special sudden-death condition or victory point. Victory point earn by elimination of opponent units and condition of Kawagoe Castle.

name: Rundstedt's East Front
description:
Issue game in Command Magazine Japan #109

Designed by Kita-Kitsune.

This is a mini size card-driven game covering the Eastern Front of WW2 from September '41 to June '42.
The map uses point to point system from Odessa to Rostov.
This game uses improved card-driven system in which players start with the determined deck but can purchase additional card by using specific event card.

Victory is determined by VPs which can be gained via control of important cities.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: It's a Dice Game, After All!
description:
It's a Dice Game, After All! is a free (not for profit) print-and-play game inspired by the Days of Wonder game Small World. In this game, you play as one of twelve fantasy-themed tribes attempting to colonize the world by any means necessary.

The object of the game is to be the player with the most victory points after 10 turns. Points are earned by maintaining the size of your tribe, and by rolling dice to extend your civilization into new regions. Special powers and abilities may also offer the potential for bonus points.

This game has no official association with Small World, its publisher Days of Wonder, its designer Philippe Keyaerts, or its artist Miguel Coimbra. This is strictly a product of fandom for the wonderful game that these people have produced.

name: Mörderische Dinnerparty: Der Pate von Chicago
description:
Chicaco 1933: The feuding clans Linguine and Calzone meet in a back room of a speakeasy.
Their business dealings are threatened, the prohibition could be abrogated.

Furthermore, Pater Angelo was killed by a machine gun in the confessional box.
Agent Eliott Ness is on the scent.
mechanics: Acting, Deduction, Negotiation, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Baron Zachareth – Hero Expansion
description:
Defend the barony of Carthridge with the Baron Zachareth – Hero Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game! Ever since he first assumed power under suspicious circumstances, Baron Zachareth has been a divisive figure. Some call him a hero, others a warmonger, but with the ability to inspire his allies and intimidate his enemies, Zachareth will defend Terrinoth whether the victories are bought with honor or with blood.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Monster Arena
description:
Players are monster breeders at the monster breeding academy and have to pitch their creatures against each other in series of three rounds.
The game begins with a drafting phase. Each player has 3 dueling cards and 9 drafting cards. Out of those nine cards, they add three to their dueling cards and distribute the rest among the other players. The process is repeated with the cards they hold afterwards.
The players distribute the 12 cards they hold now into three stacks: 3 for the first round, 4 for the second and 5 for the third. During each round, players can choose to reveal some of their cards; for each revealed card, a point token is added to the pool (from the bank). Then players can choose to participate or withdraw. All participating players reveal their remaining cards and the highest total wins the pool (losing players add tokens to the pool).
This is repeated through rounds two and three, then cards are distributed again. The game ends after the round when someone has gained 50 points.
The strengths of the monsters are often interdependent, so holding certain combinations makes them stronger. To win, players must use these combinations cleverly.

name: Schnapp die Möpse: Ultimate Edition
description:
The Ultimate Edition of Schnapp die Möpse consists of the base game and 2 Expansions in a big box.

The UE was published during the 2020 Kickstarter campaign for the second expansion for Schnapp die Möpse.

Kickstarter Stretch Goals:

Big Paper Box (Upgrade to Ultimate Edition)
3rd Mini-Expansion (Beyond)
Active Player Marker
7 Playerboards

name: Munchkin Warhammer: Age of Sigmar – Chaos and Order
description: No conflict defines the Age of Sigmar like the battles between the forces of Chaos and Order. This expansion for Munchkin Warhammer Age of Sigmar showcases one fan-favorite army from each side of this war: the Kharadron Overlords, dwarves who mine for gold in the skies above the Mortal Realms, and the Bloodbound of Khorne, crimson-streaked warriors who fight anyone and everyone, including each other.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Taco Cat Goat Cheese Pizza: FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022
description:
Taco Cat Goat Cheese Pizza: FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 is a official licenced game for the Football World Cup.

Although the gameplay is the same as Taco Cat Goat Cheese Pizza, this version has unique actions cards (yellow card, goal and Wisthle) with unique gestures.

Taco Cat Goat Cheese Pizza is filled to the brim with hand-slapping mayhem! As in Snap and Dobble, each player places a card from their hand face up into a community pile while saying taco/cat/goat/cheese/pizza in player sequence. When the card matches the mantra — boom! — everyone slaps their hand on the deck, with the last one to slap picking up the cards. Whoever rids themselves of cards first wins!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time
publishers: Blue Orange Games, Boardgame Space, PaperGames (III)

name: Bahamas: Braquage de Haut Vol
description:
The holdup was perfect... A sound plan! Millions in a bag, fleeing by plane, yes, really, a sound one. Everyone begins to relax, but suddenly the engine sputters! Then the plane begins to fall... Yes, the holdup was perfect and they had anticipated everything — everything but enough parachutes to go around...

Play your role amongst ten characters in Bahamas and steal, lie, threaten, do everything you can to get the biggest part of the loot and land safely!

In more detail, each player receives a character sheet at random (each with a different special power), along with one starting card, one action card, and two cash cards. Among these starting cards are 2-5 parachutes (depending on the number of players), and you'll want one of these to survive at game's end! Use a number of dice equal to the player count minus one. Choose a starting player at random. This player rolls all the dice, uses one of them (drawing an action or cash card, stealing an action or cash card from an opponent, or using their special power), then they choose the next player who will take a turn. Once all the dice have been used, whoever didn't get to use a die becomes the starting player for the next round.

A "Crash" card is shuffled into the bottom four cards of the action deck, and when it's drawn, everyone without a parachute — or the lifeboat hiding in the action deck — plunges to their death. Whichever surviving character has the most money wins! Alternatively, if one player collects the three different FBI cards prior to the crash, this player manages to land the plane safely, bust everyone else, and win!

This edition includes the base game, a promo card as well as the expansion Bahamas: Trou d'air which added new playable characters, new action cards, a new turbulence module and money bags with holes.

name: Consensus Junior
description:
Consensus Junior is the third and newest addition to the award-winning Consensus collection. As the name implies, this one's for the kids.

The game follows the same, award-winning design as the other two versions. There's a large, colorful board, a deck of 200 noun cards, a deck of 75 adjective cards, a deck of voting cards (8 sets of cards, each with a unique border color, numbering 1-10) and a collection of 8 colored pawns, one for each of the sets of voting cards. The board has numbered spaces for 10 noun cards, a space for the adjective card, and a scoring track. The noun cards are drawn and placed face-up, one in each of the numbered spaces on the board. An adjective card is turned over. Players select the one noun they think most closely fits the adjective, place their vote face down on the table, and then take turns revealing their selection. The answer receiving the greatest number of votes is deemed the winning answer and the players who chose the winning answer move ahead one space. In a case where there is no clear majority, no one scores. Hence the name, Consensus.

The key to the difference between the Junior Edition and the other editions of Consensus is the content of the noun and adjective cards. Given, for example, the following randomly selected noun cards:

* Bee Hive
* Bed Bug
* My Daddy
* Nemo
* World Peace

Which would you vote for if the adjective were (also a random sample):

* Rare
* Adorable
* Unforgettable

If the adjective were "rare," which do you think is, um, rarest: your daddy, world peace, Nemo? Which the most adorable? Which the most self-evidently unforgettable?

Even as the mature person you most obviously are, you'd still have a somewhat clear and more or less patently obvious choice, regardless of which adjective was chosen. And, with an "opponent" of the unabashed certainty of an eight-year-old, you know there will be strong opinions about everything. This is what makes the Junior Edition so appealing: everyone counts, everyone in the family finds themselves personally invited, everyone has an opinion, everyone feels equally entitled, equally correct, and, with the Junior edition, pretty much equally informed. How many family games can you say that about?

name: Brewitched
description:
Sit down and grab a glass because here comes a story...

You've plundered the dungeon and come away with a solid and heavy treasure chest. After struggling to break the lock, to everyone's surprise, the chest was full of...potions! In Brewitched, you are adventurers sharing and tasting unknown potions to discover which ones are the most powerful (and valuable).

Spend your action points to smell, switch, drink, and throw away a potion or use one of the eight characters' special abilities. But be careful! Some of the potions are cursed, and this curse will be represented in real life... The results will be hilarious!

A DRINKING GAME (OR NOT)
Fun with or without drinks!
Play with younger players or designated drivers.

name: Fuse
description:
In Fuse, players alternate turns entering their discs into the board, eventually pushing other discs along the way, with the goal of creating the biggest group of their colour.

Fuse is a derivative of Feed the ducks by the same designer, that adds up to the family of other ‘push/attract games’ such as Avverso (Henrik Morast) or Momentum (Phil Leduc). It also uses the piece-entering mechanism of games like 9tka (Adam Kałuża).

EQUIPMENT

12 ‘ice’ discs, 12 black discs, board, carrying case, 2 small blue discs (king indicators).

GAMEPLAY (please refer to rulebook for detailed rules)

Players alternate turns entering one of the perimetral discs into the 6x6 inner area of the board. One or more discs may be pushed forward as a result.

The game ends when both players pass in succession. The player with the largest group of connected discs of her color wins the game.

ADVANCED GAME MODES:

Omega Scoring: The same score as in the game OMEGA (by the same designer) is applied.

Kings mode: One or two pieces per player (indicated by a blue disc on top) are worth 2 points.

-description from designer

name: Ragnarocks: Promo Pack 1
description:
Promo Pack 1 for Ragnarocks contains 2 mythology cards: “Huginn & Muninn - Odin's ravens” and “Ullr - God of hunting”.

The mythology cards represents personal player powers (like the god and hero powers in Santorini, also designed by Gord!) that fundamentally change the way the game is played.

The base game of Ragnarocks come with 32 mythology cards, and this promo expansion adds two more:

“Huginn & Muninn“: You only have two Vikings. However, each of your normadic (moveable) Vikings moves and then summons.

“Ullr”: You only have two Vikings. When your opponent moves, their selected Viking must move as far as possible (in the chosen direction).

name: Formula1cm
description:
Formula1cm is a (Print and Play) paper&pencil racing game where you challenge one or more opponents in a one-lap Grand Prix.
Each race is a 2-player race, but you can also play solo, against the clock, or against more opponents in a World Cup championship. 
During your turn, you must pick a movement value, choose the best path, and mark (with a little dot) the new position of your car.
You must guess your movement value (in centimeters) "by eye," and if your opponent is unsure, he can check your move with the ruler; if you make a mistake, you lose the engine, tyres, and you get penalties.

—description from the designer

name: Flames of War: Za Stalina – Intelligence Handbook on Soviet Armoured and Cavalry forces
description:
From the Publisher's website:

The treacherous fascist invasion has awakened a slumbering giant. It has triggered the massive mobilization of brave soldiers and diligent factory workers. Together these comrades have built the mightiest army the world has ever seen – the awesome RKKA, the Red Army.

The foolhardy Germans will now feel the wrath of the Soviet people, and be crushed by it. All that will be left of the Hitlerites will be their gleaming bones turned over by our plows in the summer planting.

Inside You Will Find

• Complete organization and equipment for the Tankovy Batalon (Tank Battalion), Mixed Tankovy Batalon (Mixed Tank Battalion), Motostrelkovy Batalon (Motor Rifle Battalion), Rota Razvedki (Reconnaissance Company) and Kazachya Sotnya (Cossack Squadron).

• Variants for the Gvardeyskiy Tankovy Batalon (Guards Tank Battalion), Gvardeyskiy Motostrelkovy Batalon(Guards Motor Rifle Battalion), Gvardeyskiy Rota Razvedki (Guards Reconnaissance Company) and the Gvardeyskiy Kazachya Sotnya (Guards Cossack Squadron).

• History of the 3rd Mechanized Corps.

• Inspiring colour photos

• Fantastic Artwork by Vincent Wai

• Tactics guide

• Comprehensive painting guides

• Exploits of Mariya Oktyabrskaya, winner of the Hero of the Soviet Union, the highest award for heroism.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: PickUp
description:
PickUp is a fast-paced basketball deck-building card game that will wow you with it's authentic basketball gameplay and 40+ visually stunning characters!

The game puts you in the roles of GM, coach, and player, interweaving chance and strategy.

In an exciting head-to-head showdown, each team starts with the same roster of players. Teams can then use their players on the court or trade them for better, more specialized players to build out their roster.

—description from the publisher

name: Star Fleet Battles: Module F2 – The Vudar Enclave
description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

The Race That Humiliated the Klingons!

The Vudar were a Klingon subject race. Due to their unique ability to tolerate radiation fields, the Vudar were allowed to build their own ships as Klingon police auxiliaries. Due to the radiation glare, the Klingons didn't realize how many ships the Vudar had built until the Vudar declared independence.

Or did any of this really happen? Since the idea of building a whole bunch of ships with the economic power of a single planet makes no sense, were the Vudar just a Klingon trick to convince the Hydrans to allow a "neutral" race to occupy half of the Kingdom?

Includes 45 new SSDs, eight new scenarios, and several new weapons including the Ion Cannon, Ion Pulse Generator, and Ion Storm Generator. 108 counters.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: Tradewinds
description:
The object of ‘Tradewinds’ is to earn victory points by controlling valuable trade routes. As colonists develop the local infrastructure, many islands will experience an economic boom. Before that happens, dominate the exports of an island by investing there more heavily than others...but the value of those exports depends on the population demanding the products, and how well funded they are. Of course, not all would-be colonists are particularly loyal subjects: make sure to deposit enemy sympathizers and other undesirables where they can do little harm.

(rulebook overview)
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Forces of Hordes: Legion of Everblight
description:
Publishers Blurb

Embrace the Power of a Dragon!
In the frozen northern wastes, a sinister blight has awoken and now stands ready to consume everything in its path. An army prepares for war, its leader the cunning and malevolent dragon Everblight, whose very essence resides in each of his twisted generals. Filled with horrendously blighted ogrun, cruel and tainted Nyss, and terrifying dragonspawn, the Legion of Everblight is poised to spread its corruption to the farthest reaches of western Immoren and beyond.

Serve the mighty Everblight with Forces of HORDES: Legion of Everblight, featuring:

• Complete faction rules and profiles for using all current Legion of Everblight models in HORDES Mk II.
• New troops to bring to the fight, plus the all-new warlock Bethayne, Voice of Everblight and her light warbeast Belphagor.
• An in-depth look at the history and structure of the Legion of Everblight.
• A painting and modeling guide to help ready your forces for battle.
• Legion of Everblight Theme Force lists and rules, which allow you to create armies based on specialized forces from the Legion of Everblight.

name: Myrmidons
description:
Myrmidons, first released as a game playable with Nestortiles, is a game for two players.

The Myrmidons were the fiercest warriors in all of ancient Greece. This game represents a small-scale battle between two brave armies of Myrmidons, both trying to eliminate the rival. All of them look alike, but not all are equal. They vary in speed, strength and defense, and players must discover each other's weaknesses during the battle in order to win the game.

The base game contains 12 myrmidon pieces (two each of six different types), a 6x7 checkered board, and a cotton case. An expansion with 28 additional pieces (two each of 14 new different types) is available to provide different playing configurations.

name: Drums and Shakos Large Battle: Fast-Play Miniatures Rules for Divisional Level Napoleonic Battles
description: "THE TROOPS HAVE BEEN DEPLOYED. YOUR ORDERS, SIR?" Drums & Shakos Large Battles is a set of miniatures rules for large napoleonic battles. Each player controls a Division of two or three Brigades. Designed to be played in less than three hours, its mechanics force participants to make tactical choices. Drums & Shakos Large Battles rewards good management of reserves, right deployment of artillery, and historical use of cavalry. Maneuver your Battalions and Regiments, react to your opponent's actions, and launch the final attack at the right moment! Victory lies only a few steps away... Innovative mechanics detail the approach and contact phases of combat. Easy measuring system, very limited use of counters and markers, no bookkeeping. Clear victory conditions, based on losses and penetration into enemy territory. The rules allow for reactions in the opponent's turn: no player is ever truly inactive. Four Scenarios included. Appendix: playing at Corps or Army level. Playable in any scale, 6 to 28 mm. Divisional army lists for major powers (Austria, France, Britain, Prussia, Russia, and Spain). Simple guidelines to refight historical battles.

name: Dark City
description:
Don’t let the dim light of the full moon mislead you. Tonight Dark City is shadow territory. Monsters prowl the streets, craving for blood, and they’ll do anything to keep their hunting grounds. Humankind has its guardians, however few and far between, and they fight for their lives with matching ferocity. Who will survive another showdown on the gloomy streets of Dark City?

Dark City is a party game in which players choose iconic characters from the cast of a horror movie – vampires, werewolves, zombies, hunters, priests – then face their opponents in a fierce battle of wits, inference and finger-pointing.

Every round, the Acting Player randomly discards three cards from the deck. Then, one by one, players draft a monster or guardian at their choice from among the remaining cards. Players attack their chosen target by aiming their monster’s or guardian’s signature gesture at it. Then players have a chance to flee the battle, trying to prevent their opponents from scoring. Attacks are resolved in initiative order. Successful attacks “kill” their targets and allow players to achieve their monster’s or guardian’s goals. Players whose monsters or guardians have “survived” the encounter and achieved their goals score experience points (XP).The game ends when one or more players gather enough XP to meet at least one of the four victory conditions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Gravity: Soaring Islands
description:
The world of Soaring Islands existed in harmony until its people learned to extract the resource called Gravity. Civilization has plunged into endless struggle between Corporations and a fierce competition for resources.

Head up a hunting squad in the service of your Corporation and gain control of the Soaring Islands. Organize attacks on other players’ islands. Recruit Mercenaries. Mine Permanent Gravity and speculate Temporal Gravity.

At the end of each round, unstable islands fly to the island with the largest amount of Gravity. When your island is surrounded by other islands, you not only win the game but put an end to the war!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Command Cards, Hand Management, King of the Hill, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units, Ownership, Resource to Move, Turn Order: Pass Order
publishers: Board Game Pimp, RedHex, Rightgames RBG SIA

name: Tin Spin
description:
Tin Spin is a mix of physical skill, luck, and a bit of strategy. You will split your turns either rolling your die or spinning it, trying to spin longer than your fellow players. It’s a game that comes in a mint tin, making it super compact and easy to bring places, though you will need a table with a hard surface to play on (no playing on carpet, grass, etc…).

The game has 25 gold cubes. The first player to earn 5 of them wins.

You earn cubes using the seven unique dice. Six can go to players (it supports 2-6 players) and the seventh is used to swap dice after each player's turn. It’s rare that you’ll have the same die every turn.

Each die has its strengths and weaknesses, and physical skill at dice spinning makes a difference. It’s surprising how easy it is to learn how to spin dice though. Some dice are more likely to earn you a cube when rolled, some are better at spinning, and you choose each turn to roll or spin. Either way you end your turn by rolling the swap die and doing what it says to swap dice with other players.

name: Helios: Riese und Ballonfahrerin Erweiterung
description:
This mini expansion adds two new character tiles to Helios.

The giant (three mana) destroys, when activated, one temple of each opponent. At the end of the game, it gives 6 points for each pair of identical landscape tiles.

The balloon driver (3 mana) places, when activated, one piece of thunderstorm on each opponents table on a free spot. The thunderstorm may not be built on a landscape, the sun may not be placed on it, and no temple may be built on it. It doesn't count as a landscape when placing new landscapes (that is, new landscapes may not be put next to only the thunderstorm and nothing else). However, if the sun shines on it, it vanishes. At the end of the game, the balloon driver gives 1 point for each free spot next to the player's landscapes.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mythology, Territory Building

name: Wombat Kombat
description:
In this game each player is a wombat general, managing their wombats.

Players recruit fighting wombats with different amounts of Poo. When players have two or more cards of the same wombat in their hands, they can lay these cards on the table (if they want) to collect Poo at the end of the game. If, however, an opponent lays out more cards of the same type, then the wombats of that type already on the table are flipped and placed in the respective player’s burrow, face-down. The game ends when one player lays down five different wombats in front of him/her or the Draw Pile is exhausted, then players proceed to collect Poo.

Each card depicts a wombat with a different fighting style. The number on a card indicates how many of that wombat is in the game – eighteen samurai wombats, for example, but only four boxer wombats. The number also indicates the amount of Poo that each type of wombat gives during scoring. Some cards have a special skill icon on the top left corner too, which only activates once (as you lay them down). It doesn’t matter how many cards with icons you have in one set of wombats.

The player with the most Poo wins. In case of a tie, tied players roll the power dice once (or more if still tied) to break the tie!

—description from publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Der Dieb von Maradad
description:
4 families sell themselves mutually old treasures, antiques from their market tables for prizes, as high as possible.
The buyer is willing to pay just a little, so the haggling starts. From time to time anything will be stolen, but noone wants to have seen it. When you have luck you can trade with a partner. You foist a pretty worthless object on the other and get an expensive antique for it. Your partner hasn't known this though.
This and much more makes "Der Dieb von Maradad" a unusually diversified game. Winner is the player who owns the most money after a certein time (=2 hours).

name: Monster Truck Mayhem
description:
SUNDAY! SUNDAY! SUNDAY! Monster Truck Mayhem is invading the SuperMegaDome! Brought to you by Ridback Pub, 101 The Animal, and Big Al’s Sound Emporium! This thrill show spectacular will BLOW YOUR MIND! All your favorite trucks and more will be there… AND SO SHOULD YOU! Car crushing, Mud Sliding, Bus Jumping, and general mayhem for only $10! TEN BUCKS gets you the whole seat... but you will only need the edge Edge EDGE!

Race around the SuperMegaDome and be the first to cross the finish line!

Monster Truck Mayhem is a real-time dice rolling racing game. Players simultaneously roll their dice to race around the SuperMegaDome track and the winner is the first player to cross the finish line!

Players use custom dice to move 1, 2, or 3 spaces at a time. “Tire” and “Boost” are used to navigate course obstacles like the Car Crush, Bus Jump, Mud Pit, and more! Three “Boost” is an instant movement bonus. Three “Tires” causes another player to spin out!

Crush obstacles AND the competition and be the first Monster Truck to cross the finish line and take the checkered flag!

name: Ghost Hunter: Vampires
description:
In Ghost Hunter: Vampires players become Infernal Club investigators. In their latest adventure they have uncovered the worldwide phenomenon of vampirism. Now they risk their necks (literally) to become the best vampire hunters and end the curse.

Ghost Hunter: Vampires is a card game for 2-6 players that should last for 10 – 20 minutes. Players take turns to lay higher and higher cards on a central stack. If a player can’t lay an equal or higher card on a stack then they must pick up the stack. If a player lays a set or run of 3 cards at once then they get to capture the stack. Many of the cards that can be laid have addition rules that affect the game, for instance'the next player misses ago' or 'capture the top 3 cards from an opponent's capture pile, it is using these special rules at the right time that is the real skill of the game. The first player to play all of their cards ends the game. Players count up the scores of all of the cards they have captured minus all of the cards they didn’t manage to get rid of. The player with the highest score wins the game.

Although Ghost Hunter: Vampires is a stand alone game, it is compatible with other Ghost Hunter decks, allowing players to combine decks or just play with their favorite cards from any deck.

name: Data Leak
description:
Data Leak is a game of making words and breaking passwords. Acting as a skilled computer hacker, you will attempt to break your opponents’ passwords before they can break yours, knowing that these passwords must be formed from a pool of only 45 letters.
Unfortunately, data leaks happen every turn and you’ll have to be canny about which letters of your password you reveal to your opponents.
By browsing the darknet and using threats such as viruses, worms and trojan horses, more letters will be revealed until you eventually break your opponents’ passwords.
The last player with an unguessed password will win the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Deduction, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Take That

name: Joyride: Survival of the Fastest
description:
Joyride: Survival of the Fastest is a fast-paced, 2-4 player racing game in which you do whatever it takes to beat your opponents through the gates and to the finish line, whether that be through skillfully weaving your way around the track or bashing your opponents out of the way to claim victory.

Sometimes the fastest route to the finish line is through everyone else!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Race, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Banana Wars: US Intervention in the Caribbean 1897-1933
description:
Description from the publisher:

US intervention in Latin-America involved the US Marine Corps, Army and Navy. Caribbean nations were invaded, occupied, and sometimes native politicians deposed. Battles with native rebels were frequent. Protecting and promoting economic concerns lay at the root of US military intervention. Businesses such as the United Fruit Company and the Standard Fruit Company sought to control the Caribbean banana, sugar and tobacco trade. Our doughboys became their enforcers.

"Banana Wars" is a delightful, card-driven whack-a-mole game in which the US player stamps out insurrections while the Insurrecto player creates an unending string of crises to exhaust US resources.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Campaign of Nations
description:
With games like Objective Shreveport! and Hood's Last Gamble, designer John Theissen has found a unique, accessible, streamlined approach to games of operational maneuver. With Campaign of Nations, he turns his attention to the Napoleonic era, and specifically to the dramatic and turbulent 1813 Leipzig campaign. Waterloo might get the attention and the catchy pop song, but it was Leipzig that saw the emperor encircled, defeated, and forced to abdicate.

These are far larger, grander armies than those that marched across your plexi in Mr. Theissen's ACW games. New Zone of Control rules appropriate for this scale make it more difficult to slip by the enemy. Just before being attacked, defenders in multiple hexes may attempt to concentrate forces, leading to dramatic swings in fortune. These and other rules support a tense board situation in which the French player, occupying a central position, must contend with enemy armies marching in from all directions. Will Napoleon defeat each one in detail, or will they be able to tighten the noose?

name: Napoleon at War
description:
At the beginning of the 19th Century, war was a serious matter; monarchies, budding new nations and new forms of government tore at Europe’s economic and political fabric for two decades. Conscription was constant. Larger and larger armies clashed on battlefields across the Old Continent, led by noblemen, princes, aristocrats or heroes emerging from the ranks.

Put yourself at the head of an army and become the nobleman or hero accomplishing the mission you have been assigned. You have at your disposal enormous masses of infantry, fast-moving cavalry formations and powerful cannons, backed up by elite forces and legendary warriors. You will have to make quick and daring decisions, take advantage of the favourable positions and terrain features the battlefield has to offer, all to defeat your adversary and obey the orders sent by your superiors.

In Napoleon at War you command your forces, the size of a Division, and try to accomplish your assigned mission in a game played on a gaming table, with an array of magnificently painted miniatures, while a good friend at the other side of the table tries to thwart your efforts and crush your forces.

To play Napoleon at War you will need:

First of all, an army, organised according to one of the Campaign Manuals, and made up of a good number of 18mm Napoleon at War miniatures.

The rules.

An adversary, since the game is for two or more players.

A battlefield, consisting of a flat surface on which you can place terrain features to represent important terrain features such as woods, villages, hills... of the type that can be found anywhere in Europe.

A measuring tape and a good number of dice. Typical six-sided dice or D6s as they are commonly known.

With Napoleon at War you can recreate important battles of the Napoleonic Wars in your own living room. You can command a terrible Division of French Cuirassiers or a firm red line of determined British infantry. Which is your favourite army?
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Santiago de Cuba: La manifestación
description:
One card expansion for Santiago de Cuba.
Promo item at the Festival Internacional de Juegos Córdoba 2013.
publishers: Festival Internacional de Juegos de Córdoba, Jugamos Tod@s

name: Monster Lands: Jerdav Promo Card
description:
A promo made for the Man vs Meeple Kickstarter project 2018. (JERDAV is a composite name of Jeremy and David's first names)

The MvM Affinity icon is a wildcard, allowing you to settle the Land with a Mercenary of ANY Affinity. It also counts as any 1 Affinity of your choice in the end scoring. However, it does not strengthen Monsters coupled with this Land, the Monster does not get an extra die.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Bali: Village of Tani
description:
Bali: Village of Tani is the second major expansion for Bali and introduces a few new aspects to the game.

There are some extra playing cards for the building of the Village of Tani. The village board consists of four different parts.

In Phase 2, each player has a new action available during their turn: Build a hut.

This action can be performed instead of the regular action Play cards. You place a farmer card from your hand onto the discard pile to build a hut in the corresponding area on the village board. Then place 1, 2 or 3 sacrifice cards of your choice from your hand back into the supply to determine on which field in that area you can place your hut. After placing your hut, you immediately receive the bonus of that area: Ganesha figure, stones, or a banana plantation tiles for scoring bonus points.

Additionally, there will be a wooden "Ganesha meeple" which delivers more points when scoring Priests.

Finally, extra victory point tokens helps make score-keeping a little easier.

Important: If a player still has any unbuilt huts at the end of the game then that player does not participate in the end scoring and automatically loses the game. So, you must build all the huts you received at the start of the game.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Stock Holding

name: Jaleo
description:
Jaleo is a loaded Spanish word which basically means a muddle. On this ever-expanding board muddled with discs, add, stack, and move them to create 4-in-a-line!

COMPONENTS

- 28 hexagonal red tiles
- 16 black discs
- 16 ‘ice’ discs (white)

HOW TO WIN

Make a four-in-a-line with your discs and/or your stacks (i.e. four-in-a-line when viewed from above).

GAMEPLAY OVERVIEW

Place four tiles together to form a diamond-like shape in the middle of the playing surface. Set the rest of tiles aside as a pool. Each player selects a colour. Take the 16 discs of your colour. Select a first player.

Players take turns during the game until, at the end of a player’s turn, someone has won (whether it’s their turn or not). On your turn, you will either stack, add, or move. If you can stack, you must stack; otherwise, you can choose whether to add or move.

Stack (mandatory): If at the beginning of your turn, two or more of your single discs are adjacent to one another, you must stack one of those single discs atop an adjacent single disc of yours. Your turn is done.

-description from publisher

name: Usurp the King
description:
The King may be in trouble. The court that surrounds him contains subjects who seek power. Each player represents a family that will vie for control over subjects. Featuring seven victory conditions the path to victory may shift as you gain more information about each subject’s motives and those of the other families. Your allegiances will twist and change based on your interests. The subjects are but pawns.

The game is played over two phases:
INTRIGUE PHASE
Players will gather information, exert influence, and gather resources. Each member of the court has a role, each player may look at 1 role, place an influence token on a court member and select a Leverage card to add to their hand.

REBELLION PHASE
After each player has taken five turns during the Intrigue phase they will keep 5 cards in their hand and set 4 cards aside in their reserve. In order of the Leverage item number, cards will be played to bribe, conspire, stab, poison, and to shift alliances.

SCORING PHASE
One of the unique aspects of this game is the 7 different victory condition. Players may change what condition they are attempting to achieve as the game evolves. After all Leverage cards, the winning player will be determined based on the resulting court conditions (which of the following living court members they control).

The Usurper will win if two other court members are disgruntled and the Usurper has not been bribed.
The King will win if the King is alive and the Usurper has not won.
The Heir will win if the King is dead, the Usurper has not won and the Heir is not disgruntled.
The Bastard will win if the King is dead, the Usurper and the Heir have not won and the Bastard is not disgruntled.
If none of the above conditions have been met, the player that controls the most undisgruntled court members will win.
If none of the above conditions have been met, the player that controls the Anarchist will win
If none of the above conditions have been met, no player wins (Anarchy).


—description from the publisher

name: Escape Adventures: Von Schamanen und Geisterstädten
description: Family friendly escape game in a western setting. The story driven game includes solving puzzles as well as some deductive skills and offers a scoring at the end based in the age of the group and the used hints. Included is an overarching puzzle linking games in the series.
categories: Adventure, American West, Book, Fantasy, Puzzle

name: The Heart of Cthulhu
description:
The Heart of Cthulhu is a cutthroat card game consisting of three decks and more than 300 cards. This adventure game combines strategy and luck with aspects of RPG. This combination, the game’s unique lore and stunning visuals produce a new adventure every time the game is played.
