With the addition of these cards the board is opened up making no position impregnable and no attack a certainty. With these cards in use, the game is more fluid with gaming positions and strategies needing to be constantly shifted

RULE VARIATIONS:

The Advanced Tech cards are designed for use as command cards alongside the original sets provided with the standard game. No additional commander token has been provided as it is suggested that the Advanced Tech cards be used in place of the Diplomat cards. If preferred, the Advanced Tech cards can be used in conjunction with additional tokens, representative of an additional commander, therefore allowing the use of all five of the original commanders as well.

Advanced Tech 2nd Edition

Released in its original form in the summer of 2007, this twenty card expansion deck was then re-released in January 2008 sporting some new wording and improved graphics. Like our other decks, the Advanced Tech Command Deck is designed to be used alongside the original game and can either be used in place of an existing command deck of the players choice or with the use of additional command tokens available from our online store.
Second edition adds +1 Landmine and subtracts the one Subliminal Orders

- Landmine (Cost 1 to be played at beginning of turn before any attacks): This card allows the playing player to draw a land territory card which they then place secretly in front of them. The next time an opponent attacks the territory shown, that player loses Mods equal to half of a D6 dice roll.

Expands:


Risk 2210 A.D.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order

name: Les Batailles de la Fronde
description: It covers the battles of Bléneau and Faubourg Saint-Antoine (Paris suburbs) during the French Fronde civil war in 1652.

name: August '44
description:
August '44 is the expansion to 'June '44: The Struggle for Normandy, 1944' and is not a stand-alone game.

With both, now players can play the entire Normandy campaign from 6 June to mid-August. It also includes a 'COBRA' scenario to play from the breakout of late July on.

The expansion game includes the following components:

4-page Rules & scenario booklet
1 new 11 x 17" map
1 new Player aid card
6 new cards
40 new counters

Republished in Command Magazine Japan #95 in 2010.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid
publishers: DDH Games, Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社)

name: China: Einflusskarten
description:
Extension for the boardgame. Available on a postcard at Abacusspiele.
Including 9 new influence cards: With these it is possible to earn additional points when placing houses while owning the associated influence card.


Number 6 in the Abacusspiele / Spiele aus Timbuktu postcard-series
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting

name: BattleTech: 20 Year Update
description:
From the back cover:

"The Fourth Succession War was a victory for the Federated Suns.

The War of 3039 was a fiasco.

Now a new generation of Inner Sphere leaders are coming of age, inheriting the promises and the vendettas of their elders.

A new Marik commands the Free Worlds League. Theodore Kurita gains more and more power at the expense of his own father. The marriage between Hanse Davion and Melissa Steiner has successfuly borne fruit. The Capellan Confederation is no longer under the leadership of a madman.

But things never go smoothly in the Inner Sphere. Will the fledgling Federated Commonwealth survive the coming decade or will it collapse under pressures from within and without? Can the Capellan Confederation regain its strength before the Davions decide to finish what they started 20 years ago? Can Theodore Kurita drag the Draconis Combine into the modern day without losing his own life?

The BattleTech 20 Year Update advances the storyline of the universe up to the year 3050 and provides an inside look at the next generation of heroes and villains."

User comment:

The various House books provided background on the Inner Sphere empires up til the cusp of the Fourth Succession War, and the war itself is covered within the two volumes of the NAIS Military Atlas to the Fourth Succession War, This volume covers the period between the end of the war and the arrival of the Clans. While it's unlike the House books in that it doesn't provide any details on experimental 'Mechs or other rules refinements - even with Star League era tech beginning to reappear - it does include a complete unit roster for every major unit in the Inner Sphere, as well as detailed maps, making it a great sourcebook for BattleTech and BattleForce campaigns.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Kaosball: Ringer – Mr. Awesome
description:
"Arigatogozaimashita"

Is he an experiment to create the ultimate human Kaosball player? Perhaps an avatar of grace from Shadowvale? Maybe just a phenomenal athlete, drawn to the sport and specialized in ball handling? Regardless of which origin story you believe, one thing is indisputable: he really is awesome.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Tokkome
description:
User summary
捕込 (Tokkome) is a facility where semi-farmed wild horses were captured and picked as military horses in Edo period of Japan.

Tokkome is a card game with a theme of horse-capturing.

Each card is numbered from 1 to 7, and depicts that many horses. There are two piles players can play cards on: Tokkome and Maki. Each turn, you may play one or three cards on top of either pile if the cards being played can form a sequence with the top card of the pile, or take all cards from Tokkome.

After taking all cards from Tokkome, if you have three cards of the same number, you discard them and score victory points, but taking all cards is risky because it increases your cards in hand, which you have to get rid of. Afterwards, all cards in the Maki pile go to Tokkome.

When a player gets rid of all their cards in hand, each other player loses victory points for their remaining cards in hand, and the highest scorer wins the game.

Publisher's summary
「捕込」は野馬を捕まえつつ手札を減らすゲームです。
ただし、野馬を捕まえる際に余計な手札も増えてしまいます。
いかに無駄なく野馬を捕まえられるかが悩ましいゲームです。

name: Dego
description:
After his victory at Dego, Napoleon decided to hit first the Piedmontese Army but the heroic defense of Colonel Dal Carretto, that retreating in front of the French found his stronghold in the Cosseria Castle, stopped the French western Push for an entire day.

This forced the French to turn on their advance to the east toward Dego, the gate to the Po Valley.

"Dego", the second wargame in the "Napoleon Small Battle Series" (NSB), offers you a new set of rules that includes new orders and situations to let you recreate the development of new tactics and formations.

...And this will happen in all the future games of the series.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Get the MacGuffin: Plan C
description:
Plan C, an expansion for Get the Macguffin, has six new cards with amazing powers that really shake up gameplay. You can use your Third Eye to peer beyond the veil or bring something back from the past with the assistance of the Time Traveler. Of course, when the chips are down, you can always cross your fingers and fall back on Plan C!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game

name: Second Bull Run 1862
description:
"Second Bull Run 1862" is an American Civil War board wargame for two players that simulates the main battle of the "Northern Virginia Campaign" during the summer of 1862 between General Lee for the South and General Pope for the North. Despite being outnumbered, Lee wins the 3-day combat and takes advantage of his good defensive position before launching a counter attack that disperses Pope’s troops. This simulation primarily uses the rules of the Sécession System (Vae Victis - American Civil War series) developed for Cedar Creek 1864 (VV94) and especially Stones River 1862 (VV121).

Complexity : 6/10
Playability for solo play : 7/10
One turn = 1.5 hours approximately
One counter = one brigade

Published in Vae Victis wargame magazine, in issue #148.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Victim: Asylum
description:
Victim: Asylum is an expansion and serves as a continuation for Victim: The Cursed Forest. Victim: Asylum, similar to its predecessor, revolves around the cooperation of "Victims" trying to escape from an entity called "the Evil". With a brand-new setting and Victims, Victim: Asylum aims to offer a diversity in gameplay. This expansion can be played by 2-6 players. Each game takes about 40-90 minutes to play. Some situations may require components, such as cards or dice, from the main game. Victims and Evils from the main game can also be used in this expansion. The main objective for Victim: Asylum is to find the key, go to the basement, gain access to the Professor's secret tunnel and escape the Asylum before Evil consumes you. Just like the main game, one of the players will become possessed by Evil after the 3rd round, changing their objective to eliminate the other players or sabotaging their attempt to escape.

—description from the publisher

name: IKI: Essen 2015 Promo
description: Two additional artisan cards featuring the game designer Koota Yamada and UTSUROI co-founder Nakagawa Kozi. These cards were not in the box, but given as a free promos with every copy of IKI at SPIEL 2015.

name: Dog Fight: Starship Edition
description:
It is 2095. It's been almost a decade since the Great Cleansing.

Before that was the asteroid disaster. The catastrophe before that, who can remember? The world is nothing like we knew it and yet the struggles are the same. The remnants of old nations formed new factions on Mars, Maenon, and other installations. The Itnoah Dominion largely controls Earth. The conflict has spread throughout the solar system, and the balance is changing. We need you, Captain.

Prepare your ship.

2 or more players. Card-driven (living card game) plus tactical board game. Ship to ship combat. Combine and customize maps, play missions. Get all six ships and challenge more players.

Do you have what it takes to captain a starship in combat? Check out the fast-paced space ship combat game Dog Fight: Starship Edition the tactical combat game.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Collectible Components, Real-time, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Player Elimination
publishers: Fox Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Jungle Speed: Édition Luxe
description:
A deluxe edition in a wooden box containing the base game, the expansion (L'Extension) and some previously unreleased cards (extension "Expert", also included in the "la Totale / deluxe" edition). Only 3000 boxes of this limited edition were released, each contains a certificate of authenticity signed by both authors. It seems that this version was only released in France in december 2005. According to the French wikipedia page it was sold out in a month (no source cited). However some boxes were given as tournament prizes during the parisian GenCon in May 2007.

Each player is dealt a hand of cards. In order to win you must be the first player to get rid of all of your cards. Each turn, all of the players reveal one of their cards. If two cards are identical, those players must make a grab for the Totem. The faster player then gives their cards to their unfortunate adversary.

To add to the difficulty, certain cards are almost identical, which can trick a hapless player into grabbing the Totem by mistake -- a grave error. Other cards force all players to make a grab at once, change the method of play, or otherwise add to the difficulty.

The wooden Totem sits in the middle of the table, waiting for the player with the fastest reflexes to snatch it up and win the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: "Thanks a Lot!?"
description:
The "What do your friends really want?" Game

A getaway in southern France, 24 hours of invisibility, or bring one animal back from extinction which do you want the most? Thanks A Lot.? is the lively game of giving and receiving where it’s truly the thought that counts. Dole out amazing gifts to your family and friends based on what you think they’ll like. The higher someone ranks your gift, the more points you score. (from the manufacturer)

name: Neptun: Queenie 2
description: This expansion comes with 75 goods tiles (15 of each good type) and 6 goods point tiles. At the start of the game you place 1 good tile of each type in each city. When you deliver a certain good at a city, you take the corresponding good tile, if still present there. Once you have a set of the 5 different good tiles, you take the highest value good point tile (being worth 11 -> 6).

name: It's In The Bag!
description:
The Quick Witted Party Game

Work with your team to guess the cards before time runs out! Guess the cards in 3 different rounds and win!

—description from box back

What do all board games and card games have in common? PURE HAPPINESS... and TEAMWORK! You'll be smiling and laughing in no time as people yell and hope you can answer the implied questions with your ability to communicate!

—description from publishers website

name: Les pierres de Coba
description:
In Les pierres de Coba - a solo, narrative and evolving game - you will perform 50 challenges to restore balance in Mayan society thanks to the 9 sacred stones (9 carved dice).

Each of your stones represents a member of Mayan society, and for each challenge, you will need to divide your dice into two groups of equal value. But the dice faces have powers that will change their value or that of their neighbors depending on the situation.

You will discover your quest through a 56-page adventure booklet, which will present you, with each challenge, a legend linked to the universe of Mayan society.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Die Icon Resolution, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Storm Raiders
description:
For thousands of years all we have known is the Rift Storm. It destroyed our empire, sundered our land and severed us from the Old World we once ruled. Sheltered within the eye of the storm we fought to survive, imprisoned in our last remaining city, desperately clinging to life. As the ages passed the eye slowly grew in size enabling exploration beyond the city and a startling discovery. The storm was still connected to the Old World, its erratic rift capturing hapless Atlantic crossings and wrecking them upon Atlantis' broken shores. The age of the Storm Raider was born: Brave souls who for fame and fortune would dare the might of the Rift Storm, to save these precious offerings and bring hope to our dying world.

The Storm Season is upon us, all eyes look to the sky and we wonder are you the Storm Raider Atlantis has been waiting for?

The aim of Storm Raiders is to be the player with the most prestige at the game's end. Storm raiding is a perilous task, filled with many dangers - the most devastating being the mighty Rift Storm that encircles the many islands. Players will want to stay close to the storm, without being overcome by its immeasurable force.
Prestige is gained by salvaging wreck sites, fulfilling contracts, acquiring crew, upgrading their vehicles, and earning medals. Players will be drafting dice each turn to either travel using their trike, plane, or sub, or to instead take some much-needed time to rest and repair their battered vehicles.

After 6 rounds of traversing the splintered landscape, players will add up their prestige points to determine who will be remembered as the greatest Storm Raider of their time.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Race, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Biohack: Scientist Expansion
description:
The news of the race to bring Dr. Maischberger's research back to life has reached the other scientists!

In Biohack: Scientist Expansion, more scientists with different capabilities are joining the biohack research.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mythology, Science Fiction
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Claim Action, Worker Placement

name: Magic: The Gathering – Scourge
description:
Ancient, unseen forces have fused two immensely powerful archenemies into one: Karona, avatar of war. That’s why everything is on a grander scale in Scourge, with some of the biggest, jaw-dropping Creatures ever featured in one set.

This 143-card set includes randomly inserted foil-finished premium cards and new mechanics like Storm, Landcycling, Warchiefs, and even a few creatures that morph for free.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: DC Comics Dice Masters: Terry McGinnis Promo Cards
description:
Promo cards created for the Rainbow Draft Weekend 2, including full art card, sketch variant (blank) card and die.

Terry McGinnis: Batman Beyond card text:
When you purchase a non-Basic Action Die with printed cost less than the number of your active characters, add it to your Prep Area.
Max: 4
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Invocación Fronteras
description:
In this real-time game, the players must simultaneously and continuously play cards on its own boards trying to defeat at least one of the different powers of any of the opponent's cards and take them. The effects of the played cards are instantaneous and change the powers and abilities of other cards in play.

The game is played in rounds until the deck is empty (more players means less time). When this happens, the players count the total strength of the defeated cards, and who has more is declared the winner.

It can also be played in constructed deck mode.

name: Dog Poker
description:
"Animal Poker" Series No. 2! After "Neko" is "Inu"!
This game is a game that collects 7 kinds of "Inu Card" (A to G) and aims for high points.
All players leave the "Card they want" at the same time and give the "Other cards" to the person on the left!
Let's aim for the highest point in hand while watching the scoring condition that is released one by one.
In addition to the card, there is also a score sheet for score recording. 100 points (one! handlet)!

Changes from draft poker: The number of players is changed when playing with 2 to 3 people.


In addition, round rules and score sheet are newly included.

name: Find Your Seats: Bonus Appétit
description:
What's a dinner party without MORE GUESTS?! These have come from all over, introducing children into the game, along with a not-so-hard-to-notice Spy, Counselor, Robot and Vampire. Dinner is served!

Find Your Seats: Bonus Appétit adds six new characters, each very different than any we've seen.

The Sweet Pea that moves neighbors closer, The Counselor that flips them back over, The Twins that have different personalities on the left and right, The Spy that looks at cards, The Vampire that sucks blood and points, and The Robot that wants specific patterns.

name: Blackwater Gulch
description:
Blackwater Gulch is a table top hobby game where you and your friends collect small gangs of finely detailed miniature men who will fight each other in the fierce and wild west.

You will create a gang or posse based on different professions and equipment, breathing life into your men through the skirmishes they win or lose in the town streets and outskirts.

The game is named after the fictional town of Blackwater Gulch, located “somewhere out west”. It’s the around 1890 and a gold rush has brought fortune-seekers to town after a local discovery made nationwide news.

This brought a population boom and the town has become overcrowded with unsavory sorts with not enough lawmen to go around. Your gang is living in these troubling times. They can be lawmen or outlaws, vigilantes or freedom fighters. You decide who they are, what they can do and why they do it. Adventure awaits in Blackwater Gulch!
categories: Adventure, American West, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame

name: Hội Phố (Second Edition)
description:
Tiếng Việt ở phần dưới của mô tả*


Hội Phố is a quick Vietnamese themed card game for 3-5 players. During the game, players will try to gain Contracts by having the most money each round or by using Merchant’s skills. The first player to gain a required number of Contracts is the final winner. There are 15 merchants (12 merchants in the 2018 version of Hội Phố) with 15 unique skills and 5 Ship Cards. Players play a card simultaneously and compare reputation, the players who have the highest and second highest reputation merchant gain money while the lowest merchant triggers skill.

Each round contains 4 turns (Player plays 4 out of 5 cards in hand). In a 5 player game, there are only 3 turns per round. Money and cards in hand are always hidden (unless the player is required to reveal it).

Each Turn has the following steps:
Put a card facedown - Reveal a card - Resolve and reward

After finishing the last turn (the 4th turn in a game of 3-4 players or the 3rd turn in a game of 5 players), the round ends.

All players reveal their money and the player with the most money gains 1 Contract card (the top one of the contract deck)

Hội Phố là một trò chơi thẻ về văn hóa Việt Nam dành cho 3-5 người chơi. Trong trò chơi, người chơi sẽ cố gắng đạt được Hợp đồng thương mại bằng cách kiếm nhiều tiền nhất mỗi vòng hoặc bằng cách sử dụng các kỹ năng của Thương gia. Người chơi đầu tiên đạt được số lượng Hợp đồng cần thiết là người chiến thắng cuối cùng. Có 15 thương nhân (12 thương gia trong phiên bản Hội Phố 2018) với 15 kỹ năng độc đáo và 5 Thẻ tàu. Trong lượt, người chơi đồng thời hạ một thẻ và so sánh danh tiếng, những người chơi có thương nhân danh tiếng cao nhất và nhì sẽ nhận được tiền trong khi thương nhân có danh tiếng thấp nhất sẽ kích hoạt kỹ năng.

Mỗi vòng có 4 lượt. Nếu có 5 người chơi, chỉ có 3 lượt mỗi vòng. Tiền và thẻ trong tay luôn được giấu kín (trừ khi người chơi bắt buộc phải tiết lộ).

Đặt một thẻ úp xuống - lật lên và so sánh các thẻ - Lấy thưởng và kích hoạt chức năng

Sau khi kết thúc lượt cuối cùng (lượt thứ 4 trong một trò chơi 3-4 người hoặc lượt thứ 3 trong một trò chơi 5 người), hiệp đấu kết thúc.

Tất cả người chơi tiết lộ số tiền của họ và người chơi có nhiều tiền nhất sẽ nhận được 1 thẻ Hợp đồng (thẻ trên cùng của chồng thẻ hợp đồng”
mechanics: Hand Management, Score-and-Reset Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Shadow Fight: Битва демонов (Shadow Fight: Demon Battle)
description:
Shadow Fight: Demon battle is a card game where you take a role of a popular character from Shadow Fight.
1. Collect your series of tricks
2. Predict enemy trick and put a trap on it to knockdown your enemy.
3. Use your abilities.
Win 3 fights and be victorious!
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Take That

name: The Battle of Chickamauga
description:
A self-published, SPI quality (circa 1974), wargame of the American Civil War Battle of Chickamauga, 20 Sept., 1863.

A legal-sized white envelope with a b&w sketch of the battle containing:
2 8 1/2" x 11" typewritten pages of rules (SPI ACW Quad complexity)
1 page of Order of Battle and Set-up
1 page with Combat Results Table and Terrain Effects Chart
Approximately 100 quality 1/2" die-cut counters
17" x 22" heavy paper white map with black and blue colored terrain features
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Merlin
description: According to Sid Sacksons "A Gamut of Games": An intense Battle-to-the-death between Merlin and Morgane le Fay, each able to call on magical powers and three helpers. The eight metal figures can be colored with the paint supplied.

name: G-Barbarossa
description:
G-Barbarossa consists of 250 pieces, a 58 x 82 cm map (printed in English) and 7 pages of rules (in Japanese).
Hex scale is 40 km, turn length is a month and units are corps. Player numbers are from one to four and playing time is about six hours.

G-Barbarossa covers the German offensive of 1941 and the Soviet counter attack of Winter 1941-1942. Soviet units have been treated in a unique way, in that the second step strength of a two step unit varies and is unknown to all players until the unit is reduced. For example: a 3 strength infantry unit's second step may reveal itself to be: two, one or * (annihilation!). Soviet leaders are treated in a similar way, with ratings of: 3 (Zhukov only), 2, 1, 0 and *, being revealed to all players only at the moment of battle. Leaders have combat strength and command control ability equal to their rating, and they keep units in supply up to the number of hexes equal to their rating. A leader with a rating of 1 exerts command control into adjacent hexes, a leader with 0 has no combat strength but gives supply to units in the same hex and a * leader is removed before combat, thereby having no effect. Only German panzer corps have a second turn phase, allowing them to exploit breakthroughs. The turn sequence changes in Winter for the Soviet counter attack.

name: Akropolis
description: Akropolis is a three-dimensional abstract strategy game for 2 players. As in the ancient world, columns and temples will be built. Each player tries to make use of the hard work of his opponent for himself. The aim of the game is to get several columns together in a particular arrangement or to build a temple.

name: Prospektor
description:
In PROSPEKTOR, two to seven players try to make their way as explorers and prospectors traveling throughout the Solar system. Buy, outfit, and board ships, space stations, and space mills to become the richest prospector. It is not enough to find the raw materials. You have to bring them back to Earth and sell them successfully. This is only possible if there is a supply line (i.e. an uninterrupted orbital line from the raw material world back to Earth). Robot shuttles on the planets and asteroids carry the resources to the orbiting ships/stations at a rendezvous point. From there, a transfer to Earth is only possible when a supply line is available.

The game is set-up as a row of cards with each representing a planet in our Solar system. Each card/planet shows orbital paths for player travel and shows available resources which can change throughout the game - ore, biomass, energy, and water.

Each game includes:
91 playing cards
7 cards to cut and use as playing pieces

The designers suggest using 10mm dice as playing pieces, as only three are necessary for each player.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Exploration, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Trading
publishers: Computerspiele per Post (CSPP), Udo Grebe Gamedesign

name: Star Fleet Battles: Module Omega 4 – The Omega Rebellion
description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

From the back of the cover:

THE EDGE OF DISASTER!

Rebellions flare across the Omega sector. The RYN tigers try to break out of their enclave before the Andromedans can destroy them. The Qixa try to escape from their nebula. The Branthodons rebel at oppression by their genocidal Alunda neighbors. And the Bolosco Traders, denied the profits they seek, are hunted by enemies far and wide. On the eve of invasions that will virtually destroy the sector, wars and rebellions create a burning house in which everyone must fight for survival or be destroyed.


The RYN use renewable ceramic armor and transporter-emitter missiles.
The Branthodons use genetically-engineered space dragons for their ships.
The Qixa fight with gauss cannons, ultrawarp missiles, and energy spark rings.
The Bolosco Traders use tractor technology for their primary weapons.
The Koligahr gain caseless anti-matter to blast their foes into oblivion.
The Alunda develop Whipcrack Torpedoes to increase their firepower.
Seven scenarios, 47 new SSDs, 216 Counters, and the Bonnaventure Campaign.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: This Sceptered Isle
description:
This Sceptered Isle consists of 4 battles of the Wars of the Roses. Towton, Mortimer's Cross, Barnet and Tewkesbury.

It uses an evolution of the system from his pre-gunpowder quads published through 3W (Age of Chivalry, Crusades, Sword & Shield, Henry V, Crusades II). The command system has been changed to accommodate leader character - leaders are rated as aggressive, controlled, or timid, and are likely to gravitate to an order stance that is in keeping with their character as the battle unfolds. Correct exploitation of their capability in the battle plan is important for victory. The melee and fire combat mechanics are also quite different from the other games in the series.

The counters are nicely done, icons. The maps are DTP standard. Best of all, the rules are short, counters few, and you can set up and play and finish in an hour.

name: La Petit Armee
description:
Game billed as "a complete Napoleonic miniatures system in a box." Note that the title is bad French; the correct title would be La Petite Armée.

Box contains three two-panel mounted, green-flocked boards combining to measure 3' x 2'. Game includes a selection of terrain to use on these boards to create battlefields, including six different hills, two different villages, two different farms with farm fields, hedgerows, stone walls, roads, streams, rivers, two forests and a bridge. Roads, streams, and the forest footprint are in colored felt. Buildings are painted and cast from resin. Tree bases are magnetized for secure storage inside the box.

Boxed set includes rules, charts, two rulers, two ten-sided dice, casualty/morale caps, command/rally counters, deployment/dummy markers scaled to unit base sizes, objective/line of communication markers, and two fully painted, based and flocked Napoleonic armies.

Each army consists of four line, one light and one elite infantry brigade; two light and one heavy cavalry brigade; three foot and one horse artillery batteries; and one General with two separate lieutenants used for command extension functions. Each brigade includes a flag of its nationality.

Infantry is mounted four to a magnetic stand, three stands to a brigade representing about 2200 men. Cavalry is mounted two to a magnetic stand, three stands to a brigade representing around 700 men. Guns are mounted individually, one crew member for a field/horse battery and two crew for a heavy gun. General is mounted with a foot figure; lieutenants are mounted individuals.

Figures in the standard starter set are painted "Risk" figures from the "shako" edition of Risk. Additional painted brigades representing helmeted cavalry, lancers, etc. may be ordered from the producer. Supplemental terrain boards and terrain elements are also available.

The rules are playable and concentrate on command and morale. Units out of vision distance or line of sight are initially represented by hidden deployment markers, revealed as units come within sighting range. Units may also be assigned to off-board flanking forces and/or reserves.

Initiative is determined each turn, as are available command points for each army. Command points may be used either to activate units for movement and combat, or to rally shaken or demoralized units. Army command diminishes as brigades are demoralized or destroyed.

The game system allows for considerable expansion and accommodates multiple players on a side. Entire large battles can be gamed using this system and additional unit, but an interesting game can be played with as few as four or five brigades on a side.
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Legends of the Ancient World: The Island of Lost Spells
description:
The Island of Lost Spells is a programmed adventure using Dark City Games Legends of the Ancient World rule set. These rules provide gameplay very similar to that of Melee and Wizard from Metagaming. This adventure is compatible with those games as well.

Battles are fought with counters on a hex map that is included with the game.

This series of games can be played one of three ways: Game Mastered, "semi-solitaire" (group play with no GM), and solitaire.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Legends of the Ancient World: The Crown of Kings
description:
The Crown of Kings is a programmed adventure using Dark City Games Legends of the Ancient World rule set. These rules provide gameplay very similar to that of Melee and Wizard from Metagaming. This adventure is compatible with those games as well.

Battles are fought with counters on a hex map that is included with the game.

From the Publisher: "The Crown of Kings! The ancient symbol of ruler ship from the legendary Federative Empire, said to have ruled this land in the misty past. Some say that when the Crown is again brought to light, and worn by one both steadfast and strong, the Empire will rise again. That is the work, perhaps, of generations of imaginations, but the Crown of Kings would be a prize indeed."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Urrahh! Your Guide to the Soviet Fighting Man, His Weapons, and His War
description:
This expansion to the Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers: Infantry and Vehicle Small Unit Skirmish Wargaming in WWII system adds details for including Soviet forces in your games.

Expands

Disposable Heroes and Coffin For Seven Brothers: Infantry and Vehicle Small Unit Skirmish Wargaming in WWII
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Hibiscus and Hurricane
description:
Hibiscus and Hurricane is a shrewd game of exploitation, profit seeking, and risk tasking along the coast of a fictional tropical nation. In H and H you play a civic minded developer tasked with the goal of generating additional profits for your investors while improving the lives of the citizens along a warm, rich, tropical coast that has recently emerged from a long time dictatorship. You score points by developing provinces along the coast, bringing tourists to your resorts, and avoiding devastating hurricanes. Tourists are fickle and don’t take well to nasty storms and other calamities, but are comfortable in places well protected from natures fury while being furnished with amenities and goods. Players rush to fill the limited capacity of each province while placing "clouds" along specified tracks which will generate hurricanes that can strike their opponents cities and send their tourists packing.

H and H is a medium weight Euro game, similar in length to Ticket to Ride or Thurn and Taxis, with more strategic decisions than either of those games. Its designed as a quick FUN game with plenty of strategy.

Objective:
To invest in this region, bring tourists and score the most victory points after a predetermined number of hurricane strikes.

Game Play:
The Game is played over a predetermined number of rounds, signaled by the strike of a hurricane. Typical game length is between 3-4 hurricanes (1-1.5 hours).
The game is played with a deck of cards with special actions and bonuses and disasters, a game board representing a small coastal region, and wooden bits to keep track of tourists and improvements.

Card Management
Players start with 5 cards in their hand. Players may not have more than 9 cards at the end of any turn.
A turn consists of 3 actions, from one of the following combinations:


Play 3 actions
Draw 3 cards
Play 1 action draw 2 cards
Play 2 Actions draw 1 card


Choice is declared before any cards are drawn or played.

After each hurricane has been played out that ends a season, and the deck is re-shuffled. At the end of each season all remaining tourists score points. Three to five hurricane seasons are played out, and the player with the most victory points wins.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Environmental, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Minotaur Maze
description:
From the back of the box:
Minotaur Maze is a game of speed and strategy where the object of the game is for players to move through the changing maze to the four pits to rescue their maidens from the minotaur and then return to the minotaur maze disc to win the game.

name: Ancient & Medieval Wargaming
description:
The book provides a general overview of miniature wargaming in the ancient and medieval periods. While designed for miniatures players, the included historical backgrounds, army tactics, and army lists (50+) are useful to the ancient and medieval boardgamer as well.

The book is divided into the following periods: Biblical, Classical, Dark Age and Medieval. Within each other period, there are chapters on the history, troops, weapons, army list, miniatures rules, and a battle report. The included miniatures rules for each period are only 6 pages long, and armies are 8 units of 4 stands each (some special units like Elephants or Artillery has only 1 stand). Battle reports are for the battles of Kadesh (Biblical), Issus (Classical), Mount Baden (Dark Ages), and Agincourt (Medieval).

name: Kagemucca
description:
The funniest cow war in the world... the Mucca Games party game!

Each player receives a set of cows (Elite, Rookie, Cow Waste "Vaccacca") and place the cards face up. Each player studies the placement of the other players' cards, then the cards are covered.
The current player attacks another players' card with one of his cards: if they are of the same kind, nothing happens; elsewhere, the battle is resolved using the "Rock-Papers-Scissors" rules: the Elite beats the Rookie, the Rookie beats the Waste, the Waste beats the Elite.
The winner takes the losing card as a point; the winning card cannot be attacked during the next round (current player passes clockwise).

Kagemucca was introduced in Mucca Games in 2006 by the author, Valerio Cassiano, who managed the First World Kagemucca (Preview) Tournament.

Valerio Cassiano passed away a few months later.

Kagemucca was produced by Mucca Games and daVinci Games in 2008, with the help of the Cassiano family, and of many Mucca Games friends.

The cows on the cards are illustrated by:

Simone Pacioni (the Original Ones!), Gianpaolo Derossi, Emanuela Matricardi, DRMA (Domenico, Roberta, Matteo, Andrea ) Di Giorgio, Daniele Barletta, Alberto Di Giorgio, Luigi Ferrini, Alberto Bontempi, Martina Mealli, Paolo Vallerga, Marco Giammetti, Giordano "Giò" Segatta, Martino Palladini.

name: Warmaster Renaissance Supplement
description:
This self published variant was released shortly after the original Warmaster, as a modification of those rules for the Renaissance period. It is interesting that this work pre-dates Games Workshop's Warmaster Ancients.

From the introduction of this title:


These rules are meant to supplement the Warmaster fantasy miniatures rules produced by Games Workshop, and incorporate the ancient rules supplement for that system developed by Stephen Hess. Our thanks to Mr. Hess for taking the time to assemble the basic troop types for the vast majority of troops available in the ancient period, as well as providing many prepared armies lists, and for graciously allowing me to directly incorporate his work into this piece. This supplement for Renaissance gaming is heavily dependent on the work done for the ancient period. Especially useful were the basic infantry, cavalry and elephant troop types. Rules incorporated here are elite, skirmishers, phalanx, warband, and camels. Stephen Hess’s Ancientmaster rules supplement can be found on the web http://www.brumbaer.de/Wm/Ancients/index.html.


Also included are guidelines for creating army lists from other sets which focus on this period, WRG 7th ed. & DBR.

name: Twilight of the Luftwaffe
description:
An expansion for Rise of the Luftwaffe, found in RBM/s C3i Magazine Nr15. This module is set in 1945 at the end of the war. Planes include Gloster Meteor III, De Havilland Vampire F.1, P-80A Shooting Star, B-29 Superfortress, Me-163C Komet, He-162 Volksjaeger, HE-P1077 Julia, Ba-349A Natter, and the Me-263 Stern.

Contents:
2 sheets of planes
Background and rules including special counters.
Campaign sequence and mission targets.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Guns at Gettysburg Scenarios 3: On to Richmond – The Peninsula and the Seven Days
description:
A selection of scenarios for use with Guns at Gettysburg miniature wargame rules.

The 16 scenarios included are:

* Lee's Mill (1862)
* Dam No. 1 (1862)
* Williamsburg (1862)
* Eltham's Landing (1862)
* Hanover Court House (1862)
* Casey's Redoubt (1862)
* Fair Oaks (1862)
* Oak Grove (1862)
* Mechanicsville (1862)
* Battle of Gaines' Mill (1862)
* Battle of Garnett's Farm (1862)
* Allen's Farm (1862)
* Battle of Savage's Station (1862)
* Glendale (1862)
* Malvern Hill (1862)
* Evelington Heights (hypothetical)

Also includes several pages of optional rules for Guns at Gettysburg as well as conversion rules for players of Johnny Reb 2.
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Snappy Nappy
description:
SNAPPY NAPPY by Russ Lockwood: Simple, subtle & ultrafast Napoleonic Rules for 2 to 20 players. Simple, yet subtle, rules for multi-corps actions. Step by step introduction for those new to Napoleonic wargaming. Morale based (no figure removal) for fog of war. 1 vol, 60 pgs. 2009 HOPEWELL, OMM PUBLISHING

SNAPPY NAPPY is designed for running any Napoleonic campaign in one to two days. The author has successfully hosted and executed the 1809 campaign in Germany (1 day), the Invasion of Russia in 1812 (2 days), and the Leipzig campaign in 1813 (2 says) with 8-12 players. Unit size is described as division level, but it is flexible enough to represent regiments for a set piece battle as well. For example, the battle of Raab (1809) could be done as a 2 player division-level game in about 60-90 minutes, or as a 4-6 player regimental game in about 2 hours.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: DBR Army Lists Book 2
description: Armies of the European Early Northern Wars, Thirty Years War and Great Rebellions and of The Moghul Conquest of India
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Old School Peg Hockey
description: A wooden dexterity game for 2 players where each player has a stick and take turns attempting to hit the puck into the opponents goal. First one to 5 wins.

name: 18 Ghosts
description:
For half a millennium, a group of ghosts have been growing quite weary of one another's company in an old Scottish castle.

Since they are thoroughly bored with the social scene of the stony structure, each ghost secretly wishes to escape the castle and go on wild adventures. Unfortunately, the ghosts are trapped there.

Suddenly, an opportunity arises! They discover three glimmering magical portals that they might be able to use to find freedom. Desperation sets in quickly, because they know the portals won't be open long, so the ghosts scramble and jostle one another, trying to slip through the portals while they have the chance. They certainly don't want to see each other's ethereal faces for another 500 years!

COMPONENTS:

18 Ghosts includes:


A board depicting an old Scottish castle with 25 rooms (5×5) and one large dungeon.
18 ghosts in 2 types and 3 colors (3 for each color and type).
3 portals, one of each color.


GOAL OF THE GAME:

Both players try to help their ghosts escape from the castle.

In order to win the game, be the first to have a red ghost, a blue ghost, and a yellow ghost outside the castle.

When this happens, the game ends immediately. That player is the winner.

name: Cutthroats!
description:
Ahoy mates! As an upstanding member of the pirate community, yer goal be to gain fame and fortune, aye, but mostly fortune! To amass wealth, ye must go on the account and join a pirate crew. Working together, you will embark on voyages of great danger. Or if ye be lucky, yer captain will have a map to untold treasures that can be unearthed with just a few tools o' the trade. So be prepared and beware! Yer mates cannot always be trusted, nor can that blasted lubber.
Perhaps ye have the pluck to be captain yourself? Captains gain a large share o' the treasure, but beware a mutinous crew! Eventually, you may become so famous that ye retire to enjoy yer legitimately acquired riches. But if some young scallywag flaunts more riches than ye, ye will fade into pirate obscurity!

In Cutthroats!, players take on the role of a crew of pirates. Each turn one player is voted Captain and a voyage is selected from the six available. Working together and using the tools they have purchased and their crew abilities, the crew attempts to defeat each voyage and gain reputation and doubloons! When a player reaches the rank of Pirate King, all retire from a life at sea. But the pirate with the most loot is the ultimate winner, so watch that reputation track carefully and decide when the time is right for treachery!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Voting

name: Steam Expansion: Andalusia
description:
Andalusia is a 2 player, print-and-play map, designed by Thomas Wegner for Steam. The map depicts Andalusia, an autonomous community of Spain, in the south of the Iberian peninsula. (Read more: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andalusia)

There are nice twists regarding goods delivery. The Andalusia map uses a concept of "My City Tokens" - goods delivered to a city with your "My City Token" on it gain you 1.5 Victory or Income points per link, but only for the first delivery. Furthermore, there are very few blue cubes in the game. These are worth 2.0 Victory or Income points per link when delivered to Gibraltar.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Jamaica
description: Multi-player puzzle solving game using 7 dice. Your goal is to come up with the "answer", which is the sum of 2 black dice (11 to 66), by using other 5 white dice and arithmetic operations (add, subtract, multiply and divide). Whoever solved it first says "Jamaica!" and show the solution.

name: Rolling Courts
description:
You are a head of a noble family who wants to be known in the courts of the kingdom. Your family members can be sent to the villages and from there buy their way into the courts by donating money. Money is gained by sending other family members to work in the mines. Will you manage to balance between the two tasks and lead your family to be the most prestigious one in the kingdoms?

Your goal is to bring your family members to the courts where you'll earn victory points. You get to the courts from the village councils. The more advanced you are in the council the senior you are and the less it costs to move to the courts.
You gain money by moving other members of our family members to the mines, the deeper you go the more money you can get. You also might be lucky to get to the deeper mines.

Moving your family members on the board is done by rolling 3 dice. Those 3 dice show to where you can move your family members.
As you enter members to villages, courts & mines you advance the other family members that are already there, which means you are helping other players.

Only 3 decision each turn, but you must balance between money earning and spending, free family members, position of members in the villages, and when to move to the courts.

name: Espaço 235
description:
Each player or team controls a squad of 3 spaceships, the goal is to lead them to a trip since the launching base to the finishing point - 235. The route is full of difficulties and hitches that retard or blocks the headway of the ships.
On the other hand, there are a lot of favorable circumstances that accelerates the progress of the ships to the objective.
The luck factor and decision skill of the O.C. (Operational Commander) depends the success and the prizes to get.
The game finishes when a O.C. can park, in the base Espaço 235 (Space 235), the maximum of the ships that are in playing. This means that, if each O.C. has 3 ships, the winner will be the first to reach the objective with 3 ships. And so successively , by decreasing order.

name: Agent Saboteur
description:
From website:

Agent Saboteur is a face-paced card game full of bluffing and sabotage, where you command a team of international spies trying to stop the terrorists and build your reputation in the process. One of the great things about this game is that no one sits on the sidelines and waits for the other players to get done. For the casual gamer, Agent Saboteur is easy to teach, fun to play, and will quickly become the game you play most often. For the hobby gamer, it will become the go-to game you get out when friends or family stop by.

The Story: “Welcome, handler XXXXXXXXXX. Your reputation precedes you. That little matter you took care of in XXXXXX was quite impressive. Some believe you may be ready, so from here on your organization will only be tasked with stopping the type of incidents that end up on the front page. The last agents that got sent got themselves XXXXXX within a week and we’re still explaining the glow in XXXXXXXXXXX. Everything you hear, see, or do from this point forward is strictly classified. Good luck. You’ll need it.“

The Gameplay: Your assignment is to use the spies and mission updates in your hand to stop the terrorists. Whichever player gathers the most points in incidents wins. To do so you'll work the source to gain more agents to your team, but if you push your luck, you may get made and lose them all. Then you'll need to send your agents on missions, traveling incognito using your fake passports. Beware, if the other agents guess where you're sending them, they can sabotage the attempt. Keep your cards close to your chest and you just might live.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Aquarius: Dragon
description:
This is a card you can add to your Aquarius deck to alter the gameplay to resemble Seven Dragons.

The front of the card is an image of the Aquarius Dragon, and the back of the card contains the instructions on how to use this card. It acts as a new starter card, and is initially wild.

As you play Actions to the discard pile, the Aquarius Dragon changes color to match the top Action card in the discard pile. You can also choose to play an Action to the discard pile without fulfilling the action in order to just change the color of the Dragon. Or you choose can play an Action card to the bottom of the discard pile to get the benefit of the action without changing the Dragon.

name: Poseidon: The Gods
description:
Zeus, Hades, Hera, Hermes, Athena and Hephaistos are the new Gods for Poseidon.

During Exploration Round, a King may choose not to move the discovery ship and build trading posts, but to place one of his nations potentials on one of the Gods instead to get that card´s bonus.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology, Nautical, Transportation
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Mail Order Mutants
description:
Who will be the first to create the Rattle-Hoofed Eelbatross, the Pacific Duckguana Snail, or the dreaded Chipmunktopus?

Mail Order Mutants is a set-collecting card game in which 2-4 players assume the roles of mad scientists seeking to genetically engineer bizarre creatures to sell to rich, anonymous businessmen. The scientists scoop raw DNA out of a shared toxic sewer to create the mutants indicated on a series of order request cards, and then ship them to the businessmen's private menageries.

The scientist who is best able to scoop, splice, and slice the DNA in and around his gestation tanks to churn out the most valuable collection of mutants will win the game, and a retire a still-mad, but rich scientist.

Mail Order Mutants is a free print-and-play game, consisting of 103 cards.

name: Mundus Novus: Vers de Nouveaux Horizons
description:
Mundus Novus: Vers de Nouveaux Horizons (eng: Toward New Horizons) is a print-and-play expansion for Mundus Novus.

Vers de Nouveaux Horizons is based on territories. Now, the players can be something else besides merchants. They can explore the new world or conquer the territories discovered by the other explorers. And a new way to win the game is also introduced!
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Nautical, Print & Play, Renaissance
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Unfortunates of Tozlandia and the Tablet of Doom
description:
You and 14 others have decided to create a new life on the peninsula of Tozlandia. The land is lush and plentiful, however after settling life, a dark, secret tablet is uncovered. After years of deciphering it is revealed that the land of the unfortunates will be ravaged by disasters predicted by the Tablet of Doom and that time when these things will unfold is drawing near. It dawns on you that you and your Tozlandianites are the unfortunates! You quickly re-read the tablet and realize that you only have time to build safe houses to survive the onslaught that’s about to happen. All of the other unfortunates are looking to you to help them get to the safe houses and avoid disaster.

Goal of the Game:
To have more than half of the unfortunates survive the events predicted by the Tablet of Doom. Unfortunates survive by making it to a safe house, however more than half of the unfortunates must make it to win.

Playing The Game:
Turns are broken down into a few parts, first you take your action phase and then you tempt fate and roll two 6-sided dice and do what happens on the Matrix of Doom. Finally you check to see if you have won the game.

Turns continue in the fashion until all unfortunates are in safe houses, all safe houses are destroyed, or no more unfortunates can move. If you've gotten the required number of unfortunates to safe houses you've won the game, otherwise the game is lost.

This game was designed for the 2012 Solitaire Print and Play Contest placing 3rd in the Category of "Best Small Game" -- 2012 Solitaire Print and Play Contest Results Post
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: So läuft der Hase!
description:
The game consists of a wooden board with 8 by 8 hollows (or 6 x 6 in the smaller edition for two players). These are randomly filled with marbles: Orange for carrots, green for salad and yellow for dandelions. Each player also owns a hare (a marble in a unique color) on the field.
Players take turns hopping two fields forward and one to the side, picking up ("eating") the marble on the field they land on. The food marbles are worth 3, 2, and 1 point respectively; and landing on an opponents hare eliminates the opponent (and is worth 4 points). When no more hare can move, the players count their points; the player with most points is the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement

name: Quantum Leap
description:
Quantum Leap is a board game for 2 players than can be played on a hexagonal grid of any shape and size. The official rulebook uses a hexagonal board of 5 hexes per side, 30 white stones and 30 black stones, as it is the recommended configuration for beginners.

In Quantum Leap, each player’s stones start dispersed on the board. Your goal is to be the last player making a valid move. Stones can only move by capturing enemy stones, leaping in a special fashion. Stones get their leaping potential from the number of friendly stones that immediately surround them.

The rulebook includes a variant for more than 2 players.

Quantum Leap is the dark brother of Adaptoid.

Special thanks to Cameron Browne for the game name.

Note:

The latest version by the designer uses 31 black stones and no empty space at the start, and removes the swap option for the second player. This makes it more elegant and balanced.

Update:

Nestorgames has released a 'balls edition' that includes 61 balls in 2 colours (30 white and 31 black) and 61 rings. It replaces the pie rule for an additional ball for the second player.

name: Impact Factor
description:
Impact Factor is a strategic tile laying game in the world of science. Nine research laboratories are competing in the fields of physics, biology and chemistry for much needed funds. But having the most promising research projects might not be enough as faulty data, laboratory accidents and major scandals are overshadowing the success.

The players are Science investors looking for the most lucrative investment and once they have built up and nurtured a research facilities they will try to support it by favorable reviews, media campaigns and dirty tricks.







At the start of the game each player has a hand of three tiles and three investment markers.
During his turn a player can essentially take two of the following actions:
- place one tile from his hand on one of the nine spaces of the game board that has no investment marker on it;
- draw one tile from an open display;
- draw one tile from the deck;
- discard any number of tiles and draw the same number of new tiles from the deck;
- place one investment marker on one of the nine spaces of the game board that has no investment marker on it;
- use the special action of a tile in play that has one of that player's investment markers on it;
- remove one of his investment markers from play and take it back into his hand;
- discard a tile from his hand to use that tile's special action.

The game ends when either one player has all his investment markers in play, all nine spaces of the game board are occupied by investment markers or when the last tile is drawn from the deck.

The goal of this game is to collect the most science points, which are granted by the value of the top card on each of the nine spaces on the board, modified by the number of tiles on that space, the number of different colors (fields of research) and all the modifiers provided by the adjacent tiles.







Impact Factor plays with 2-4 players in approximately 30 minutes and offers many meaningful decisions.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Memory, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Take That, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: La torre degli incantesimi
description:
La torre degli incantesimi is a roll and move and dexterity game, for 2-4 little magicians.
Each player tries to make his magic potion collecting 4 different ingredients. During his round, a player rolls and moves his magician and does one of the following action according to the space he lands:
- using his dragon, take a small ball and put it inside the tower in the middle of the board. The ball will exit from the tower and land in a bridge: it will be transormed in one ingredient according to the symbol in the bridge.
- take the ingredients from a bridge.
- put a beam inside the tower: it can influence where the ball will exit.
- draw a magic card: for example it could allow the player to take an ingredient for free.
- reroll the dice.
The first player who finishes his potion wins.

name: Thud Ridge: A Solitaire Game of the Air War over North Vietnam
description:
THUD RIDGE is a Game where you are a Commander of a Squadron of F-105 Fighter-Bombers during the Vietnam War. Your goal is to complete a series of missions and score as many Victory Points (VP) as possible to assist to the US war efforts.

Game features an innovative system that allows a single player to easily resolve SAM Attacks, AAA Attacks, SAM Suppression, Air-to-Air Combat and Ground Attacks involving multiple aircraft.

The game also includes a large hex-based map of North Vietnam, many colorful counters of aircraft, including F-105 Thunderchiefs, F-4 Phantoms, Mig-17s, Mig-19s, Mig-21s and RB-66 Destroyers.

Mission Resolution involves the player to draw a Mission Card, select his aircrews and arm his aircraft to best complete the Mission. You will need to determine what Mission roles your aircraft will perform; Strike-Bomber or SAM Suppression (Wild Weasel).

Also Included is a US Navy Campaign called ALPHA STRIKE. ALPHA STRIKE has the Player in command of a Naval Carrier Air Wing(CVW) off the coast of Vietnam, known as Yankee Station. ALPHA STRIKE includes A-4 Skyhawks, A-7 Corsairs, A-6 Intruders, EA-6A Prowlers and F-4 Phantoms.

You can find Thud Ridge at http://www.berserkergames.net
categories: Aviation / Flight, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting

name: Rink Ratz: The Hockey Card Game
description:
Rink Ratz: The Hockey Card Game provides an authentic hockey experience in card game.

In the game, players play cards onto a common play pile, attempting to create shots and score goals. Play starts at the Rookie level and progresses through the Junior and Pro levels as special cards are added. These special cards introduce other elements of hockey, such as blocked shots, breakaways, power plays and penalty shots to name a few. The team scoring the most goals wins.

name: Pocket Rugby League
description:
From the publisher:

Pocket Rugby League is head smashing, scrum packing, ball and all Rugby - played with dice.
We've made this game to give plenty of scoring chances...in fact, not scoring in an attacking raid might be more painful than the huge hits throughout the game.
The gameplay focuses on each side taking turns in an attacking set of 6 tackles.
You are in control of 5 playing positions - the scrum half always starts each passage of play. He will either pass to another position, kick for a field goal or try and gain ground. On the other 4 dice, there is a 1 in 6 chance of 'busting' the line of defense, at which point, your opponent has one more roll of the 'Defensive' die to try and stop the try scoring effort.
If he succeeds, it is recorded as a tackle in the set of 6 and the attack continues. If he can't stop the try, the attackers then gets to roll the TRY / NO TRY dice.
3 in 6 chance of a TRY / 2 in 6 chance of NO TRY and 1 chance the VIDEO ref is called upon to review the tape - in which a re-roll of the TRY die is made.
You can also kick for field goals, penalties and scrums. All of these are dependent on rolling a certain number to be successful.

name: Raider 33: Pinguin
description:
Raider 33: Pinguin follows in the footsteps of 2011's Raider 16: Atlantis. Designed from the ground up to be an entirely new game, Raider 33 – Pinguin introduces a new take on the lone-ship-against-the-Royal-Navy theme. Much more detail has been given to ship to ship engagements, various missions assigned by the German high command, a detailed ship manifest, fuel concerns, captured cargo and enemy prisoners, secret documents, many different actions, and a new ocean to prowl.

2014 Solitaire Print and Play Contest Awards:

Best Game
4th Place (Tied)

Best Wargame
2nd Place
categories: Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Chit-Pull System, Simulation, Worker Placement

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Stargazer Federation Expansion Pack
description: This ship is the competitive prize for Month 3 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, The Collective.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Super Tooth: Dino Bones Promo Card
description: This promo card for Super Tooth is marked OSFest 2014.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric

name: Zero Hour
description:
Description from the publisher:

Nearly 75% of the U.S. population is infected with an airborne disease: the Z-B13 virus. About a quarter of these people are at Stage 3 of the infection, and the numbers of the "Afflicted" are growing by the day. Cities throughout the U.S. Midwest are emptying as healthier citizens flee for the coasts and roving gangs terrorize the highways. Rumors abound as to the cause — a madman with a chip on his shoulder, a military experiment gone wrong, and so on — but if there's any hope for turning back the tide on this illness, someone will need to find a cure. And the best bet for this cure is a small team of survivors unaffected by the virus, searching from city to city as they find and stop the Mastermind behind the Z-B13 virus.

The pulp-adventure cooperative game Zero Hour balances dice placement with a press-your-luck threat track and risk/reward decisions that add tension on every turn. Combined with an optimistic take on a well-loved gaming theme, Zero Hour flips the zombie genre into an epic quest to find the cure for the Z-B13 virus...all in about an hour.

name: Bifrost: The Viking Party Game
description:
Bifrost: Chamado aos Deuses (Bifrost: Call to the Gods) is a Party Game inspired in games such as Uno and the Brazilian game Copo d’Água (AKA Dorminhoco), with a card-buying mechanic, but set in Nordic culture and mythology. The main objective of the game isn't to win, but to not be the loser.

The game 'turn' has 4 parts. First you will receive a call (card) from the previous player, then you can use a rune or viking, and/or pass a card to the next player, ending your turn.

The objective of the game is to get 5 different gods in your hand. Having the call (card) of a god in your hand means that the warrior (player) has been recognised by that god. When you have the 5, you should put your cards face-up on the table. The other players should do the same thing, always in the most discreet way. The person to put their cards on their table last, is the loser.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.K.S. Pagh Klingon Expansion Pack
description: This ship is the competitive prize for the "A Matter of Honor" episode Organized Play event.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: [d0x3d!] v2: a network security game
description:
Like its predecessor, [d0x3d!] v2 has players working together as a skilled team of hackers, pulling off a digital heist on a secured network to find and reassemble the pieces of their digital assets and escape before being detected by the network's administrators.

Players work against time, changing network topology, and increasingly aggressive sysadmins to score their objectives and get out before they're caught, or enough of the network is taken out of service to make reassembly or escape impossible.

The v2 version of [d0x3d!] changes the modular board - instead of square, adjacent tiles with unrestricted movement, the network is now made up of (24) hex tiles with asymmetric pathing to challenge the players by forcing them to forge a path through the system, and adds two new hacker roles (the forensics ninja and the traffic spoofer) to complement the powers of the other players.

[d0x3d!] v2 is released with a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0), allowing for the free sharing and remixing of the game.
categories: Adventure, Educational, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Light Rail: Downtown
description:
The metropolis from Light Rail is growing fast and the citizens need express lines to keep up with demand! Downtown is an expansion for Light Rail.

Downtown adds new "express line" cards which help you gain majority on your valuable routes!

Downtown also adds cards with three different buildings, making them prime targets for scoring.

name: Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #19
description:
The Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #19 is composed of 2 expansions:

Extra! Extra! Funny Pages
Include 6 Funny Story tiles. Tiles (A side up) are shuffled in with the rest of the story tiles of the appropriate matching size.

When you activate a reporter on a story space, you may claim a funny story tile if one is available. To do so, you must spend the mix of copy/photo icons shown on the funny story tile PLUS one Cartoon Card (to match the Cartoon icon). Apart from this, funny story tiles are handled exactly like standard story tiles in all other respects.

Phase 8: End of Round - One ONLY funny story tile of each size (3 and 4) may be available at any one time. If a second funny story tile of the size size is draw, discard it. This rule also applies during setup.

Aeroplanes: Charters
This adds ways to enter a city without being closed out.

Available in Game Trade Magazine (Issue 185 - Jul 2015).

name: Age of Steam Expansion: South East Australia
description:
Age of Steam: South East Australia was designed for commercial publication but is now made available as a free print-and-play expansion for the Age of Steam base game.

This map is intended to be played with 3 to 6 players, with the map reputedly playing best with 4 or 5.

South East Australia features a fundamentally new economic system, and features links that can go as high as 9.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: GTP Compet
description:
From the back of the box (translated):

GTP Compet brings the entire family together.

Suitable for all ages 6 to adult. It helps everyone learn the initial concepts of solid geometry while having fun and develops logic, dexterity, manual agility and a sense of observation. Educational and of exceptional content with numerous variants.

For two players, you must be the fastest to achieve the challenges imposed by the puzzle or 3D maps.

Solo, you need to build cubes of different sizes and difficulties from thousands of possible combinations.

name: Chad
description:
Chad was designed as an attempt to distill Chess to what the designer considered its essential aspect - the mate - and whatever was necessary to support this.

It is played on a 12x12 square grid with two "castles" marked off; these are 3x3 regions which have 1x3 "walls" on all sides. Each player has a king and eight rooks, all of which start in their castle.

Rooks move as in Chess but cannot capture in general; a rook may only capture another rook if one is in its own castle and the other is on one of the walls of that castle. However, a rook can put a king in check from any distance.

Kings can move as either kings or knights, but are confined to their own castles. They can always capture.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.R.W. Rateg: OP Prize
description: This ship is the competitive prize for "The Corbomite Maneuver" episode Organized Play event.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Haus der Sonne: Lava Tiles Mini Expansion
description:
Originally available through the 2016 Easter Basket (Brettspiel Osternest).

A mini expansion consisting of 6 lava tiles and rules to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mythology, Territory Building

name: Arctic Dash: A Narwhal Race
description:
All the tasty fish have been eaten and it's time to make the yearly trek to the wintering grounds. Dash beneath the ice and be the first to the other side.

Players take turns racing to the front. As the lead narwhal reaches the edge, she decides how the path is laid out. But don't get discouraged: foil the leader with a lucky roll and force the race along inconvenient paths through slowing seaweed or around rocky walls. "Bump" into other players in the hopes of gaining a bit more lead with a lucky roll of the dice.

Arctic Dash is designed to keep the race close, provide a few avenues for light strategy, but also not penalize younger, less experienced gamers.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Print & Play, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Jeu de mots
description:
Jeu de mots is is a French game. With the help of the letters in your hand, you must try to complete a word that contains the strike of letters appearing at the center of the gaming table. The more your word is long, the more you score.
It's similar to Scrabble, but with a dice and with cards, without game board.

name: Legenden von Andor: Das Chaos
description:
Promo card for "Legends of Andor: The last hope".
For the legends 12-16.
Randomizes the Sunrise box sequence.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Puzzle
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Epic PVP: Fantasy – Samurai Deck
description:
The Samurai Class deck includes: Samurai deck of 20 cards, class board, and 2 tokens.

Because AEG was involved with the game they added a bonus deck. AEG let their Vanguard volunteers vote on what that deck would be and they chose Samurai. So all Kickstarter backers received a FREE bonus Samurai Class deck with each copy of the game ordered through the campaign.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Chicken Roundup
description:
A fox has invaded the farmyard and now each player must get as many chickens into their coop as possible. Chicken Roundup is a two player card game of spatial rearrangement with a touch of tower defense where the players try to send the most chickens into their coop by shifting and swapping cards while observing the pecking order.

The 104 card deck consists of 100 Chicken cards in 5 colors, 2 Coop cards, 1 Fox card, and 1 Rooster card. The Chicken cards are dual use and either represent chickens in the farmyard or can be used for different actions which are used to manipulate the grid of cards in the play area. The Fox card can catch Chicken cards which can then be used for their action. Coop cards are the target that the players are trying to herd chickens toward.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Farming, Print & Play

name: Pokémon TCG: Diamond & Pearl
description:
This theme deck Includes:
1 60 card Pokemon deck
1 metallic coin
1 rulebook/card list
1 playmat
1 sheet of damage counters
1 Deck box
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck Construction, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers
publishers: The Pokémon Company International, Wizards of the Coast

name: Second World War at Sea: FDR's Lost Ships of 1937
description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

In 1937, President Franklin Roosevelt cut defense spending in response to the demands of Republicans and conservative Democrats for a balanced budget, even as unemployment continued to soar. Had he continued with his use of naval construction as a jobs program, the U.S. Navy would have had a number of additional heavy warships in 1941: two battleships, two carriers and their aircraft, and additional cruisers and destroyers.

The Midsummer 2014 Golden Journal includes 25 new laser-cut, mounted, scorchless and sootless pieces for FDR's Lost Ships of 1937: 15 "long" ship pieces and 10 aircraft pieces. And we have some scenarios for them, too.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Escape: Zombie City – Queenie 4
description: 1 new character and 2 new street tiles that can be used with Escape: Zombie City.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time, Zombies

name: Snakey Dice
description:
Play the classic mobile game "Snake" using dice & a pencil! No old mobile phone or battery-life required! Make the longest snake you can, picking up power-ups along the way to supercharge your snake.

Solo game:
You will use up to 6 custom 'snake' dice to determine how your snake moves around the 11*11 grid, eating power-ups that give you powers to manipulate your dice rolls, and even using one-time actions to portal through walls or tunnel under blockades! But be careful - every time you gain a power-up, more blockades appear on the grid. And one of the snake dice faces is a Blockade face that can't easily be manipulated and causes more blockades to appear!

How much of the board can you traverse and how many power-ups can you unlock before you inevitably crash?...

Multiplayer game:
You can now also play the game with 4 players, all manoeuvring their own snakes around the same shared board, vying for powerups and all trying to avoid the blockades AND each other! Points are acquired similarly to the solo game, but you get additional bonuses for being the first to reach level 4 of each powerup track, and the last snake standing gains a bonus 10VP! You can also try your luck on the larger 15*15 grid, giving more room to snake around (and a slightly longer game) - especially good with the max 4 players!
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Video Game Theme

name: Arcane Academy: Advanced Arithmancy
description:
Description from the publisher:

Expand your studies with four powerful, new assignment cards, four new tiles, and custom-molded, plastic exhaustion tokens and gems to add new challenges to your game in the Arcane Academy: Advanced Arithmancy expansion.

name: Special Ops Issue #7
description:
Special Ops #7 has eight articles, two ASL scenarios, two ASLSK scenarios, and Autumn For Barbarossa, a complete Standard Combat Series (SCS) game.

Articles for this issue:
FIGHTING THE MYTH - A Preview of “Baptism By Fire” (BCS). By Carl Fung.
ANGOLA! - A Shorter Scenario and Some Play Balance Options. By Bruce Monnin.
OPERATIONAL COMBAT SERIES - From Good to Great. By Dmitry Klyuykov.
BCS SHOCKERS - BCS Concepts That Might Shock A Traditional Player. By Dean Essig.
THE FINE POINTS OF PILLBOXES - By Zeb Doyle.
FROM EUROPE TO THE PACIFIC - A Preview of ASLSK PTO. By Ken Dunn.
SOVIET PLAY IN CASE BLUE (OCS) - And A Little German Strategy, Too. By Chip Saltsman.
WHICH SCENARIO SHOULD I PLAY? - Rating OCS Scenarios. By John Bowen.

ASL/ASLSK scenarios:

ASL SCENARIO O13 - Road to Rome. By Ian Daglish.
ASL SCENARIO O14 - Wiking Horde. By Brian Youse.
ASLSK SCENARIO S60 - Operation Niwi. By Joe Gochinski.
ASLSK SCENARIO S61 - Help Our Troops Out. By Brendan Deller & Sean Deller.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Tanks: Sherman (Early)
description:
The M4 Medium Tank, aka the Sherman, was the
most iconic American tank of WWII. It was well
protected, mobile and reliable, and remained the
main tank in US armored divisions throughout the
