war, with a total of more than 44,000 produced.

This pack contains:
1x unassembled Sherman
(early) tank
1x Sherman (early) tank card
1x Hero card
2x Crew card
2x Upgrade cards
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Battlefront Miniatures Ltd, Gale Force Nine, LLC

name: Larklamp
description:
"Play enchanting tabletop games made of light and shadow with the Larklamp Magic Lantern Game system. [...] The Larklamp is a unique tabletop game system handmade by veteran game designer P.D.Warne in Montreal, Canada.

—description from the publisher

The main component of the Larklamp is a lantern assembled from laser-cut wood, into which card panels are placed. Light from the lantern shines through holes in the card panels to create a game play area of light and shadow (the board, as such) on the table surface.

The game system was published in 2017. Two games were available at the time of its release (Snixtrap and Wisp in the Vale), but the publisher's web site indicates they plan to develop one new game for the Larklamp system annually.
categories: Children's Game, Electronic, Fantasy, Game System
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game

name: Arena: For the Gods! – SuperHero Shield
description: Promo card. Allows you to push faraway Heroes.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Mythology

name: New Salem: The Constable
description:
Due to the rising tide of witchcraft that is threatening to overtake the burgeoning town of New Salem, the founders have elected a Constable to help mediate the situation. Because it is feared witches may have infiltrated the founding group, the Constable will rotate among them to avoid any witch getting too much power.

The Constable will be in charge of triggering the plentiful array of new events that have become available, such as Seance, Conspiracy, and Drowning. There will be a random assortment of 7 events in each game to create a different witch hunt each time.

The Gloom and Law buildings have been replaced with new sets that add or remove Despair with each building, but have an end game effect of adding or removing a lot more if you collect the set of 3.

This expansion is included in the New Salem 2nd Edition and an upgrade kit was made for the 1st Edition. It includes a new event deck of over 20 events, 48 new building cards, a constable standee, and 8 constable badges.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Magic: The Gathering – Worldwake
description:
Ancient forces are awakening, causing this dangerous world to become even more perilous. This second set in the Zendikar block features the new game mechanic Multikicker, introduces a new version of the Planeswalker Jace Beleren, and expands on the Allies, Landfall, Traps, and Quests mechanics.

Worldwake features 145 black-bordered cards, including randomly inserted premium versions of all cards in the set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Word Mines
description:
Word Mines, the party game that makes you and your friends watch your dirty, dirty mouths.

Each round, teams dive into their deviant minds by guessing words to score points. The Cluegiver dishes out clues, but they must bite their tongue and avoid using any of the ever-seductive, forbidden words. Put your friends to shame by being on the team with the most points scored at the end.

If teachers said you wouldn't amount to much, now is your time to earn that gold star.

—description from the publisher

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Golden Stout
description:
One of three cards for The Red Dragon Inn: 2016 SlugCrew Minor Reward. This card was given away if you have registered in SlugCrew and have done their events.

This drink forces you to pay 1 gold to the inn.

A second edition of this card is part of the The Red Dragon Inn Smorgasbox (Collector's Edition).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Jogo Liga da Justiça
description:
On these game each player choose sides controlling the characters of the Justice league or the villains.
On every turn the players can do one of 5 different actions: move, attack, use a special card (usually a special attack), recover a life point or recovery a special card (both last two options only if you are in special positions in the board).
To move you must roll a die the show how much spaces you can move. To perform an attack you also roll one of two dice (one for bigger attacks and one for smaller attacks) if your character is in range (each character has different ranges where he can perform attacks). After an attack, the defender can roll a defense die. If the attack and defense die show the same color, nothing happens. If both show different, the defender loose a life of the attack die (if the defender doesn’t have those life color he loose a red point or two life points.
The team who survives wins the game.

name: Magic: The Gathering – Ixalan Planeswalker Deck: Jace Ingenious Mind-Mage
description:
Includes:

1 Herald of Secret Streams
1 Fleet Swallower
2 Kumena's Speaker
2 Jungle Delver
2 Deeproot Warrior
3 Jace's Sentinel
2 Shaper Apprentice
2 Vineshaper Mystic
2 Shapers of Nature
2 Jade Guardian
2 Headwater Sentries
1 Tempest Caller
2 Air Elemental
2 Grasping Current
3 River Heralds' Boon
4 Castaway's Despair
4 Woodland Stream
11 Forest
11 Island
1 Jace, Ingenious Mind-Mage
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: キズナと螢の物語　エピソード2：穢サレシ少年 (Story of KIZUNA and "Luciola cruciata": Episode 2 – Soul Stained Juvenile)
description:
キズナと螢の物語　エピソード2：穢サレシ少年 (Story of KIZUNA and "Luciola cruciata" - Episode 2: Soul Stained Juvenile) is an expansion to Story of KIZUNA and "Luciola cruciata". It contains 10 new scenarios, 10 new characters, and some replacement cards for the characters in Episode 1. Some of the new scenarios and characters are of a new attribute, Dark. Also included are additional materials for making custom scenarios and characters, as well as new rules and mechanics regarding the use of enemies / ORs in the new scenarios.

Awakened from a long slumber, a boy sets out for a war to know the truth. This is a story of the boy getting back his life tainted by insane gods.

Three months have passed since "Luciola cruciata" stopped Old Rebellion's invasion into the human world through the gate, which was later called Voidgate Disaster. While people are regaining composure, in a facility of Luciola cruciata, a boy woke up from a 13-year sleep, which triggers the story to proceed.

This game expands the base game of Story of KIZUNA and "Luciola cruciata" with new scenarios and new characters. It also enables you to create your own characters and scenarios.

Publisher's summary
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Star Saga: Nameless Goliath Expansion
description:
This is an add-on to the expansion "Terror in the Deep" of the scifi dungeon crawler Star Saga.
This set allows the Nexus Player to use the monster "Nameless Goliath". Requires Star Saga: The Terror in the Deep to play.

The box includes:

1 Nameless Goliath big miniature
1 Nameless Goliath Boss Card
Goliath Expansion Rulebook that includes 2 exciting new scenarios for the Terror in the Deep!

Miniatures supplied assembled and unpainted in coloured plastic.
—description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Maiden's Quest: Unicorn Savior Promo Card
description:
This is a promo for Maiden's Quest.

This promo adds a new unicorn savior card to the game and would get shuffled in with the rest of the savior cards.

On the Saved side, the unicorn displays two unicorn symbols (wilds) and the downgrading symbol. On the Left Behind side, the unicorn displays one unicorn symbol (wild)

This promo was included in Game Trade Magazine #222 (August 2018).

The card is labeled 'Promo 1'.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval

name: Xeno Siege
description:
You are the only soldier remaining. Xenomorph invaders have wiped out your entire squad. You figure the sentry guns could help thin out the Xenomorphs so you can get to some spare supplies. With the right upgrades to your combat suit, you may be able to take on the Xeno Queen and put an end to this siege.

Xeno Siege is solitaire game of resource management. Choose 1 of 5 Combat Units equipped with variable weaponry. Your unit is powered by 2 sources of energy, represented by blue and yellow dice. Roll and place these dice to activate actions to move, attack, and upgrade your combat unit.

For the final battle, face 1 of 5 Xeno Queens, each with its own special attack and defense. Will your upgraded Combat Unit stand a chance against the ferocious Xeno Queen?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Bugsies
description:
Bugsies is a fast and easy game for the little ones in which you need to be quick and sharp.

Wooden chips representing butterflies, bees and ladybugs are sitting on the colored petals, and players are holding them by their string tails. The player who holds a wooden spider cup throws the dice, and the hunt begins!

The leader throws the dice in the middle of the flower field and tries to catch the bug that was shown on the dice while the bug is still sitting on the petal. The player that is holding this bug needs to quickly figure out that their bug is about to be caught and straightway pull it away from the petal. The leader throws the dice and tries to catch the right bug until they succeed. When the spider, finally, gets the bug, the player whose bug was caught passes the string tail to the leader and takes the spider cup to become the leader in the next round.

The game has three rule options, three different levels of difficulty. You can throw one die with colors and hunt for those who sit on the petal of the given color. It's a little harder to react to the die with the colors and shapes of the bugs. And for the advanced Bugsies, there is an option with two dice. Here the task is to combine given colors and shapes.

The game ends when... in fact, it doesn't have to end. You can take a break when everyone has played enough and every player got a chance to be a spider. Thank each other for the great game, rest a little, and come back to Bugsies.

name: Kharnage: Cohen Jr.
description:
Single card, Kickstarter Exclusive, micro expansion.

4+ players


During the set up, set Cohen Junior near the Domination token.
During the Domination token distribution, the 4th player who destroyed the most cards takes Cohen Junior and deploy him in his Army for the next round, even if Cohen Junior is already in the Army of another player.
When Cohen Junior is destroyed, the card is not kept by the player who destroyed him. The card is set again near the Domination tokens.
When Cohen Junior is alone in the Army of a player, you don’t earn a Kharnage token when you destroy him.


Interaction between Cohen and Cthulhu:
Cohen is given to the 4th player and the 5th player draws the first card of the Horror pile. You must be 5 players to play with Cohen Junior and Cthulhu expansions.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Guerrillas of the Peninsular War
description:
Guerrillas of the Peninsular War is an 18-card abstract take on the standard hex and counter wargame. Players will take on the role of either the French or the Spanish Guerrillas in reenacting the bloody insurgency that took place during the invasion and occupation of Spain from 1808 to 1814. The Guerrillas must do everything they can to protect their farms and villages from Napoleon’s forces, while the French must combat these insurgents in their mission to wrest control of much needed supplies.

—description from the designer

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): The Swift Twins – Star Players
description:
When it comes to Blood Bowl, the Swift twins have got it all: the looks, the charisma, the incredible outfits and, of course, the pure skill. There must have been something in the water where they grew up! Lucien (‘The Silver Bullet’, according to his official merchandise) was the first to rise to fame, as team captain and star Blitzer of the Galadrieth Gladiators. Under his leadership they won Blood Bowl X and Lucien himself amassed a serious haul of awards and plaudits. His brother Valen later followed in his footsteps, captaining the Elfheim Eagles and setting them up as one of the most promising new teams in the league. In recent years, tired of competing to top the leaderboards, the twins have begun hiring out their services as a pair.

This multipart resin kit contains the components necessary to assemble The Swift Twins. These models are a pair of Star Players for High Elf, Dark Elf and Elven Union Blood Bowl teams – they refuse to work alone, only as a pair. This means they’re quite expensive, but worth the gold – you won’t find a finer Thrower and Blitzer. The rules for using the Swift Twins can be found in The Inaugural Blood Bowl Almanac.

This kit comes as 12 components, and is supplied with 2 32mm Blood Bowl bases.

-description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Cytosis: Epigenetic Modification  Cards Promo
description:
This promo consists of asymmetric starting cards. It was included in the Kickstarter version of Cytosis and now its available as a promo for other editions in some languages.

Each Epigenetic Modification Card gives a player a unique ability that they may use throughout the game.

It is advised not to use the Epigenetic Modification Cards until players have played Cytosis and are already familiar with the game. The Epigenetic Modification Cards may be used with the Base Game of Cytosis or combined with the Virus Expansion.

—user summary
categories: Economic, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Medical

name: Combat Commander: Europe – C3i #27 Scenarios
description:
Four scenarios from C3i magazine #27.

Scenario 117: Avanti Tredentina, Avanti! Italian vs. Russion forces, Nikolaevka, Voronezh Front, Russia, 26 January 1943

Scenario 118: No. 4 Commando German vs British Forces, Operation Jubilee, Occupied France, 19 August 1942

Scenario 119: Sky Fall German vs Partisan forces, Goeland Drop Area, Roquebrune, Gironde, France, 17 July 1944

Scenario 120: Deadly Convoy German vs. Partisan forces, Hameau de Cuad, Berson, Gironde, France, 19 August 1944
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Naruto Boruto Card Game: Naruto Shippuden & Boruto Set
description:
The Naruto Boruto Card Game features cards with original illustrations of beloved characters from the animated series Naruto, Naruto Shippuden, and Boruto. Players can assemble teams including the original Team 7’s Naruto, Sasuke, and Sakura; the new generation’s Boruto, Sarada, and Mitsuki; and the Uchiha clan. Create your own legendary ninja team, and see if the power of teamwork and friendship will help you prevail over your opponent!

The Naruto Shippuden & Boruto Set contains characters from those two anime series in two decks of fifty cards, a shared sideboard of eight cards, twelve double-sized cards, two turn-sequence cards, a play manual, and two play sheets. Cards from this set can be mixed and matched with cards from other Chrono Clash titles to create a variety of decks or to introduce multiplayer action.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Dein letzter Coup
description:
You and three friends slip into the roles of the four characters for one evening, solve the tricky puzzles together, find the perpetrator among you, solve the murder and spend an exciting and funny evening with Your last coup.

Background
Slowly your heart rate decreases, your adrenaline level returns to normal and your hands stop shaking. You and four accomplices are celebrating your successful bank robbery. You are happy about a loot of 1.1 million euros and let the corks pop in your secret quarters. But shortly after the party ends, Anna, your make-up artist, is found murdered and you are arrested. Does the murder have anything to do with the bank robbery? How well do you really know your accomplices? Unravel the secrets of the other players and find the murderer.

—description from the publisher

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Order Battletome – Fyreslayers
description:
Order Battletome: Fyreslayers is the guide to fielding a Fyreslayer army for Age of Sigmar.

This book contains a miniatures showcase illustrating colour schemes and painting advice, plus examples of painted models. It also features rules for fielding your Fyreslayer army in games of Age of Sigmar.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Senda Zen
description:
Each player represents a sage who seeks to walk a path that leads him from corner to corner. The two players draw their paths through a mobile board, based on the strategy of movements, where planning and spatial vision are fundamental. Enjoy your path and find the best solutions to reach your goal in this peaceful duel.

Senda Zen is a 2-player puzzle, in which the objective is to walk, with your sage, the necessary path until you reach your opponent's starting point.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Network and Route Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Race for the Chinese Zodiac (Kickstarter Edition)
description:
Legend has it that a long time ago, mankind was ignorant to the extent of not knowing how to count or tell the years apart. The ever-benevolent Jade Emperor wanted to help mankind out. From there, the idea of a twelve-year cycle and the naming of each year in the cycle after an animal was born.

But how should the Jade Emperor choose twelve animals from among so many in the living world, while remaining impartial? To resolve this equitably, the Jade Emperor decided to hold a race involving all animals on his birthday. The first twelve animals to cross the river and reach the Heavenly Palace will have a year named after them, in the order of how they finished the race. The race became known as The Great Race and the twelve-year cycle was named the Chinese Zodiac.

Race for the Chinese Zodiac is a board game that recreates The Great Race. Each player has a hand of eight action cards (numbered 1-8) as well as energy cards of different values and karma tokens. Each player selects one animal token and takes the corresponding animal card, which grants the player advantages during the race. All players place their animal token on the start space of the racetrack. Players assemble the dual-layered and double-sided action wheel that's used to determine the effectiveness of each action and place it in the center of the table.

On a turn, all players select an action card and an energy card from their hand, then they reveal these cards simultaneously. If the action card selected is one value lower than the player's previously played action card, the player must spend one karma token; if two or more values lower, they must spend two karma tokens. Players then resolve all played actions based on the orientation of the wheel, ideally gaining movement, new energy cards, and karma. Everyone places their played cards face up in front of themselves, then rotate the wheel clockwise by one space and start a new turn.

The first animal to complete the race earns the coveted right of having the first year of the Chinese Zodiac named after it!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Bonesplitterz
description:
Even other orruks regard Bonesplitterz with a certain degree of caution, for these savage greenskins have fully embraced the feral spirit of Gorkamorka.

Bring the savage, uncontrollable power of the WAAAGH! to Warcry with this card pack! Combined with the Core Rules and your miniatures, this set allows you to command a warband of unstoppable Bonesplitters in your skirmish battles. An abilities card lets you use deadly in-game tactics and power, while a set of fighter cards provide profiles for Savage Orruks, Savage Morboys, Savage Big Stabbas and Savage Arrowboys.

This set contains an abilities card in English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, and Russian, as well as several fighter cards. Please note that a copy of the Warcry Core Book is needed to use this set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Settlers of Catan Scenario: The Jungle
description:
Use the hidden secrets of the primordial jungle to further your quest for victory.

- After the board has been set up, replace the Desert tile with the special Jungle tile (see Additional Components).

Select a number token (in addition to the number tokens already placed on the island) whose value is 3, 4, 5, 9, 10, or 11. All players must agree on which number to use. Place this number token on the Jungle hex.

The Robber begins the game on the Jungle hex.

- Special Rules
The Jungle
During the game, players may explore the Jungle and make valuable discoveries. The discoveries will aid them in developing their principalities. When the number on the token that was placed in the Jungle is rolled on the production dice, each player with settlements or cities adjacent to the Jungle will make discoveries!

Like other land hexes, each settlement adjacent to the Jungle will receive one discovery when the Jungle number is rolled. Likewise, each city adjacent to the Jungle will receive two discoveries.

-Discoveries
Discoveries are not represented by cards as other resources are. Instead, they are represented by the Discovery Counters. Discovery Counters do not count against a player's hand limit of resources when a "7" is rolled on the production roll.

Discovery Counters can not be stolen by the Robber, can not be claimed by a Monopoly, can not be earned through a Year of Plenty, and may not be used in any trades.

Discovery Counters are used to aid the purchase of development cards. Each Discovery Counter can be used to replace any one of the three resources needed to purchase a card. Up to three Discovery Counters may be used on each card purchase.

Any combination of Discovery Counters and the three normal resources may be used.

For Example: a player may purchase a Development Card with one Ore and two Discovery Counters. Similarly, a Discovery Card could be purchased with one wool, one grain, and one discovery counter.

III. Components
In addition to all of the normal components of the Settlers game, you will need three additional components:

1 Jungle Hexagon
Discovery Counters (about 10 should be enough, the Victory Point Tokens from Seafarers work very well for this purpose)
1 additional resource number token (valued 3, 4, 5, 9, 10, or 11)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Ogre Team Card Pack
description:
Ogres are not subtle, but that doesn't mean you don't need a reference for all their special rules, stats and Star Players. This essential deck of 44 cards helps you make the most of your team, ensuring you never forget something in the heat of the game.

Contents:

Reference cards for Ogres, Runt Punters and Gnoblars
Reference cards for legendary Star Players like Morg ’n’ Thorg, the one and only Bob Bifford, Bomber Dribblesnot, Nobbla Blackwort
Blank cards to create your own players
1 team roster card, with a match record on the reverse
4 Inducement cards: Slave Giant, Firebelly, Riotous Rookies, Bottles of Heady Brew
4 Heroic Feats cards: Remember my Name, Like a Bull on the Gridiron, Ogre-Achiever, and Hungry for Maw
4 Miscellaneous Mayhem cards: Medi-Ogre, Circling Vultures, No Guts, No Glory, and Your Maw is So Big
The all-important card explaining how to use the cards, with a red card on the reverse


—description from publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Escape Room: The Game – Down Below
description:
Important: DOWN BELOW is an escape room adventure that is played in virtual reality. It can only be played with VR glasses (e.g. cardboard) with a click function.

Here we go!

You come back to yourself, the only thing you see are the colorful fish in front of you. The rest of the room is pitch dark. You can hear a strange, muffled sound. It takes a little while before you realize that you are under water, in the depths of the sea. Then you remember what happened ...

You had an argument with the sellers of an old submarine that you wanted to buy and renovate. When you arrived at the old port, you could see immediately that the submarine was not in the offered condition. This junk box was never worth 1.2 million euros! Before you even knew what was going on, the sellers pulled out a gun, took the money, and pushed you into the submarine ... That was the last thing you can remember.

An alarm suddenly sounds in the submarine, a voice drowns him out: “The emergency mode has been initiated. Open the emergency door. "A few seconds later the second instruction follows:" Another 15 minutes of oxygen. Repeat, another 15 minutes of oxygen. ”At least the emergency lights have come on. A look at the clock reveals that it is just 14:17. That means: at 14:32 you either got out of the boat or you will never escape ...

name: La Paloma
description:
Boardgame for 2 Players.

Each Player trys to encircle and capture the opponent's counters to convert them into their own.

Each Player receives 32 counters, one placing his with the red Anchor facing up, the other showing the White dove. After each player has placed two of his own stones in the middle of the game board before the start, the game continues alternately. From then on, players only place one counter in turn with the object of encicling one ore more of the opponent's counters lying in one straigt continuous row.

The game is comparable to the well-known Othello.

—user summary

name: Space Park: Spotlight – The Board Gamer's Guide to the Galaxy
description:
Originally available from the Promo Paradise Kickstarter.

4 XP

Card Text: Draw two cards from the deck of STARLIGHT STATION. Keep one and place the other back
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Queue, Rondel, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 18TraXX 2020: Great Plains Railroading
description:
TraXX. That sounds like a good name for a railroad company! Well, let’s make it so. The game, the convention that inspired it, and a key company in the game, are all called TraXX. It is the design intention that the TraXX railroad be an important feature of the game. TraXX is player-controlled and partially government-subsidized company that assumes control of troubled railroad companies. Headquartered in Denver, well, that’s where the TraXX convention is held every year, TraXX can spread out across the plains and in so doing relieve struggling company presidents of their financial burdens. TraXX 2020 is intended to be a “lively” game as many companies will come and go during the game and TraXX may be used for good or otherwise. Additional “McGuffins” include minor railroad companies, boom towns on the plains, the Bailey Yard, and Pullman cars. You’ll need familiarity with, or a copy of, the rules to 1830 to play the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Bake & Sale
description:
At last, your dream came true !!! You just started your own bakery ! During the course of the game, you will have to run your business for an entire week. Each single day you will have to get supplies, produce different types of bread and improve your baking techniques. But this is only the beginning of the story... At the end of the week, only the best bakers will have a chance to win the Baking Industry Awards.

Bake & Sale is a thinky, economic roll and write game for 1+ players of any age that was created as part of the Stuck at home contest.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Market, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Choosing Sides
description:
A 2-4 player combat fantasy, part deck building, and part card placement. On a player's turn, cards are played in a domino-style manner, using all 4 sides of the card. Each player has a starting hand of standard attack and gold cards.

Your standard attack cards will be used to reduce your opponent's life total. Your standard gold cards are used to purchase new cards and build an army of Mages, Guardians, Warriors, Alchemists, and Merchants. The purchased cards have multiple values on each side of the card. The values of each class type are as follows:

Warrior - Attack
Merchant - Gold
Guardian - Heal
Alchemist - Poison Attack
Mage - Draw a card

Bonus values are in the middle of each card and are activated if the fist matching side value and middle are the same class type. Use purchased cards to give you an advantage over other players.

The game ends and you are declared the winner when all other players are eliminated by reducing their life totals to zero.

-description from designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Pattern Building

name: Age Of Hunting Deluxe Edition
description:
Age Of Hunting Deluxe Edition is a re-issue of 狩猟の時代 (Shuryou no Jidai) with new artwork and upgraded components. It includes extra components and rules to enable two players. However, the publisher states that gamers with the original game would need the expansion set 狩猟の時代~大河の恵み~ (Shuryo no Jidai~Taiga no Megumi~) instead.

The worker placement gameplay remains the same, with prehistoric people trying to develop their settlements.
user summary

name: In the Zoo (fan expansion for Dizzle)
description:
The story of "in the zoo":
You have to collect tickets at the entrance. Then it's off to the various enclosures where you can collect food from the animals.
The penguins only have cheap fish, for which you can collect a lot of points with the blue area. The elephant is really difficult at the beginning, but there is expensive salad and the girl is more valuable than the visitor children in the other enclosures.
And what is the most disturbing thing in the zoo? Rubbish! So there are -5 points for it.

name: Rainbow Elf
description:
From 2 to 6 players face each other in games of 15 to 30 minutes, indicated from the age of 6. Through simple and intuitive rules, they will interact with the village, the forest and the sky. Each goblin has its own ability, based on its color, to use for its own benefit or to annoy others.

—user summary

name: Zoom in Kobe
description:
Travel around the city of Kobe and take the best photos to win the game!

In Zoom in Kobe, players compete in a photo contest to try to take the best photos of the city. During the game, you take photos of its beautiful locations, the iconic structures found in Kobe, and...weathercocks, one of the symbols of Kobe!

The goal of this board game for 2-6 players is to score the highest number of points to win the photography contest. When a player takes their eighth landmark photo, the game ends, then the photographer with the most points wins. Points can be scored by:


Taking photographs of the landmarks selected by the judges, with bonus points awarded if the photos contain the relevant themes of the game (different themes will be revealed for each game)
Taking photographs of the different buildings of the skyline of the city.


This game contains 75 landmark cards with beautiful illustrations of locations of the city of Kobe. First time players learning the basic mechanisms of the game, or those who want a shorter play time can play with the Photography Starter Kit version.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Horns Up!
description:
The Lacuna Coil Official Card Game

Welcome to the most action-packed party card game ever: Horns Up! Inspired by the amazing atmospheres, the most exciting and overwhelming concerts of all, like the Lacuna Coil live events.

The goal is to be the first to move from an entrance to the front of the stage. Players take turns playing Path cards to move toward the stage, or wall/ticket cards to block their opponents. Once you move, any path cards with no pawns on them flip as the crowd moves in, forcing other players to play new path cards. The first one to reach center stage wins!
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement, Take That

name: Unsolved Case Files: Honey The Bunny
description:
Rolling Hills, MO: As if being the new kid in 6th grade isn't hard enough, you have just been accused of stealing Honey the Bunny, the beloved class pet in Ms. Hartwell’s room. You swear you didn't touch him but Principal Stern won't listen.

He is about to close the case and assign your punishment when Principal Stern needs to tend to an emergency and leaves you alone in his office. As the door shuts behind him, your eyes veer over toward his desk, where the case file for his principal’s investigation into the missing bunny lies.

Can you prove you are innocent before he returns? Find the real bunny thief? Maybe even save Honey’s life and become the hero of Ms. Hartwell’s class?

In order to solve this mystery game, you’ll need to complete 3 separate objectives. First, prove your own innocence in the case. Second, identify the bunny thief, and third, find Honey. With 3 different mysteries to solve in order to play the game, this case will challenge your thinking skills as well as your investigative abilities.

To get past each step of the case you’ll need to visit an online answer page that requires you to prove you cracked each objective. If you don’t have the right answer, you can keep investigating without your task being spoiled by the right answers.

name: 異界/境界/鉄道旅行 (Another World / Another Realm / Rail Travel)
description:
You have been reincarnated in this multidimensional realm as a travel writer. You and your fellow passengers ride on the Black Comet, an inter-dimensional railroad that connects all worlds.

We will survey sightseeing attractions and interview passengers to write travel articles. The reporter who publishes the most travel articles will make a name for themselves in this world.

In 異界/境界/鉄道旅行 (Another World / Another Realm / Rail Travel), you bid on passengers who appear each round using your dice. Not only do you have to outbid your opponents, you want enough dice to make a successful roll to acquire the passenger’s sightseeing cards. You also compete with other players for souvenirs. Specific sets of cards are used to publish articles, the main source of points at the end of the game. You can earn additional points for each passenger card you acquire, and some passengers earn bonus points with specific articles. After 5 rounds, the player with the most points is the winner.

The game features a beautifully illustrated cast of characters riding on the Black Comet. All of the passenger, sightseeing, and souvenir cards are unique, with imaginative text that hints at a bigger story. Among the original ideas are references to folklore and popular media. This is a game with high production values, great art, and fun gameplay.

name: Antietam
description:
Antietam is a Grand-Tactical introductory board-wargame at the brigade level of the bloodiest single day (September 17, 1862) of the American Civil War.

–Description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Turn Order: Random, Zone of Control

name: Mixtape Massacre: Hallow's Eve expansion
description:
This expansion take the Scare character and gives it more than just a character and a couple cards.

The Scare booster is a playable character in Mixtape Massacre. In the Hallow's Eve expansion The Scare serves as the main adversary. And as you can tell by the picture above.

name: Hollywood Racers: Racers of the Lost Arena
description:
Your races can now be played by up to 6 players!

10 new Drivers! 3 new boards! 2 new Managers! 3 new gaming modes (Solo, Arena and Championship)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: Cavalcade Charge
description:
Rush in, take over the board with your creatures, then power them up until they’re unstoppable. The Cavalcade Charge Challenger Deck has all the tools you need to overwhelm opponents.

The Cavalcade Charge deck is tournament-ready, with 60 cards, plus a 15-card sideboard you can use to fine-tune your strategy between games.

The deck list for Cavalcade Charge is based on a top-tier strategy, so it’s the perfect springboard if you’re looking to get back into Magic: The Gathering (MTG).

A Challenger Deck makes a great Magic: The Gathering (MTG) starter deck, powerful enough to jump right into the competition at Friday Night Magic.

Contents: 60-card ready-to-play deck, 15-card sideboard, 5 double-sided tokens, 1 deck box
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Yamaguchi (fan expansion for Age of Steam)
description: Age of Steam: Yamaguchi is a map which integrates a catch up system, based upon the history of the area. The auction in a typical Age of Steam game is replaced with a valuation based on a player's income and number of shares issued. The typical action selection system is replaced with a rondel.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Rondel, Tile Placement

name: Murder Mystery Party Case Files: Murder Noir
description:
Director Sven Laragaard is famous for his detailed pranks and hi-jinks on set. During the filming of his latest project, entitled Murder Noir, Sven is found dead with a fake gunshot wound. Was his death a coincidence to his latest prank, or was he murdered? In this file is all the evidence in the case to help prove if someone committed a murder.

Open the Murder Noir Case File to start the crime scene investigation. The hunt is on to find a killer and it’s up to you to solve this cold-case mystery. This Case File includes all the evidence you need to solve the murder. Review every clue and piece of evidence in this unsolved mystery case file.

The Case File includes crime scene photos, suspect interviews, newspaper clippings, and much more to help you determine who committed murder.

Players need to hunt through the evidence to find the killer and determine the motive, means and opportunity of each suspect. During a murder investigation, a detective must answer the following 3 questions: 1) Motive: Who had a reason to kill the victim? 2) Means: Who had access to the murder weapon and victim? 3) Opportunity: Who had a chance to kill the victim? Is any particular person unaccounted for during the time the victim was killed?

If you get stuck anytime during your investigation, you can access misplaced case files online for hints to keep you moving. Once you think you know the solution, access complete solutions online to confirm your suspicions and make an arrest.

Enclosed you will find the following:


Case Evidence (38)
Evidence Photos (6)
Newspaper and Magazine Articles (6)
Instructions and Suspect Sheet (2)
File Folder (1)
Links to online hints and solutions

name: 7 Wonders: Edifice – Engineers Guild Promo Card
description: At the end of the game, gain 7 victory points if you have at least 1 Participation pawn from each Age.

name: Championship Drag Racing: Pro Stock Series
description:
Re-live the excitement of a Pro Stock Season.

Anything that can happen in a real life drag racing event; can and will happen with the same frequency in Championship Drag Racing. Drivers will red-light, have tremendous reaction times, blow up their engines, and even crash with the same frequency as the year represented. And as with any replay game that is worth its salt there are allowances made within the confines of realistic frequency for ANYTHING to truly happen.

In general, your results will be very close to the on-the-track action of the season represented. However, keep in mind, that this game simulates hundreds of variables that can occur in any race. As with any sport, sometimes pure luck can be the deciding factor. That’s no exception with Championship Drag Racing. On the whole, you’ll experience very realistic results. But, within the confines of a single qualifying run or elimination race, anything can truly happen!

Championship Drag Racing: Pro Stock Edition gives you every Car and Driver that made an elimination run in a season. You also get all 23 circuits rated by lane making the lane choice strategy just as important as real life. A full schedule and complete points standings are included.

Can you set a new Elapsed Time Record, or a new Top Speed Record? Order today and find out!

name: Murder Mystery Party Case File Puzzles: The Art of Murder
description: In Murder Mystery Party Case File Murder Board Puzzle - The Art of Murder, you gather and construct evidence to coordinate with the central murder board to solve the crime. A high profile case has suddenly landed in your hands...A 47 year old male and prominent gallery owner in Manhattan, was found dead in his studio. You must now work independently or with others to identify the killer’s motive, means and opportunity to commit the murder. Open The Art of Murder 6 Puzzles in 1 Murder Board Mystery to start the investigation.

name: Delvers and Wanderers: New Classes for Four Against Darkness
description:
Delvers and Wanderers is a new class book for Four Against Darkness (similar to Wayfarers and Adventurers). In these pages, you will find the following classes:
The Spearfighter; The Doomed; The Light Gladiator; The Chaos Warden; The Kukla; The Bulwark; The Vagabond; The Ranger; The Gnelf; The Murchik; The Ogre Grub-Man.

Also included nine new Secrets, new animal companions and an adventure for all levels, "Down in the Sewers of Jamash", with a full set of new dungeon tiles, written by Daniel Casquilho.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: UNO Ultimate: Add-on Pack – Ghost-Spider
description:
Ghost-Spider
Make some noise! But not too much. Ghost-Spider controls her fate by knowing what's around her at all times. Avoid danger by using her Character Power to put {!} Cards on the bottom of your deck or use it to try and get a powerful Action Card. Use her Wild Cards when you think other players are trying to go for big action plays. Use Balancing Act when other players are about to go out to force them to add cars or use it to burn cards from your hand if you have too many.

Included in this add-on pack:


One Uno Ultimate Ghost-Spider Deck!
Character specific Wild Cards!
Danger Deck Cards with Villains and more!
2 Chase Foil Cards
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Number

name: UNO Ultimate: Add-on Pack – Harley Quinn
description:
Harley Quinn
Let's get dangerous! Harley Quinn likes to get wild, and so is her playing style. Play with reckless abandon by using your "!" Cards as much as possible and always keep track of how may cards players have in their hands. Strategically select a player to draw cards or just go after anyone who looks at you wrong.

Included in this add-on pack:


One Uno Ultimate Harley Quinn Deck!
Character specific Wild Cards!
Danger Deck Cards with Villains and more!
2 Chase Foil Cards
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Number

name: Historical Mystery: Disappearance in the Sky
description:
Disappearance in the Sky is the second game in the detective series “Historical Mystery”.
London, 1934. A famous millionaire Alfred Loewanstein mysteriously disappears right from the flying plane! A year later his son finds his valet dead... Are these two accidents connected? What happened to Loewanstein after all? Dive into a journalistic investigation, which is based on the real historic events!

Players prepare 13 decks without shuffling or flipping cards.
Starting from the first card they begin to follow the instructions. As they read through the story, they will encounter icons with numbers of decks: new places and people they unlock.

Players will have 24 Moves: chances to flip one of the available cards. They will either examine places or objects, or interrogate suspects.
During the game it is important to pay close attention to the details and people’s expressions in the pictures – it will help you solve the crime!

When players are out of the Moves, they need to scan the “Question” QR-Code and give answers to a series of questions concerning the case. Then they can check right answers and the whole story description.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Timer, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Colonial 1700-1800
description: Colonial 1700-1800 is a strategic card game for 1 to 5 players that recreates the struggle between the European powers to preserve their colonial empires in the 18th century. The basic game faces France and Great Britain (2-player games), although the powers of Spain, the Netherlands and Portugal can also be involved through expansions (up to 5-player games). The game combines eurogame type mechanics (set collection, hand management, resource production) with other wargame type mechanics (direct confrontation between players, troop recruitment, territorial control of colonies, resolution of battles).
categories: American Indian Wars, Economic, Fighting, Political
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Set Collection, Zone of Control

name: Les enlumineurs
description:
A creation by Simon de Thuillières.
The aim of the game is to illuminate stories (the idea: like an old manuscrit).
To win the game, you have to use color pigments to build together a codex. You get points depending on the colors used.
Monks are used to produce the necessary pigments for illumination.
Note: the author uses jokes referring to the modern world in his codex, like "pugilat de ruelle 2" (street pugilist in the middle Ages) for street fighter 2 (modern world).

Une création de Simon de Thuillières.
Le but du jeu est d'enluminer des histoires.
Pour remporter la partie, il faut avoir utilisé des pigments colorés pour construire le meilleur codex. Les points dépendent des couleurs utilisées.
On utilise des moines pour produire les pigments nécessaires à l enluminure.
Ce que les content pour un d un âge moyen un culte bas petit serre lit lumination créa tri cieux (ce qui traduit de l ancien francois donne : ce que les contemporains du moyen âge incultes baptisèrent l'illumination créatrice).

name: Noa's ark
description:
The Flood is coming... You’ve been working on your ark for a long time and it’s finally ready to shelter the animals. You must hurry! The first raindrops are starting to fall and the animals are getting nervous.

You have to get going! Travelers talk about other arks built in distant lands... Will you be able to make your ark the best? Each round, you will reveal an Animal card and compete to be the fastest to get the same values on your dice as the ones shown on the Animal card. You may modify the result of each die using the FLICE: you must change the die face by only using your index finger!

The goal of the game is to be the player with the most victory points at the end of the game. You will gain them by obtaining Animal cards and winning Objective cards.

—description from the publisher

name: Card Catcher
description:
Card Catcher is a fun, fast, family dexterity game from Level 99 Games. You can learn it in just a moment and can play quickly with both kids and adults. Only a little basic math and dexterity are required to play.


Use your arm as a crane to drop the coin!
Win the prize the coin lands on!
Collect the best combination of plushies and capsules to win!


—description from the publisher

name: Galactic Contract: A Strategic Resource Management Game
description:
"Captains! The Galactic Construction Company (GCC) welcomes you to compete for our coveted Galactic Contract! Each of you has been outfitted with a ship from our fleet and is now expected to fulfill shipments to the GCC. Upgrade your ship and trade with planets to gain advantages; complete shipments to allow us to construct improvements. Now get to your ships!" - Galactic Contract Rulebook

THE GAME

Galactic Contract is about resource management. Your goal is to collect as many points as possible by collecting resources and allocating them strategically around the solar system.

You and 2-3 friends play as contractors each trying to prove that you deserve the lucrative Galactic Contract from the GCC. Gain points by purchasing upgrades, trading with planets, and fulfilling shipments for the GCC.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Trading

name: Colossal Cat in the Box
description:
Colossal Cat in the Box is an oversized version of the breakout quantum trick-taking game Cat in the Box, featuring a supersized version of the original game, two new expansions, and even more deluxe components.. We’ve upsized everything at least 4x their original size (except the cards, which are higher quality with a white edge on the backs), and added/replaced items for a massively improved gameplay experience. There are bigger player boards, a larger customizable central research board, bigger rules and scorepad, giant translucent plastic heavyweight double-sided player tokens, and even a huge start player mini! All of this in a standard 12 x 12 x 3 box, complete with cat-shaped GameTrayz trays for your player tokens and a GameTrayz tray for organizing all of the components in the box.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Enclosure, Hand Management, Predictive Bid, Trick-taking

name: The Exorcism at the House of Monkton Falls
description:
Take on the role of a paranormal investigator and together with your friends banish the evil spirit haunting the House of Monkton. The Exorcism at the House of Monkton Falls is a cooperative board game for 2-4 players tasked with banishing a spirit from the ancient home in Monkton.

Take control of a paranormal investigator, gather tools to complete tasks, banish the gathering darkness from various rooms in the house, and escape the dreaded spirit before dawn.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Gardens of Babylon: Deluxe Edition
description:
Gardens of Babylon: Deluxe Edition comes with content not found in the retail edition - 48 upgraded custom meeples, 144 upgraded custom seed tokens, 1 collectible coin, and The Assyrain expansion (1 black saboteur meeple, 1 black six sided die, and 36 poison tokens).

Adding a new element to the game, the Assyrian is an agent from a rival empire to the North. Seeking to undermine the glorious jewel of Babylon, he works against all guilds to weaken the wonder of the ancient world. At the end of each turn, a player may have the chance to move this lone agent. Travelling around the Garden the Assyrian may be used to poison ponds - destroying seeds currently planted there and rendering the ponds unplantable for the rest of the game!

The Assyrian can also be added to the solo mode with just a few extra rules.
mechanics: Modular Board, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Son of Doctor Esker's Notebook
description:
Doctor Esker has vanished, leaving behind only a mysterious book full of puzzles written in his own hand. Nobody has cracked his cryptic codes yet. Are you up to the challenge?

The game provides a deck of 74 cards which contain ten devious puzzles to solve. You can play through the puzzles solo or together with family and friends. Great for a party, a game night, or a lazy afternoon.

Each puzzle is composed of a set of cards. You can solve the puzzle by reading, comparing, arranging and pondering the messages, drawings, and artwork on the cards. Solving the puzzle reveals a sequence of numbers. When you think you’ve got it, gather the solution cards corresponding to the number sequence and flip them. If you see a message or image, you’ve solved the puzzle. Persevere to the end and receive Dr. Esker's greatest praise and a clue to his story.

Son of Doctor Esker's Notebook is the first sequel to Doctor Esker's Notebook. It is a stand-alone game. You do not need to have played Doctor Esker's Notebook to play this game, and you can play them in any order without any issues.

-description from designer

name: Squava
description:
Squava is a derivative of Yavalath with the same goal but different components. It is intended to be a small simple game.

It is played on a 5×5 square board. 2 players (White and Black) alternate turns placing a pawn of their colour on an empty space of the board.

Players strive to make a line of 4 pieces of their colour, but lose if they make a line of 3 before doing so. Lines can be orthogonal or diagonal.

name: Monopoly Chance
description:
Risk it all with the flip of a card! The Monopoly Chance game is the high-stakes, card-flipping version of the Monopoly game—and it only takes about 20 minutes to play! Instead of moving a token around the board, each player receives a token deck with Cash cards (no paper money!) Bankrupt cards, and strategic cards that lend an edge. Roll the die and flip over up to that many cards. Play it safe and flip over just enough cards to "cash out"—or risk it all for the big bucks. But careful, one too many flipped cards could reveal a Bankrupt card! Players compete to buy properties around the board by putting Cash cards on property spaces—and sometimes over other players' Cash. But only those with the top card at the end of the round will own that property and get to add one of its buildings to their skyline. At the end of the game, the player with the longest skyline wins!

Contents:
-game board
-4 token decks (20 cards each)
-4 reference cards
-8 Chance cards
-32 buildings
-4 skyline racks
-die
-game guide

-description from publisher's website

name: King of Crime card game
description:
2-4 player game, 15-20 minute game play. Players are the bosses of their families in the 1930's gangster era. Players hire thugs, bookies and torpedos to help them gain control of the various rackets in the city. Card play weakens/enhances family strengths duing the game. The major twist is the HIT die, played during a racket round, where every character is a target!

Mature themes (nothing you couldn't read about in any Time-Life book from the library), recommended for 12+ years.

From the designer of Battle of the bands, Backstage Pass and Portable Adventures card games.

Players (families) battle each other to control a set number of rackets, 2 of one kind of racket or 3 of any kind racket. You build your family using thug, bookie and torpedo cards, collectively known as mug cards. They're point value is your power during rackets. When a racket card is being fought over, the players all roll a HIT die (1d6),any opponent mugs in play that match your die roll (a die is printed on the mug cards), those cards are eithered flipped-unusable during this round, or discarded. The die roll is then added to the remaining value of your mugs in play, highest score wins the contract. But, you must have a mug who can control that racket, otherwise it is discarded. Family cards are played during non racket rounds to help your family or hinder the opposition.

name: Pizza Pizza Yum Yum
description:
Order up! Your shop is known for the tastiest pizza pies. But in this chaotic kitchen, miscommunications lead to mixed-up toppings and mad customers. Work together to keep the pizza party going!

Pizza Pizza Yum Yum is a cooperative game played over three rounds. Each round, you will be making two pizzas with your partner. Scoring criteria will be face-down, and communication is restricted, so you will need to be in sync for a high score!

Meld minds with your friend and tackle the challenge in Pizza Pizza Yum Yum. Over the course of the round you’ll both be playing Pizzas out, and Yum cards to determine scoring. Those Yum cards are vital, showing what ingredients score for the pizza. However, you don’t know which ones your partner plays nor where - making it a test of how well you can plan without overtly expressing those plans. Do you think you have what it takes to topple the 30-point threshold in order to secure victory? Or will your delivery end up running a little behind, leaving you short on tips for the evening? Check this one out if you enjoy quick, cooperative challenges with a friend.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hand Management

name: Blue Moon: Sea Moon
description:
Promo 31 for the Buka people.

Seemond is a Ship with Capacity 1. It may immediately be loaded with one card from your hand when played. Additionally you may play a Character/Booster/Support card on the turn that Seemond lands.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Hand Management, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: Carcassonne: The City Gates
description:
This is a fan-made expansion available for download from the Hans im Glück website.

It contains one sheet of 24 printable tiles that each contain one or more city parts with one or more city gates (in German: city gates = Stadttore).

The new rule is that roads are allowed to end at an edge of a tile that shows a city gate.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Print & Play, Territory Building

name: Tempête sur Dixmude 1914
description:
Tempête sur Dixmude (Storm over Diksmuide) is the game included in the #133 issue of Vae Victis magazine. The game simulates the battle between the Belgian and French defenders of the city of
Diksmuide and the German troops during the Battle of the Yser, in Flanders (20 October - 11  November 1914).
One player is in charge of the Franco-Belgian forces commanded by Admiral Alexis Ronarc’h (the FrancoBelgian), the other the German XXII Reserve-Korps commanded by Calvary general Eugen von Falkenhayn (the German).
Each counter represents an infantry battalion, a detachment or an artillery regiment. The map represents the region around Diksmuide and is divided in several area zones. the battleis played in 7 turns, each representing 3 days of real time.

name: Munchkin Dungeon: Dungeon of Superior Shopping
description:
The Dungeon of Superior Shopping is a promotional item from Steve Jackson Games that can be used with any Munchkin expansion that contains Dungeons. This item is larger than other Dungeons (6"x4" instead of 4.4"x3.3") and is meant to be kept separate from them. It was handed out as a promo item during the 2015 International Tabletop Day. Its text reads:

When a Portal adds a Dungeon, any player may choose to put the Dungeon of Superior Shopping into play instead of drawing a Dungeon from the deck.

While in this Dungeon, everyone can purchase not just levels, but Doors and Treasures!

On your turn, you may discard 300 Gold Pieces worth of Items to purchase one face-down door, 600 Gold Pieces for one face-down Treasure, and 1,000 Gold Pieces for one level, as usual.

When the Dungeon of Superior Shopping is discarded, place it back in the box. The sale of a lifetime only happens once a game, after all.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: La Petite Mort: Les Grands Méchants
description:
Your goal will be to be the first to obtain your Diplôme de Fauche by fulfilling 4 objectives on it.

During the game, each player will have characters in their game area who will be born, grow, age and enrich their personality or acquire skills that will bring them strengths and weaknesses throughout their lives.

This extension adds the "Big Bad guys" cards. They will serve to weaken your "nice" characters and make it easier for you to get your diploma.

Let the mowing begin!

5 new Meeples "Little Death" Yellow + diplomas (4) of the basic box in version 5 players, additional rules "The Great Evil" + 1 unpublished diploma, 10 Cards Characters ... of bad guys!, 15 new Cards Characters
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Fanhunter: Suburbia Expansion
description:
Expansion for the game Fanhunter Battles.

It allows to expand the world of Fanhunter, adding new troops and big Guys.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Wargame

name: Ginormopod 2050 A.D.: Attack of the Giant Bug Monsters
description:
GASP! at a startling vision of the world yet to come!

CHEER! for the brave people of tomorrow fighting a desperate struggle for survival!

SCREAM! at uncanny creatures too horrifying to describe, the children of the nuclear age who now wish to claim our dying planet as their unholy birthright!

As waters and temperatures rise, and coastlines sink, gigantic insects sweep across the western United States. The only thing holding them back is the Fusion Fence built along the mighty Mississippi. But will it buy us enough time to complete work on the anti-mutagen – humanity's last hope?

Ginormopod 2050 A.D.: Attack of the Giant Bug Monsters is a retro-futuristic treat, presenting a 2050 as it might have been imagined by Hollywood a hundred years earlier. The proven design team of Ryan Heilman and Dave Shaw (Brave Little Belgium, White Eagle Defiant) has returned with another action-packed game. One player controls American forces and their allies, choosing carefully where to defend, when to fall back, and how to counterattack. Their resources are limited, and every decision has a cost. Their opponent controls the Swarm, throwing an endlessly respawning supply of mutated ants, spiders, and worms, brought to life by the delightful illustrations of Wil Alambre.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck

name: Equus: Cavalry Battles of the Second Punic War, 218-203 B.C.
description:
An expansion for SPQR found in RBM/GMT's C3i Magazine Nr 10.

It features 5 cavalry battles from the Second Punic War:


Ticinus River, 218 B.C.
Maharbal's Victory in Umbria, 217 B.C.
Castrum Album, 214 B.C
Agathocles' Tower, 204 B.C.
Cirta, 203 B.C.

name: Quinto
description:
Quinto is a board and card game for ages 10 to adult. The game is easy to understand and play because it contains familiar elements found in classic games, yet challenging enough for even the most demanding board and card game enthusiast. Quinto, an advanced version of an ancient Roman board game, appeals to all ages.

Using playing cards, players compete to capture strategic positions on the game board and earn points. The object of the game is to earn the most points. Obtaining enough points to defeat your rival can be quite challenging because your opponent will try to capture and block your pieces. The powerful "Wild Kings" and the high-scoring "Quick Quintos" can change the momentum of the game.

Each Quinto game includes:

one large, quad-fold playing card;
two decks of Quinto playing cards;
133 playing chips (red, blue, white);
score cards;
Game Manual; and
Warranty certificate

Every Quinto game comes with a 100% money back satisfaction guarantee.

name: Web of Flies
description:
Web of Flies is an abstract strategy game played on a hexagonal web in which each player controls a team of 16 spiders, represented by counters with 1-8 legs to indicate their strength. (When playing with three or four players, each player has only one set of spiders numbered 1-8.)

To start the game, neutral flies and the player pieces are placed randomly around the web. Everyone but the first player can then swap the position of two of her spiders. Each turn, a player must make a capture by moving one of her spiders onto an enemy piece (or a fly). Spiders can move over friendly spiders and empty spaces, but not enemy spiders. A spider can capture an enemy spider that has the same number of legs or fewer legs. If a player can't capture, she passes for the turn, but take actions in the future if captures become possible.

The game ends when only one player has 8-legged spiders, or neither player can move. The player with most 8-legged spiders wins; in the rare case of a tie, you look at the 7-legged spiders, and so on.

name: Cadwallon: City of Thieves – Run for Your Life!
description:
Run for Your Life! is free downloadable content for Cadwallon: City of Thieves that adds a new high-stakes timer to the game. Featuring new map tiles and locations along with the variant rules to use them, Run for Your Life! brings even more variety to nightly illicit activities. This variant requires The Inn, Cry Havoc!, and A Gamble in the Dark, which are each available via the links on each of the respective BGG pages, or on Fantasy Flight's support page.

Run for Your Life! introduces the amazing Seismic Scale of Mage-Geologist Von Riechter, which can accurately predict the total destruction of Cadwallon based on the increasing strength of tremors and aftershocks. Watch the scale closely; the thief brave enough to endure fire and falling rubble might just claim the most wealth, if he isn’t killed first.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Pocket Basketball
description:
From the publisher:

Pocket Basketball has all 5 player dice on the court with the Referee die, a Defensive set die and a standard six sided dice for shot accuracy. Depending on if your player is OPEN or the defense has double teamed him, will change how easy or hard it is to score.

Games consist of 5 min quarters, or however long you wish to play. There are dice for each of the five court positions, plus 1 die for defense, 1 die for referee and 1 die for shot accuracy.

At tip off, both players roll the D6 with the highest roll winning possession. Every play begins with the PG being rolled first. He will either PASS to a team mate, SHOOT for 3pts or DRIBBLE

PASSING from the PG will be to the team mate shown by a letter. You can pass as many times before the SHOT CLOCK times out.
Each other player has a PASS option which they can CHOOSE which player to pass the ball to. The CENTRE and SMALL FORWARD have a special ability after they pass, however, it can only be used if the receiving player takes a shot on his next action.

CENTER - Pass/tip in - if the player that receives this shoots and misses, the player can roll again to try and meet the DEF level as a tip in attempt
SMALL FORWARD - Pass/rebound - if the player that receives this shoots and misses, the player can roll again with the SF die as the rebound was made


If either of these two pass, and the receiving player also passes, the tip off/rebound are no longer able to be used.

SHOOTING - when a type of shot is shown on a player's dice, this indicates he is attempting to score. Your opponent will then roll the DEFENSE die to set his defense. Depending on the DEFENSE level, the SHOOTER must roll equivalent or above to score a basket.

DRIBBLE - just reroll the same dice again. If you roll DRIBBLE 3 times before you take a shot, the shot clock has timed out and it's a turnover to your opponent's PG

UNCONTESTED SHOT - except for your PG, all 4 other team mates have a special shot indicated with a STAR. The DEFENSE can not roll and the Shooter scores an automatic basket.

DRAW - when rolled on the DEFENSE, means a FOUL has occurred on the shot. If the shot is good, the player will go to the free throw line for an extra point chance. If the shot misses, the player then goes to the line for either 2 or 3 FREE THROW attempts.

FOUL - when rolled on the DEFENSE, your opponent will roll the REFEREE dice to determine the infringement. Travel/Dbl dribble/Charge are all Offensive fouls and result in a TURNOVER to your opponent's PG. Personal/Flagrant foul results in a stop in play and restart by the OFFENSIVE player's PG
Ball up - both players roll their dice to see who gains possession from the jump.

name: Toast!
description:
Update: Toast! was not funded on Kickstarter, but the design was taken up by Horrible Games and developed into Raise Your Goblets.

Toast! is themed around ruthless medieval nobles trying to poison each other during the toasts at a royal function. The King has decreed a bizarre etiquette to be followed, in an attempt to discourage this behaviour. However, instead it has just turned the practice into an art and a sport, with each (surviving) noble having developed a particular expertise.

In a round of play, goblets are arranged in a circle in the middle of the table, one in front of each player, such that players can’t see their contents. Players take turns to secretly place wine, poison or antidote tokens into the goblets, switching the goblets around, or using their characters special abilities. Each player has a target, and their aim is to ensure that, when the round is ended by someone calling for the Toast and the players all ‘drink’, their target’s goblet is poisoned and theirs is safe!

The game supports 2-12 players. The main rules are for 4-6 players, there are special rules to extend up to 12 players (where pairs of players play as a noble and their wine-taster), and there is a separate game mode for 2-3 players (a sort of Russian Roulette with goblets).

name: Golem Arcana: Gudanna – Raiders of the Blasted Land
description:
From the publisher:

Three new Golems for your Golem Arcana Army:

The Burrow Claw is a highly evasive Warsprite, using its Tunneling Blast to slip away from a melee opponent, ending up in any Region with No Cover that it chooses.
The Terra Naga is indispensable for dislodging enemies from key locations on the map -- using Scattering Sirocco, a short-range AOE, to displace all Golems from a Region and then using a free displacement on itself, possibly to take their place!
The Ravager relentlessly moves through the enemy's lines, leaving destruction in its wake by combining its passive ability that cools down movement when entering an enemy Region and its Duststorm Blade that causes damage to enemies when the Ravager leaves an enemy Region.

Also included are three TDI Golem Cards (matching the figures), two double-sided Victory Point tokens, and four new Relic Cards that can be used to augment any Golem army:

Zyama’s Anointing: allows a Golem to sacrifice some of its own Health in exchange for more Damage on its next attack.
Davati’s Sacrifice: offers a temporary boost to damage equal to the Golem's armor value, but permanently reduces armor to zero.
The Lantern of Valli: summons forth the Arena of Valli, a Construct that boosts Accuracy and Damage to all Melee attacks in the region.
Metr’s Blood Well: calls forth the blood of the earth, allowing its controller to gather Mana from that region until it is destroyed.
categories: Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Stalin Moves West
description:
Stalin Moves West is a two-player strategic level hypothetical simulation of a potential World War II campaign in which the Third Reich did not invade the Soviet Union in 1941 and instead Stalin launched an invasion of central and western Europe. The map depicts the Soviet Union (USSR), the Greater German Reich, the General Government (German-occupied Poland), Hungary, Romania, and Slovakia as they were in 1941.

Each hex on the map represents about 70 kilometers from side to opposite side and each game turn represents one month in summer and two in winter. Units are corps/armies with supply, leadership and air support covered as unique support units on the map. The uncertainty of the effect of the purges is depicted by the Soviet units being deployed to show their “untried” status, where even the Soviet player is unsure of the combat value of any given unit. The game has several different scenarios which look at various situations in which such a war might have occurred.

Published in World at War #58 (Feb-Mar 2018).

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 1-2 months
Hex: 43 miles / 70 kilometers
Units: Corps to Army

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" full color map
One dual-side printed countersheet (209 5/8" counters)
One 16-page Stalin Moves West rulebook

Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 2-4 hours

Players will need to provide one 6-sided die to play

name: Transformers Trading Card Game: Blaster vs. Soundwave Set
description:
The Transformers Trading Card Game is a battling card game designed for two players. Players build a team of Transformers character cards and power them up with a customizable deck of battle cards. Transformers character cards are twice the size of standard playing cards; they can be flipped from bot mode to alt mode and back, and they feature premium printing treatment on one of their sides. The deck of battle cards features Action and Upgrade cards to enhance Transformers character cards.

The Blaster vs. Soundwave Set contains the cards for two players to play these two iconic characters against each other right out of the box. Included are two large foil character cards (Blaster and Soundwave), 6 small foil character cards (Eject, Ramhorn, Steeljaw, Buzzsaw, Frenzy and Ravage), and two 40 card decks.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: Expedition of Death
description:
This expedition in the Peruvian jungle uncovered a real sensation – The royal priestesses’ burial chamber. But while the excavation team were still busy celebrating their success in the evening, the famous archaeology professor Mary Stonerock was found dead.

You had expected this expedition to be nothing less than an archaeological miracle. For two months, you’ve all been in the Peruvian rainforest looking for the remains of the Moche people, an advanced South American civilization that preceded the Incas and has hardly been studied.

You knew you were on the right path, as you had found countless small vases, tools and other artifacts over the past few days. Late in the afternoon, you finally found the tomb of the priestesses. This important find would have been another milestone in the career of Mary Stonerock, the US’s youngest full professor of archaeology.

Mary decided to celebrate the find with a hearty feast and an evening of drinking. You raised a toast to your joint success and speculated as to what the tomb, to be opened the next day, might contain. But the evening took a tragic turn when Christian discovered Mary’s body at around midnight in the entrance of her tent.

Director Gustavo Navarro has since notified the police using the camp’s radio. They are due to arrive at the remote excavation site in a few hours. Until they are here, you are all on your own in solving the mystery. What happened? How could this expedition have ended so tragically?

What is a murder mystery game?

You and your guests slip into the roles of the main suspects of an exciting murder case. The objective of the game is to convict the perpetrator – one of the people sitting with you at the table. This can only be achieved if the players discuss the course of events amongst themselves and compare their experiences of what happened. But be careful: Each character (including you!) has their own dark secrets which they’d be better off keeping to themselves.

You all gather in the wake of the crime and attempt to piece together your memories, with the aim of identifying the perpetrator. In each round, you recall more and more about the circumstances of the crime, as each round deals with a different period of time from the evening the crime was committed. At the end, everyone votes on who should be handed over to the police as the suspect.

Culinario Mortale is a highly interactive game. There are only a few rules, and no pre-prepared dialogue. The focus is on working through the puzzles and discussing the events together.

Alongside a well-structured game manual, each game contains game booklets for between five and eight characters (the number of players for each game can be found on the packaging and here on our website). In the game booklets, each guest will find their personal clues and a description of their role. Each game booklet also includes a brief overview of how the game works. As such, all players can jump right in. The support code included with your Culinario Mortale game will allow you to download the role descriptions in advance from our website in PDF format, and easily send them to your guests via email.

GAME CONTENT:
1 Game Manual, 7 Game Booklets, 1 Incident Booklet (includes of prologue, incidents, solution), 7 name badges, 1 support code

— description from the publisher.
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Fiesta de los Juegos
description:
Fiesta de Los Juegos is a special edition adaptated from popular board game Fiesta de los Muertos. Instead of finding deceased celebrities, you'll have to find board game names. This very limited edition celebrates the board game industry and will be available exclusively at the french game event Festival des Jeux de Cannes 2022.

Each player chooses a word to describe their starting board game themed card. But beware, this word will pass from hand to hand, and change little by little… Indeed, each turn players will read the clue word written by their neighbour, erase it and write another word related to that clue for the next player around the table. Looking at the final words after they have been passed and altered four times and the starting cards, will everyone be able to find the right connections?
