Hex: 0.75 miles / 1.61 kilometer
Units: Battalion to Regiments

Game Inventory:
One 11x17" full color map
One single-side printed un-mounted countersheet (224 1/2" counters)(mounted counters are optional)
One 6-page rulebook
One Player Aid Chart (TEC/CRT)

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Low
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 1.5 to 2 hours
publishers: High Flying Dice Games, Schutze Games

name: The Last Raid
description: Simulates the 955 Battle of Lechfeld (near Augsburg, Germany) which pitted Western-style heavy cavalry against Eastern-style hit and run mounted archers. For two centuries, the deadly mounted Magyar archers had been raiding west, out of the Hungarian plains, devastating German duchies and reaching into the south of France. Hearing another raid was on the way, King Otto gathered an army of heavy, armored cavalry and marched to meet them. Uses the Simon Says game system which is similar to Kingdom for a Horse. 11x33 inch map, 200 counters that have to be mounted and cut.

name: FleetBoard
description:
Players must pick up goods and deliver them, coordinating their routes, as in Auf Achse.

There are some differences from other games of this type.
The traffic situation is changing. Gas consumption and fleet maintenance are considered.

FleetBoard is Mercedes-Benz truck division's system to manage these factors in real life. The game was published as a promotion for the system.

name: Top-Secret
description:
Hypothetical conflict in the Middle East.

Attack your opponent with tanks, rockets and find a way to build an atomic bomb to raid his Headquarter but protect your industries and precious oil-wells too!

Game comes with a lot of metal miniatures (war units, industries, food storages, oil-wells) an abstract board to battle a chess-like war, cards representing wealth (food, oil and industry production).

name: Second World War
description:
Strategic level game covering WW2 in Europe, North Africa and the Middle East.

The game was created as an introduction to military simulation for students taking the conflict simulation course run by its' designer at King's College London. As such it was designed to be the simplest possible representation of the war.

Game consists of
-12 page rulebook including examples and historical commentary. Sections covered are; The map, The units, Sequence of play, Movement, Tactical combat, Strategic combat, Production, Neutrality, Victory and Initial set-up.
-Map intended to be printed at A4 size.
-50 double sided counters.

Movement is by large areas, combat by die rolling. Strategic warfare is represented in abstract fashion, attacking industrial production.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Hail Caesar!
description:
Hail Caesar! is a miniatures gladiator game created by David P. Gundt and his local gaming club, Melees Gloriosus.

"Hail Caesar!" is a simple "beer and pretzels" type gladiator game in which character have simple statistics (strength, stamina, speed, dexterity, skill) and are pitted against each other.

What really makes the game fun is the amount of research that Mr. Gundt put into the game. Rules for ten different types of gladiators and a great plethora of weaponry and armor are included with the game. Perhaps the most interesting are the rules included for the Andabates type gladiator, a gladiator that fought blind with a full-head helmet, sort of like Luke Skywalker in "Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope."

Hail Caesar! is a fun "beer and pretzels" gladiator game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Warrior Heroes
description:
This is a fantasy mass battle game, cousin to the skirmish game Mayhem: Warrior Heroes.

This is a set of rules for recreating the battles and campaigns of the mythical land of Talomir. Peopled by both heroes and monsters, Talomir is a world where battle magic thrives, but the fate of nations can be decided by the strength of one right arm. As such, it is a real departure from what you may be used to. It doesn’t have a rigid, traditional turn sequence where players alternate moving and firing with perhaps a melee or two at the end. It is much more fluid than that with both players moving figures, firing, and fighting as a result of various reaction tests. Forget perfect plans for few prearranged plans will survive past first contact! Opportunities arise as fortune smiles on one side then the other. The victory will go to the player who learns to exploit these situations.

Included in the game is an innovative campaign system for the nation states of Talomir. Both the mass battle system and campaign system are unusually solitaire friendly.

name: Tactiques Issue #1
description:
This is the first issue of "Tactiques, Le magazine des fanatiques d'ASL". It includes 10 ASL scenarios and several articles about ASL. It is no longer in print, its successor is the magazine "Le franc tireur".

Publication date: December 1991.

Contains 43 pages devoted exclusively to ASL. Index of contents for this issue:

-Dossier: Le Canada dans la guerre
-Organisation: La 90.Panzergrenadier Division
-Technique: Commme utiliser l'Opportunity Fire
-Debutants: Des regles simplifiees pour aborder ASL
-Aide de jeu: Une sequence de placement et de jeu complete
-10 ASL Scenarios:

ASL TAC1: Vous descendez a Maleme?
ASL TAC2: Entre le marteau et l'enclume
ASL TAC3: Retraite Malaisee
ASL TAC4: Je me souviens
ASL TAC5: La batterie de Merville
ASL TAC6: Contre-attaque a Villers-Bocage
ASL TAC7: Piege a Carpiquet
ASL TAC8: Balade a Champfleur
ASL TAC9: Stützpunkt Lezongar
ASL TAC10: Debout les bambins!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Constelaciones
description:
Constellations is a game of strategic spatial sense for 2 people on a board that is created in each game.
Players are astronomers and on a board of night sky must unite stars to each form his own constellation. When playing, they try to prevent to the opponent from developing their own constellation. When a person has no play possible in his turn, he loses the game.

Constelaciones es un juego de sentido espacial estratégico para 2 personas sobre un tablero que se crea en cada partida.
Los jugadores son astrónomos y sobre un tablero de cielo nocturno han de ir uniendo estrellas para formar su constelación. Al mismo tiempo han de intentar impedir al contrario que haga crecer la suya. Cuando una persona no tiene ninguna jugada posible en su turno, pierde la partida.

Awards

Finalist at design contest JugarxJugar Ciutat de Granollers09

Winner of design contest EConcurso09 Jugamostod@s

name: Railway Rivals Map I: Ireland
description:
A map for use with the Railway Rivals game.

The map covers the whole of the island or Ireland. It is smaller (fewer hexes) than most maps, and has lots of hills and loughs, making it tough for beginners, unless the leapfrog variant is used.
publishers: Fairmount Gaming Simulations Co., Rostherne Games

name: Bee-Siege
description:
The Bees aren’t happy! For some reason, there’s a poor pollen crop this year and Winter is fast approaching. Reluctantly, Queen Yellow-Tail signals her swarm, “Sneak over to the neighbour’s and seize some of their flowers”. But Queen Brown-Eyes has a few ideas of her own…

Bee-Siege is a two-player game of strategic positioning, lasting eight rounds (allow one hour to play). Players co-ordinate their small swarm of Bumblebees, Queens, Honeybees and Workers by selecting order tiles from a shared pool. The player with the most points at game’s end is the winner.

Note: No Bees will be harmed during the course of play!

name: Mecanisburgo: Expansion 2 – Mutants on Mars
description:
Expansion 2 adds a new game board for Mars which allows agents to exploit the Red Planet.

Two new factions come with the expansion: Metaluna & The Freedom Mutants League. The Freedom Mutants League has a complete different agenda than the others corporations. They win if the city is destroyed!

The expansion also includes 55 new cards.

Requires Mecanisburgo & Mecanisburgo: Expansion 1 – Moon and Ceres.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Star Blazers Technical Manual and Warship Recognition Guide
description:
From the Author's Preface:

This manual provides players of the Star Blazers Fleet Battle System with detailed explanations of the warships and battle craft used in the game. This is also the first English language reference work to provide a comprehensive catalog and history of the spacecraft and weapon systems portrayed in the television and movie series.

The hardware included in this manual is drawn from the first two Star Blazers television series and their associated movie releases. The statistical data was translated with permission from the publications of Academy Press, a company owned by Yoshinobu Nishizaki of Voyager Entertainment, Japan.

From the Back of the Book:

At last, the definitive reference book for Star Blazers fans! This data book is the first ever to bring together the ships and weapons of all three space powers from the acclaimed science fiction animated series.

Over 490 illustrations depict the mechanical exterior views of ships of the Earth Defense Force, the Gamilon Empire, and the White Comet Empire, as well as battle craft, support craft, weapons systems, and battle maps.

Fleet organization, command structure, weapons systems, and tactical doctrines of each power are covered in extensive detail. Mission profiles of all ships and battle craft describe the purpose and role each vessel serves in its respective fleet.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Confrontation: Creatures of Dirz Army Book
description:
From the back cover,

"The Army Book: Creatures of Dirz is a supplement for Confrontation: The AGe of Rag'Narok. It contains everything you need to playwith or battle against the alchemical laboratories of the Scorpion."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: EndBreaker! SCG: Build & Break
description:
In EndBreaker! SCG: Build & Break, a deck-building and card-selecting game, you are a leader of a brigade of EndBreakers, those who can gaze into the eyes of others and see their ending in a scene from that person's new future, with critical implications.

This game is set in Lanceburg, one of the city states of the world of EndBreakers, a world threatened by the Masquerades: those possessed by a mysterious power, the Thorns. You recruit party-members (Job cards) in the tavern, learn powerful skills (Ability cards), clear missions (Scenario cards) and battle against monstrous evils (Masquerade cards). You earn victory points (Dalc cards) by clearing scenarios or winning battles.

The Masquerade cards are revealed one by one during game play, and each player must fight this monster, earning VP according to how well they do. After three battles are resolved, the game ends and the player with the most VPs wins.

name: China: Venezia
description:
Expansion map for China / Web of Power, part of Schacht's 1-year campaign of releasing a new expansion map every month. Available for online play at www.michaelschacht.net.

Download the file at michaelschacht.net/p/chinaVenezia.jpg
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Kleine Helden promo card "Weißer Ritter"
description:
A promo card for Kleine Helden.

"Weißer Ritter" is German word for "White Knight". The card can be used as an additional hero for Kleine Helden.

These are the stats of the "Weißer Ritter":
Armour: 0
Magic attack: 0
Magic defense: 4
Physical attack: 5
Physical defense: 6
Bonuses: resist curses +2, blades +1 damage

name: Elemental Clash: The Master Set
description:
In ancient times long gone by, when the veil between the world of the humans and the realm of magic was thinner, almighty wizards battled each other in epic duels to determine who was the master of sorcery and arcane wisdom. Armed with a Spellbook and with the aid of the enchanted Element-Stones, the sorcerers summoned fantastic Creatures and magical Spells. A wizard who had no more pages left in his Spellbook would eventually have lost the magical battle of wits.

The aim of the game is to reduce the cards in your opponent's card-deck (or Spellbook) to zero by using the Spells and Creatures in your Spellbook. Players take turns that always follow the same structure. For each point of damage a Player receives through Creatures or Spells, he puts the top card of his or her deck on his Discard Pile (or Archive). If a player is unable to draw a card, he loses immediately.

Elemental Clash: The Master Set is the ultimate deal well-suited for beginners, while still interesting for the veterans. It contains 80 different cards, over 270 in total, carefully selected by the designer from all previous sets of Elemental Clash. The "Master Set" also features updated, state-of-the-art illustrations done by an international cast of talented artists.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Tornado!
description:
Sound the alarm! A huge Tornado! is wreaking havoc on the outskirts of Tornadoville, USA! Rescuers from the elite Tornado! Rescue Unit have been sent to help. You are one of these Rescuers. Get ready to clear debris and free family members from the rubble, but beware the Tornado! Its particular brand of cyclonic evil can block you from finding people in need. Who will be the best Rescuer? Only time will tell!

In Tornado!, two players take turns as the Rescuer and as the Tornado! As the Rescuer, players will flip over cards and remove debris while hunting for and saving trapped family members to earn points. But the Tornado! player will attempt to block the Rescuer’s every move by throwing cubes onto the playing field. Not only can the Tornado! keep the Rescuer from scoring points, it can force the Rescuer to score points for the Tornado!
publishers: Baked Fresh Daily Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Fantastiqa: Ravenous Raven Promo Cards
description:
A set of 3 Kickstater exclusive cards that were available during the Fantastiqa: Enchanted Edition campaign.

It reads:
Each player must choose one card in her hand to feed to the Ravenous Raven. Release the chosen card from play.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection

name: Petite Pastiche: Extra Commissions #2
description:
This is the second of three mini-expansions for Petite Pastiche. Only compatible with the "Petite Pastiche" edition, not with the first edition or international edition of Pastiche.

This expansion pack consists of 3 extra commission cards, with artworks by George Seurat, Claude Monet, and Mary Cassatt.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Educational, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Last Starfleet: Kickstarter Pack
description:
Things being added to Kickstarter pledges in addition to core game:

Orbit Deck Expansion - Exodus of Sol, reinforcing waves of helpful, but untrained and traumatized, refugees. KS Exclusive!

Core/Deluxe Game Ship Booster - Every copy of the game will include an additional card for each of the included ship decks!

Stickers Gift! - Everyone receiving the core game will also receive 10 ovular 2x3" Kickstarter-exclusive Last Starfleet badge stickers. Because... stickers!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Visby: Der Abt
description: Visby: Der Abt is a small expansion for Visby. The Monk now gains seals (victory points) instead of wares for the number of already played cards. The end of the game requires more seals and therefore the expansion comes with an additional seal card to indicate the amount of seals you have.

name: セブン (Seven)
description:
セブン (Seven) is a reimplementation of 7 Symbols, and 7 Nations, a trick-taking game with a unique deck of 49 cards in which the cards are in seven suits with one suit going 1-7, the next 2-8, and so on up to the final suit of 7-13. Thus, the deck has seven 7s in it, and to win the game, you need to capture the most 7s.

セブン also includes rules to two other games played with the same deck.

name: Guards Against Insanity: Edition 2
description:
An Unofficial Cards Against Humanity expansion.

Includes 112 NEW cards (80 White cards & 32 Black cards)

Professionally printed Casino Quality Linen Finish cards, 100% compatible with Cards Against Humanity.

name: Ogoola Karuta: 1-100 English Complete
description:
Ogoola Karuta is a westernized version of a 400-year-old Japanese card game called Hyakunin-isshu Karuta. The game is sometimes described as intellectual martial arts. It is about listening and being extremely focused and fast, just like the Samurai with their swords. Only here you fight with cards instead.

The game is comprised of two decks of cards, the Reader deck and the Player deck. Cards in the Reader deck contain short poems or poetry quotations while cards in the Player deck contain only the second part of these poems. To begin the game, a Reader is chosen (or you may opt to use the Reader app) and the players are divided into two teams sitting/standing on opposite sides of the table or play area. The Reader shuffles the Reader deck and the Players mix, split evenly the Player deck between the teams and place them face-up in 3-4 rows in front of them. The Reader will read the complete poetry quotation on the reading cards and the player that finds the matching playing card first takes that card and puts it aside. If the card taken was on your opponent's side, you must give one card from your side to your opponent. The first team that has no cards left on their side is the winner (you must get rid of all your cards first, to win).

The game is set in Japan during the Genpei war (1180-1185). In order to win the war, you need a strategy. Place the cards you are familiar with close to you (in the beginning it is normal that none of the cards are familiar). If you know what cards your opponent is familiar with, place those cards as far as possible from them inside the playing field. Since the reader or app will always read the complete quotation, you do not need prior knowledge of the poems. Strategically place the playing cards in a way that you can find and take them quickly such as laying them alphabetically or categorize them under the same first words.

Ogoola Karuta Poetry Game is not a translation of the original Japanese game. In this edition, we have selected 100 quotes, new and old from well known poems written in the English language. It is the first western version of Hyakunin-isshu Karuta, which means Karuta: 100 poems by 100 poets.
categories: Card Game, Medieval, Wargame, Word Game
mechanics: Action Queue, Memory, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Take That

name: Dragon Kings
description:
Dragon Kings is a deck building game consisting of 55 cards. In Dragon Kings, players develop a deck by using mana to purchase and cast new Spells/Dragons from the Dragon Pit. The Dragon Pit is the set of powerful neutral cards that belong to neither player, placed in the center of the play area. With the aid of the Dragons and Spells purchased from the Dragon Pit, the players' ultimate goal is to reduce their opponent's life to 0.

Dragons Kings is a 2-player game (or 4 players with 2 decks) that introduces players to deck building.

name: The Dragon & Flagon: Secret Room!
description:
Promo coaster released at Gencon 2016

Spilled Ale:

Place the Spilled Ale side of the coaster on the board. It covers a 3×3 square area. These are called ‘Ale’ squares.

Any character that moves into an Ale square (and is on the floor) slides until they move off of the coaster, or hit a table, wall, or another character. This only counts as one square of movement. They may continue moving once they exit the coaster or are stopped.

If they hit a table, they stop sliding. If they slide into a square with another character, both characters start sliding until they are both no longer on the coaster, or hit a table or wall.

If player is Knocked Back onto an Ale square, they slide as above.

Rules for POKER TABLE:

The Poker Table side of the coaster can be used one of two ways:

As a Poker Table: Use two Large tables to support the Poker Table on the board. It is a 3×3 table, and is subject to all Table rules. It may be pushed, flipped, etc. The two tables that are supporting it are considered part of the Poker Table.

For Ilicit Gambling: The coaster is placed off of the board. Any time a character has to give reputation to another character, and the Coaster has three or fewer reputation on it, place one Reputation from the bank on to the coaster, in addition to the normal effects of the Action.

If the coaster has four or more reputation on it, the next time a character gains reputation they also take all the reputation from the coaster.

If an action causes multiple characters to give reputation, one reputation per character goes on the coaster. A character may only take the Reputation when it has at least four at the start of the Action.

name: MERCS: Recon – Lost Margin
description:
Take a unique vacation among the abandoned building of the Lost Margin. Enjoy breathtaking scenery as the MERCS fight their way through endless hordes Lost Margin gang hell-bent on destruction.

Expand the MERCS: Recon experience with this mission pack. Each expansion contains tiles, cards, and miniatures unique to each mission pack.

Box Contents:
• 3 Plastic Raiders
• 3 Plastic Thrashers
• 2 Cards
• 4 Double Sided Tiles
• 1 Reference Sheet
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Legends of Andor: Tavern Turmoil
description:
"A long time ago Erloth used the scraps of his trashed barrow to build a stall. He sold mead and wine there and after some time it developed into a little hut - The 'Drunken Troll Tavern.' Merchants, voyagers, and heroes frequented it freely and Gilda, Erloth's granddaughter, was well-known and liked.

Many times creatures ranged Andor but neither had they attacked it nor would anybody believe this the case. Until that fateful morning, as a farmer approached the heroes and gasped:

'Come quickly! The Drunken troll ravages the tavern!'"

This legend was designed by the users of the official German-language Andor forum from May to September 2014. Made up of over 70 cards it is one of the longest legends of Andor, with high variability, and it uses components from New Heroes and The Star Shield in new ways. Thank you to all the fans who contributed ideas and opinions.
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Apocrypha Adventure Card Game: Contract Poison Promo Card
description: Promo Card received at GenCon 50 for those who purchased Apocrypha Adventure Card Game. The promo card is titled Contract Poison (1007 Promo) and it has 27 different versions / actions based on signatures obtained on the card. Each "version" and associated action can be used only if the corresponding creative's signature is on your copy of the card. This promo card uses the cost “Contract,” which means that you may slot it and use its “while contracted” power, but must sacrifice it from your halo at the end of the mission. Based on the signature(s) received, the appropriate action can be taken.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: 2WW
description:
2WW is a card game about World War II, the result of a careful historical research that we hope can be appreciated by fans of this subject. It uses an easy and completely-innovative gaming system. In never-repetitive game sessions, you can be one of the main players of the conflict, use the most horrible but celebrated events in your favour, and recreate legendary armies and units. It will be decisive the moment in which you decide to go to war, but above all the strategy that you will pursue to achieve the ultimate victory (economic or military).

—description from the designer (translated)

2WW è un gioco di carte sulla seconda guerra mondiale frutto di una attenta ricerca storica che ci auguriamo possa essere apprezzata dagli appassionati dell’argomento. Esso utilizza un sistema di gioco immediato e del tutto innovativo. In partite mai ripetitive, potrete impersonare i maggiori protagonisti del conflitto, utilizzare gli eventi più nefasti e celebri a vostro favore e ricreare eserciti ed unità a volte leggendari. Sarà determinante il momento nel quale deciderete di entrare in guerra ma soprattutto la strategia che perseguirete per arrivare alla vittoria finale (economica o militare).

—description from the publisher (Italian)

name: Revenge of the Dictators: Donald "the Drumpf" Dictator Promo Card
description: This is a card first given out for free at Essen SPIEL 2017. It adds the role of the fictious Dictator Donald "the Drumpf".
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Cousins' War: Battle of Tewkesbury Promo Card
description:
This promo card is called 4 May 1471 - Battle of Tewkesbury.

The Battle of Tewkesbury is only fought if the Battle of Barnet happens. Before the winner of the Battle of Barnet places their cubes at the end of the battle, the loser of that battle can choose to fight the Battle of Tewkesbury immediately.

The winner of the Battle of Tewkesbury may then place their remaining cubes from the Battlefield into any region(s) on the board splitting them how they choose. The cubes may not return to the Reserve. The winner also places the Battlefield card into their Reserve, as normal for winning a battle. Therefore, the Battle of Tewkesbury could prove decisive in resolving The Cousins’ War.

name: River Plate & Denmark Strait
description:
Dreadnoughts & Battlewagons provides a low complexity ship-to-ship combat system allowing players to explore historical and hypothetical encounters during the age of the super dreadnought.

Each counter depicts a single ship or the information markers required to denote a ship’s damage, special ship movement, or configuration. Ships are rated for weight of fire, range, structural integrity, maneuver, speed, and special capabilities.

The Battle of the River Plate simulates the naval encounter between the German Panzerschiff Admiral Graf Spee and the British Royal Navy Cruisers HMS Exeter, Ajax, and Achilles on 13 December 1939. The historical outcome led the Graf Spee to seek shelter in Montevideo, Uruguay, where she was subsequently scuttled.

The Battle of Denmark Strait simulates the encounter between the German battleship Bismarck and a British squadron on 24 May 1941. The historical outcome sent HMS Hood to the bottom and damaged HMS Prince of Wales, but Bismarck suffered seemingly minor damage that would lead to her eventual destruction.

—description from the publisher

name: Rally 'Round the Flag: Battles of Perryville and Stones River
description:
"I was in every battle, skirmish and march that was made by the First Tennessee Regiment during the war, and I do not remember of a harder contest and more evenly fought battle than that of Perryville. If it had been two men wrestling, it would have been called a 'dog fall.' Both sides claim victory—both whipped." - Private Sam Watkins, 1st Tennessee Infantry

In September, Braxton Bragg's Army of Mississippi out-maneuvered Don Carlos Buell's Army of the Ohio and invaded Kentucky. Although victorious in two battles, Bragg found his army out of position, low on supplies, and with no more than 1,000 Kentuckians joining the ranks. Buell was forced to seek out Bragg although his army was inexperienced. Outside Perryville, the two armies blundered into each other. A short but brutal battle followed that left neither side satisfied. The Union failed to utilize their numerical advantage, while Bragg withdrew from Kentucky. The result was a narrow Union victory, although Buell was removed from command and middle Tennessee was again in Confederate hands.

“This army does not retreat.” - George Thomas when asked if the XIV Corps should retreat from Stones River

The next time Bragg would face the Army of the Ohio, both opponents had new names. The Rebels dubbed their force the Army of Tennessee and the Union called theirs the XIV Corps. The Union was led by William Rosecrans, one of the war's best commanders. With offensives in Virginia and Mississippi failing, Rosecrans was pressured into making a premature winter push. At Stones River near Murfreesboro the armies fought a three day battle. The Confederates nearly won, but were forced back. The defeat relinquished some of the best farmland in Tennessee and an area that was heavily pro-Confederate. More importantly, the defeat led to a series of recriminations in the Confederate high command that poisoned the army. The Union received a desperately needed morale boost. Although forgotten today, Abraham Lincoln considered Stones River one of the North's most crucial victories.

"Rally 'Round the Flag!" is a brigade grand tactical system that combines old school hex and counter maneuvers with rules for command and control, leader personalities, flexible artillery, and a CRT that favors quality and firepower over raw mass. For Perryville (Battle in the Bluegrass) there are rules for Union high command confusion and Joseph Wheeler's cavalry screen. For Stones River (Winter of Discontent) there are rules for Cheatham being drunk and Rosecrans coming under fire. Both come with multiple scenarios, including additional forces. Players can make Perryville a grand decisive battle or at Stones River bring in additional Confederate forces that could decide the battle and the war.

—description from the designer

Game Scale: Approx. 0.25 miles/hex = approx. 440 yards/hex = approx. 402 metres/hex. 1 hour/turn.

Perryville map: 10 inches by 15 inches.
Stones River (Murfreesboro) map: 15 inches by 18 inches.
The two maps are separate maps.
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Drinks With Frenemies: Original Edition
description:
The game of creating friends out of enemies & enemies out of friends. If you like games, drinking and sabotaging your friends, this game is for you! Drinks with Frenemies is a card game that brings the worst out of you and rewards you for it!

It's an entertaining party game that will keep you on your toes as you adjust to the ever-changing rules. It's a drinking game that's also family friendly. Meaning you can play with any type of beverage you prefer. In fact, we've made gameplay rules for those who wish not to drink at all. From water to moonshine, we think there's no perfect way to ruin... uh... enhance your relationships!

It's a great icebreaker game that gets you moving, thinking and laughing. We've designed it to be instantly playable and incredibly enjoyable with rules that are simple to follow and cards that are easy to understand. It's just as much fun to watch others play as it is to play the game yourself. It's a great addition to any game night, pre-game or party and makes for a great gift for birthdays, graduations and holidays!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: The Sound of Sirens
description:
We've all heard about the legends of the sirens, who with their irresistible voices lure the ships of unsuspecting sailors onto the cliffs... But did you know that they all sing in different musical styles? That's because not every sailor is attracted to the same type of music! Duh!

Every 100 years, the sirens of the salty sea wake up from their slumber, to organize the Sirenade festival. Siren clans from across the seven oceans send their most famous stars to vie for the prestigious honor of... Well, being the most badass clan!

The Sound of Sirens is a racing game with a lot of interaction between the players. Each player leads a clan of sirens, and each clan is represented by a musical genre: Pop, Ballad, Rap, and Rock.

On your turn, you will be playing action cards from your hand in order to be the first to lure your assigned ship onto the cliffs. But many surprises await along the way… Do you have what it takes to become a legendary siren?
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Sovereign Skies: Cosmic Calamity
description: Cosmic Calamity gives players opportunities to engage with the citizens of the Abyssi Cluster. At the start of the game, all players start with five standard influence. Shuffle the deck of Cosmic Calamity cards, and place it to the right of the first player. Flip one card face up and place the cosmic calamity time token on the top-most hex space. There are three different types of track cards which represent certain types of events and give certain types of actions. During your turn, you may follow the instructions on the card. If you do so, you place a ship from your supply on the card. Each player may only contribute to the Cosmic Calamity card once per turn.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Political, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Rondel, Set Collection

name: Battle Babies
description:
Battle Babies is a comically themed deck-building card game for 2-4 players.

In this baby packed strategy game, you use ration cards to recruit and expand your infantry army. Craft the perfect baby army and lead them to victory.

Throughout the game, each player will be expanding their army by recruiting cute (and sometimes less than cute) babies and pitting them against the opposing armies for ultimate baby power.

—description from the pbulsiher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Sedan 1870
description:
End of August 1870. Bazaine and the principal French army have shut themselves up in Metz for a week. The marshal had time to send a message indicating his desire to attempt an exit if a rescue army arrived. But since then, there has been no news. To break the encirclement, Mac Mahon, at the head of the army of Châlons, receives the formal order from the government to rush at Metz to liberate its brothers in arms. The army of Châlons, composed of disparate elements (troops from Africa stand alongside the mobile guards of the Seine), must remain grouped and must move quickly to avoid being taken at the flank by the German troops. The Germans, commanded by Moltke himself, still believe the French to be at Paris, covering the capital. But the city of light is not his objective for the moment. His goal: the destruction of the French regular armed forces in a decisive battle.

Through "Sedan 1870", the evolution of the "Marshals of the 2nd Empire" campaign series, will you be able, like Mac Mahon, to cross the Meuse in time and go to the rescue of Bazaine’s army ? Like Moltke, will you manage to catch the French off guard and definitively vanquish the only enemy regular army still in movement ?


Complexity : 7/10
Solo playability : 6/10
One turn = 1 day
One counter = 1 division (and 1 SP = 2000 men, 1000 cavaliers or 2 batteries)
Scale : 10 km between 2 zones


—description from the publisher

This wargame can be linked with "La guerre de 1870" to play the full Campaign of the Imperial War since the beginning of the war until the final decisive battle of Sedan.
(https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/311190/la-guerre-de-1870...)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Lost Worlds: Fighter Mage with Magic Sword
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Glen More II: Chronicles – Feed the Kraken Mini Chronicle
description:
This promo adds 5 cards that feature the famous ship **INSTABIL**. There is also a rules card which explains how you can use these cards together with some Glen More II components to add a little bluffing and deduction — key features of **Feed the Kraken** — to your Glen More II rounds. These 5 resource cards have no title or card text.

-description from Kickstarter page

Included in both the Basic and Deluxe version of the Feed the Kraken Feed the Kraken game box. There are currently no plans to make these available on their own.
categories: Bluffing, City Building, Expansion for Base-game

name: Mixtape Massacre: The Sleigher Booster Pack
description:
“Rotten! Rotten souls, all of them,” a voice kept whispering to Bruce as he sat there in his Santa outfit awaiting the excited children of Tall Oaks Mall. No matter how hard he tried, he couldn’t shake this feeling something was coming over him. As the kids came and went, the voice got louder and louder. Suddenly a local girl screamed, “Look! Santa has horns!” It was too late. Bruce was gone and in his place, was something feral…

WHAT’S IN A BOOSTER PACK?
1 New Slasher character piece
1 Character profile card
1 Special Ability Token (unique to the character)
3 New “Killer Scenes, Dude” cards themed to the character
1 Special Ability reference card
1 Slasher Profile card (for use with Escape From Tall Oaks)"

-description from publisher's website

name: Yokai Quest Strikes Back
description:
Welcome to Yokai Quest
Yokai Quest is a game where players lead a group of heroes who must face a multitude
of enemies and dangers.
The main enemies of the heroes are the Yokai, mythological creatures from Japanese
folklore. Each Yokai has its own distinctive traits and abilities, from the evil Oni, to the
funny Tengu, to the prankster Tanuki. But they are not the only enemies the heroes
must face, the world of Yokai hides a multitude of hidden dangers.
Throughout the campaign, the players will follow the plot of a story that will take them
through different scenarios, where they will have to face all kinds of challenges. After
each scenario, win or lose, the plot will continue until the story is complete.
Yokai quest has been designed with simplicity in mind, so that anyone, of any age group
and knowledge, can play yokai quest after just one reading of this rulebook.
But let’s not waste anymore time! We know you are itching to start, so let us go right
into the world of Yokai Quest.

Yokai Quest Strikes Back brings with it the following changes and improvement to the original Yokai Quest!

Major Upgrades:
1. Major revision to the rulebook and Gameplay. We did not just fix the rulebook, we have now completely revised the game. Yokai Quest Strikes back difficulty level has been designed to be challenging for experienced players while at the same time a Little Heroes mode (Easy mode) has also been created for children and new players.
2. The original Yokai Quest had 16 scenarios. Yokai Quest Strikes Back brings you +20 scenarios in a separate, new +80 pages campaign book!

Gameplay Tweaks:

Strategy
1. Hero movement : Movement is now an action. Heroes no longer have costless movement. Additionally, leaving a square adjacent to a yokai will now cost double. Players will now need to strategically plan their hero movement and placement.
2. Friendly Fire : Powerful abilities have been tweaked - in general, heroes can no longer unleash a skill without a care in the world : swinging their sword at their allies will cause significant damage! The addition of friendly fire means that hero position, skill choice and energy expenditure decision is now even more strategic!
3. Players may no longer swap items at any time during their phase. Swapping items from the inventory to the hero board can now only be done during the "take a breather" phase, at the end of a hero turn.
4. Energy token management : Energy tokens can now be used to recharge a skill. This adds another level of strategy to the energy token management. Do you recharge a skill, or save the energy to unleash another skill?
5. The concept of Line of Sight has been added to the game
6. Terrain elements have been properly incorporated into the game. There are more strategic decisions to be made around these elements, such as Shrubs, Magic Barriers, altars and monoliths.

Spawn Rate and Yokai Difficulty level
1. Yokai Spawn rate has been modified , there is now the normal mode (harder), and an easy mode.
2. Additionally, each spawn point will now spawn a yokai each turn, unless specified otherwise by the scenario conditions
3. Yokais attributes, attack and defense stats have been tweaked and modified.

Additional changes
1. Heroes no longer receive treasure tokens for defeating a Yokai, unless specified by scenario conditions. Treasures must be earned!
2. Skills or Abilities have been completely revamped. Each Hero now begins their adventure with a limited number of skills, and are able to purchase more powerful skills with the victory points (experience) they gained during their adventures.

Download the new rules here:
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1_Swi9sXRXel9ejZ9PeCt...

New campaing on kickstarter, suscribe in:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/zenitminiatures/yokai-q...
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Pattern Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Rock Runners Incorporated
description:
Rock Runners Incorporated is a card game played with two to four players. The rules are very simple. Anyone could win the most Space Credits and nab the greatest intergalactic contracts! The object of the game is to be the last player to make a play and earn a Space Credit. Games can be played in best-of-five rounds to determine the ultimate winner.

Shuffle the cards and have the dealer pass out three cards face down to each player. The remaining cards are then stacked face down on the table within reach of all players. This is the Stock Pile. Each round starts at zero Space Rocks. The player sitting to the left of the dealer begins the round and play continues clockwise.

The first player lays down one of her cards face up next to the Stock Pile. If it is a Space Rock card, she declares the current Space Rock total. If it is an action card, she declares this instead. After she plays, she immediately draws a card from the Stock Pile. If she forgets to draw a card before the next player plays, she must play the rest of the round with only two cards. The next player then lays down a card and either states the new Space Rock total or the Action Card he is playing. There are seven different Action Cards with different impacts on game play.

The Space Rock total can never exceed one hundred total tons. When players have no cards to play to change the total or equal it with a Full Load, they lose. If three or four people are playing, the remaining players continue until there is only one player left in each round. After each round, the entire deck is reshuffled by the next dealer and the next round begins.

-description from Kickstarter page

name: Yeti Trek
description:
Yeti Trek is a quick, medium-weight game for 2 players. Race across a vast mountain range and be the first yeti to reach the summit to win!

The flow of Yeti Trek is as follows:
1. One player rolls all 6 dice and splits the dice into 2 groups
2. The other player choose which group of dice they want. The remaining group goes to the first player.
3. Use your dice to move your Yeti meeple across the mountain range. To move on the mountain range, the space that you end your movement on must match the color of the dice that you discarded. In addition, the total value of the dice discarded must be equal to or greater than the total on all the spaces that you moved through this turn.

Optionally utilize a rondel every turn before you move to gain bonuses to your movement.

Once both players have used all of their dice, the round is over and a new round starts. The game ends immediately once one players reaches one of the Summit spaces.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, I Cut, You Choose, Modular Board, Race, Rondel

name: Dungeon Party: Furious Orc
description:
Dungeon Party is an easy-to-learn, raucous, play-anywhere, social role-playing game, where the rooms, monsters, and treasures are all on bar coasters. Players take turns bouncing a coin to "hit" the monsters, disarm traps, or avoid cursed rooms. Players work together to survive the dungeon and gather the most loot, but there can only be one winner!

On their turn, a player reveals a room and monster, battles the monster, and recovers treasure. The game ends if all players’ characters are defeated in an encounter and the adventure failed, or if the last Boss monster has been defeated and the adventure has succeeded and you win.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Flicking, Move Through Deck, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Set-up

name: Full Moon: The Beast of Gevaudan
description:
Full Moon: The Beast of Gevaudan is a brutal solo roll and write inspired by the myth of the beast that ravaged the French countryside in the mid 1700s.

In this game you play as the beast, a werewolf struggling to survive as paranoia grows constantly, unable control your werewolf form.

Can you maintain your village guise for the month? the season? the year? The experience is harrowing, and you will need to push your luck to see how long you can survive. Are you ready to roll the dice?

—description from the designer

name: Magic: The Gathering – Commander 2020: Ikoria: Lair of Behemoths Commander – Symbiotic Swarm
description:
The Symbiotic Swarm deck leverages your creatures’ many abilities—give your living creatures the abilities in your graveyard with Kathril Aspect Warper, reanimate a swarm of small creatures with Tayam Luminous Enigma, and draw cards when your buffed creatures leave the battlefield with Nikara Lair Scavenger and Yannik Scavenging Sentinel.

Symbiotic Swarm is one of five Commander Decks from Ikoria Lair of Behemoths (IKO). Each includes exclusive cards tailored to that deck—pick your favorite mechanics and dive in to battle.

Battle your way through the plane of Ikoria with monster-themed mechanics that grow your creatures build your bond and crush your opponents.

Contents one: (1) foil oversized Commander card, one hundred (100) card deck, ten (10) double-sided tokens, one (1) deck box, one (1) Life Wheel, one (1) punchout keyword counter card.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Lock & Spell: A Game of Fortunes
description:
Destiny awaits you within the chests of fate!

Open three chests, and the treasure is yours — but only keys enchanted with the correct spells can unlock your fortune. You must summon the cards and cast your hand upon the keys. If you can't draw the right spells, offer a token of fate and try again. Get caught unable to enchant a key, and you lose a fate token. Run out of fate tokens, and you lose the game.

Lock & Spell is a single player card game of luck and tactics. To begin, reveal a set of keys and draw a hand of five spell cards. Each key shows the required hand needed to enchant it, with some keys being more difficult to obtain than others.

Spell cards come in four suits valued 1-10. If the player has a hand of cards that matches a key's spell, they may cast their magic and gain that key. If not, the player must use a token of fate to discard any number of spell cards and draw back up to five. Fate tokens are placed upon keys, and for the remainder of the current turn that key may not be gained. If during the turn a player's hand matches the spell shown upon a tokened key card, a penalty occurs and both the key and fate token are discarded.

Gameplay continues until the player unlocks three chests and gains the treasures within. If the player should run out of fate tokens or keys, they lose.

Winning a game of Lock & Spell rewards the player with a unique fortune, which is based upon the order of treasures gained. Players also score their game. More difficult chests grant higher scores, and points are gained for the remaining fate tokens not discarded.

Cast your magic upon the keys and unlock your fate!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Siblings Trouble: Expanded Deluxe Edition
description:
The Siblings Trouble is a card-driven, cooperative, storytelling game inspired by finding the mysterious places in your backyard. It boils down all the core elements of an RPG (storytelling, exploration, discoveries, treasures, and encounters) into a fun-to-play narrative romp with your family or friends!

Go on an epic 30-minute adventure inspired by childhood imagination.

- Build your Adventure Deck and jump right into the story.
- Explore a mysterious place, find loot, escape hazards, and defeat foes with treasure, tales, and Trouble Dice.
- Play as Danger, Adventure, Mischief, Mayhem, Chance, or an original kid crafted from your own childhood.

This Expanded Deluxe Edition includes the original game plus MUCH MORE!

- Play as Chance, a new character with their own ability and Trouble Die
- Play as Destiny, a new mode that adds a Story Guide with special cards
- Visit 2 brand new locations: The Spooky Old House and Museum of Mystery
- Discover new encounters and bosses for all of the previous locations
- Find awesome new treasures and Epic Treasures on your adventure
- Continue your journey with new expanded adventures between locations

-description from publisher
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Clue Junior
description:
Now preschoolers can get in on the mystery-solving fun! This mystery board game for kids ages 4 and up includes a double-sided gameboard for 2 levels of play. On the Level 1 side, kids work together to solve a Playground Mix-up. One of the characters mistakenly put an item in their backpack. All players work as a team, exploring the playground by searching for clues in seek-and-find picture tiles. Together, they must figure out what item is missing and who took it to solve the mystery.

When junior detectives are ready for a bit more challenge, they can flip the board over to Level 2 and compete to solve the Science Lab Mystery. Who set off the volcano, what did they pour into it, and where should they have been?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Taco Cat Goat Cheese Pizza: Halloween Special Edition
description:
Taco Cat Goat Cheese Pizza characters are dressed in their favorite costumes in this version!

Special Cards:

Boorilla: Yell “BOO” and shake your hands.
Hogula: Place nose into bend of elbow while yelling "BLAH".
Arrr-whal: Cover one eye with hand and form a hook with the other while yelling "ARRR".
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Dwarves of Iron Peak
description: DWARVES OF IRON PEAK is a 2-4 player board game that pits a troop of brave Dwarves against the Vile creatures that live in the lands around them. The Dwarf player must complete quests, while the Vile player must stop the Dwarves or destroy them entirely!
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Magic: The Gathering – Core Set 2021
description:
It's Magic Time

Teferi has summoned some of Magic's most iconic throwbacks alongside powerful new cards for a set too epic for just one timeline. Draw your power from the source with Core Set 2021.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Interrupts

name: D€mocracia
description:
D€mocracia is a Spanish politics game simulating a corrupt two-party democratic system.

Players represent political leaders of either party. They must cooperate with their party partner to win the support of the different election districts while rivaling each other to be the most popular and therefore chosen candidate for President. Candidates winning the election become President, who must avoid resignation at all costs during the entire term in order to score a victory point. The game ends after the third election, which awards a victory point to the successful candidate. If tie-breaking is necessary, the player who have secured the most retirement-plan points during the game wins.

If the number of players is 3, 5 or 6, some players represent smaller parties with a different goal, to become one of the two large parties by being the second most voted party at any election.

In D€mocracia, players have —and might hire— agents, including leader, party barons, media and judges to play cards for them. These cards are placed face down, one per agent, and include funding for their political or scheme activities and the activities themselves. Cards may be legal or illegal to play. After every player has placed their cards, they start revealing and getting the effects of the cards played on a turn-by-turn basis. Each judge investigates one agent per turn, placing tokens right before anyone starts revealing cards. If the agent's card is illegal upon revelation, a trial against the agent takes place. All players having judges can influence the trial's outcome, which might involve losing the agent and the card played by them.

name: Affentennis: Die Doppelerweiterung
description:
"Affentennis - Die Doppelerweiterung" is an add-on to the game "Affentennis". You can now play doubles.

To play "Die Doppelerweiterung" you need to own the base game.

Included in the extension is:


One red bag which holds all the components
Two monkey figures ("Äffle")
Two small volley blocks
Two markers
one spare ball
rules


Two players per side play along the basic game rules, there are also some extra rules to accomdate the two extra players.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: Evy against Everything and Everyone Everywhere
description:
This is the story of Evy, a young girl awaken from a slumber to find her nightmare monsters come to life.

In this single player scary-story adventure book-game, you’ll step in the shoes of Evy and help her out-run, out-smart and out-fight an unending stream of monsters.

You’ll rescue your family, your friends and basically be an all-round hero to everybody else.

Evy against Everything and Everyone, Everywhere is a book containing a single story, a tutorial on how to play the role of Evy and game rules to help you beat a dozen full-page adventures.

This game requires a number of components. You’ll find a list of easily attainable components inside the book. You also need to print a few pages of cards and cut them out. You can download these cards, the latest version of this book, both available in full-color and low-ink versions. There’s even blank maps and tips to help you make your own maps.
categories: Adventure, Book, Exploration, Horror, Humor, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Storytelling

name: Kunitori! Is the World on Fire?
description:
In Kunitori! Tenka: Is the World on Fire?, the players are feudal lords in medieval Japan, once again fighting for unification of the lands. In this deck-building game, you must use your tacticians, allies and money effectively to buy cards such as Cavalry, Fortresses and Gold, gradually building your deck of cards.

As the game nears its end, players can take command of their generals and troops to go to battle against the other players, trying to gain as many lands as possible. This battle heavily influences the game. All after fights of the samurai end and players tally their victory points, will you be the strongest feudal lord?

Integrates with:

Kuni Tori!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Flames of War: Bloody Omaha – The Battle for Omaha Beach D-Day, 6 June 1944
description:
Bloody Omaha is a source book for Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game covering the fighting on Omaha Beach. Included are army lists for the forces involved, including the US Rangers and 1st and 29th Infantry Divisions, and the German 352nd Infantry Division.

Also included are scenarios, modeling tips and historical background.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Siege of Gondor
description: The siege of Gondor is a supplement for The Lord of the Rings Strategy Game which contains rules for siges and for characters such as the Citadel Guard, Beregond and Gothmog.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Wargame

name: 1066: The Year of Three Battles
description:
1066: The Year of Three Battles covers the crucial year in the history of England when three men vied for the throne: Harold Godwinson, king of Wessex, Haraldr Sigurdsson (known as Hardrada), king of Norway, and William, Duke of Normandy. The game presents the three main battles of the campaign — Fulford (20 September), Stamford Bridge (25 September), and Hastings (14 October) — using the Battles of the Medieval World system.

Each battle has its own map, with hexes approximately 55 yards across. Units represent around 200 men and are typed as infantry, archers, and cavalry. Turns are 30 minutes of real time. Combat features a simple odds-based CRT with special rules covering archery and cavalry charges. Key leaders are present and affect unit morale and rally. Each of the games can be played in two hours or less. Players also may choose the campaign scenario, fighting all three battles in sequence, with the outcome of each affecting the forces available in the next.

Published in S&T 293, Jul/Aug 2015

name: Alcatraz: The Scapegoat – Wrong Plan
description: Alcatraz: The Scapegoat - Wrong Plan, a blackmail card initially available from the publisher at Spiel 2012, reads: "A chosen player discards one element of the plan of your choice."
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Trading, Voting

name: Monster Trap
description:
Description from the publisher:

On the edge of town there is a friendly Monster that lives in a cave. When the Monster grows hungry, a deep growl rumbles across the land. The town citizens know that this means trouble, for it is at these times that the Monster seeks out its favorite snack: Farmer Brown’s sheep! A group of clever teenagers are determined to stop the Monster from reaching its goal.

Monster Trap is a cooperative game for 1 to 6 players who work together to set traps that will discourage the Monster from eating the sheep and send it scurrying back to its cave. The players must successfully complete a number of traps that the Monster sets off before it reaches Farmer Brown’s Farm to win the game.

The players grab resources from Monster Trap Corp's conveyor belts and get them out to the traps any way they can before time runs out. Monster Trap is the ultimate resource gathering and placement game.

Each trap card has a list of resources (colored cubes) that are needed to complete a trap. The players move their tokens to pick up the resources from the conveyor belt, carry those resources to the trap and place them. After all resources for a trap have been placed, then the trap is considered set and will trigger when the monster moves onto that space.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Balck Friday: The Tatsinskaya Raid, December 1942
description:
Wait a minute. Don't we mean BLACK Friday?

Nope. It's "Balck Friday," as in German General Hermann Balck. In the winter of 1942, his crack 11th Panzer Division fought an amazing series of battles along the Chir River in response to the Soviet surprise attacks that surrounded Stalingrad. It has been called one of the finest divisional actions of all time.

Bottom line, a single Panzer division, fighting one day after another (frequently after overnight marches) pretty much destroyed an entire Soviet tank army. And more.

But it's a virtually unknown story, as the disaster of Stalingrad and Manstein's relief effort (our own Wintergewitter game) get all the headlines. It may be hard to imagine, but minus Balck's extraordinary fire-brigade work, Stalingrad would have been much, much worse!

On Christmas Day (a Friday), Balck and his units were called upon once again. They had to stop a Soviet probe deep behind the porous German lines, aimed at knocking out the airfield at Tatsinkaya, which was supporting the Stalingrad Pocket. ATO spotlights Balck's amazing efforts with a new, unpublished and complete game.

With 100 die cut counters, a full color 8.5" x 11" map and just 4 pages of rules, you'll be able to quickly explore this one remarkable exploit during a very "dark December" for the Axis.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Shoudo: The Scorched Earth Game
description:
In Shoudo, two players face off across the battlefield of the Sengoku Jidai - the Japanese civil war. The players assume control of one of four great clans - Uesugi, Mori, Tokugawa, or Shimazu - and attempt to defeat their opponent to become the Shogun.

Shoudo is a terrain-based strategy game. The board, which consists of 40 cards, is shuffled and laid out in a random 5x8 configuration at the start of each game. Each player controls 3 armies which they may use to "burn" enemy lands and attack enemy armies and castles. The first player to destroy their opponent's Daimyo castle wins the game.

To win, players must engage in combat. When attacking an enemy army or castle, combat is fought over 3 rounds. Each round, both players roll a 6-sided combat die and add the strength of their unit and its terrain bonus - the higher roll wins the round, and the first player to win 2 rounds wins the combat.

Special clan abilities, inspired by the traditional clans, affect gameplay, giving each clan a unique advantage. These abilities can give tactical advantage or greater sustainability.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Winter War: Finland vs the Soviet Union 1939
description:
"Winter War: Finland vs the Soviet Union 1939" is an operational level two player wargame. It covers the Soviet invasion of Finland over the Winter of 1939-40. The Soviets initially expected a quick victory. However, the Finns, under the leadership of Carl Gustav Mannerheim, resisted and outmaneuvered the more ponderous Red Army forces. It was not until Marshal Timoshenko was appointed to lead the campaign, that the Soviets gained the initiative. They captured sufficient territory to bring the war to a negotiated end. The Soviet historical objectives were to seize key geographical areas and inflict sufficient Finnish casualties to force the Finns to negotiate a pro-Soviet Union peace treaty. The Finns were attempting to prevent this or prolong the war to where outside intervention would come to their aid. Each hex on the map represents circa 21 miles. Each turn of play represents ten days. Ground units represent detachments, battalions, regiments, brigades, divisions and corps. Aircraft units represent a number of sorties to accomplish a mission.

—description from the publisher

name: Desítka Česko
description:
Desítka Česko is a variant of Smart10 game, based on questions about Czech republic.

It is a quiz game where a player doesn't need to wait for one's turn for long.
There are ten possible answers to each question, and every player gets to answer every question.
If the answer is correct, the player gets an answer marker.
But should you answer or pass?
If you don't score your answer markers on time (and thereby pass on this round), you can end up losing them.
So if you are not 100% certain of an answer - do you gamble or do you pass?
Plays great in teams.

name: Heads Will Roll
description:
Everyone knows dragons love hoarding gold in their caves and laying waste to any would-be intruders. It turns out dragons also have designed their own game using the leftovers...

To play, take turns rolling a fistful of pieces out across the table and flicking your Shield through the scattered Skulls to earn (or lose) points. Hit the treasure chest to bank those points and add them to your total. First player to reach 21 points wins.

The game uses most of the same basic rules as Dragoon: Heads Will Roll but has some additions, changes, different physical components, and new art. If you dig D:HWR you'll be way into this.

-description from designer

name: Unmurphed: Mike Murphy – Nick Murphy
description:
This is a fan made deck for Unmatched featuring The Brothers Murph as a playable Hero that will be fully compatible with all Unmatched sets. This is not a Restoration Games or Mondo Games product but was given the blessing of Restoration Games and has been given guidance on design by their team and will be produced through Game Crafter during The Brothers Murph's Kickstarter Campaign

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Point to Point Movement, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Schatten der Macht
description:
Schatten der Macht ("Shadows of Power") is a strategic Euro Boardgame in the Dark Eye universe.

Lead a clandestine Organisation into the battle for control of Aventuria. Gain influence in numerous locations on the continent (the game map), send out groups of heroic adventurers and command ships on the high seas.

Those who cleverly develop their influence on churches, magical societies and great lords will find themselves in a good position to assist their adventurers in the fight against competitors (and monsters) as well as convince the greatest heroes of the age to lend them their swords and wisdom. And last but not least, each secret organisation pursues its own agenda of intrigue in the Shadows of Power.

The main gameplay is focussed around gaining a deck of cards, each of them representing regions on the map or powerful characters and then playing those cards to use the resources they provide - to recruit and move adventures, influence organisations and command ships. A major aspect of the game revolves around combining actions to make them more powerful and resolve them without spending too many turns - since every player has the power to dictate the remaining duration of a round!

At the end of each round, conflicts regarding the control of regions are resolved - an elegant majority system is used to determine the victor, but since conflicts are not resolved during the individual player's turns, everyone can react and have a small skirmish become a decisive battle for victory.

In addition, the game features an innovative scoring mechanism that keeps the game free of bookkeeping hassles (all scoring is performed at the end) and also allows weaker players to catch up due to relative scoring systems.

The game features many illustrations on the cards - dozens of characters of Dark Eye lore, organisations and regions.

It is playable with 2-4 players as the basic game and there is a 5-6 player expansion available at launch.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order

name: Saco de Ossos
description:
Strange things are happening: skeletons started to raise from their graves at the graveyard. Now they are walking around and you, as a competent gravedigger, must return them to their tombs and ensure they stay there.

'Saco de Ossos (bone sack) is a game based on Tic-Tac-Toe, where the objective of each player is to be the first to align 3 skulls of their color, OR to enclose a tomb with 4 crosses of their own color.

With a single copy of the game, you play a 2 player game. With a second bag of other color, up to 4 players can play the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Tile Placement

name: Der Fuhrer
description:
Der Fuhrer is a quirky little ziplock-bag game in which players representing six different political parties vie for control of pre-Nazi Germany.

Players select campaign platforms and move from one province to another trying to elect enough Reichstag deputies to win. Components aren't much, but play includes issues such as fiscal austerity, Versailles treaty, law and order. Nazi and Communist party players have street mobs options.

No incentive is provided for cooperation among players, giving the Nazi Party player a slight edge. If no one accumulates enough deputy points after three elections to win, players may assume that President Hindenburg restores the monarchy, or continue playing until winner is declared.

The game is comprised of a 28-page softcover digest, with a map and markers sheet.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Variable Player Powers

name: Kaiserschlacht: 1918
description:
Kaiserschlacht: 1918, is a low-complexity, two-player "mini-monster" wargame covering the decisive campaign of World War I's western front. It may be played as one long campaign game covering from March through November, or you may select from three shorter scenarios: "German Spring Offensive," "Turn of the Tide," and "Allied Offensive."

Each game turn represents one day; each map hexagon scales to three miles across, and the units of maneuver are divisions and brigades. The game's systems are simple, but work to accurately and eloquently portray the operational warfare of those times. Special rules cover: tanks, shock troop infiltration tactics, artillery, air power, supply, sea movement, morale and demoralization, flooding, U-boat warfare, fortifications, trenches, inter-Allied cooperation, the critical importance of Paris, and much more.

2005 Edition:
Game components include four maps, 504 die cut counters, a rules book and storage bags. This game comes in an oversized ziplock and ships in its own mailer. It is more of a reprint of the original Excalibre 2nd edition game in 1992. The first edition came out in 1977 from Spence & Gabel Games.
publishers: Excalibre Games, Inc., Spence & Gabel Games

name: ZomBN1: A Board Game all About Zombie Infested Brighton
description: This is the blood splattered, full game follow up to BN1. Up to 5 survivors must take on the might of the evil zombie player and stop Brighton being overrun by the dead. With weapons ranging from flamethrowers to sticks of rock, equipment ranging from bin armour to binoculars and encounters ranging from trapped survivors to passing samba bands, ZomBN1 takes in the breadth and scope of Brighton and bites it sharply in the jugular.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Scuttle!: Promo Pack
description: This 7-card promo pack includes Captain Bluebeard, Catbeard the Pirate, Firestarter Kelly, Jellybeans, La Capitán, Ninja, and the Vampirate.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Foggy Island
description:
The game Туманний острів ("Foggy Island") is a very interesting decision of the idea the "Tic-tac-toe" game mechanic.

In the game each player manages an army of 18 characters. Some of them have special features that make the game more dynamic and unpredictable. The aims of the players are to construct diagonal, vertical and horizontal lines, which depending on the size, can bring a different number of points. The field in the game is 6x6 and banking on the weather, the rules of playing the characters can be changed.

But do not forget about the spies! Each player has four rival spies in his army, who can bring some victory points to the enemy. Play them in such way for the opponent, that he could take the least advantage of their location!
AWARDS
Winner of the ukrainian “Game of the Year 2019” (best ukrainian designer game)
Nominee of the ukrainian “Game of the Year 2019” (players choice)
categories: Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Memory, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Line Drawing, Variable Player Powers

name: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – Defence Against the Dark Arts: Felix Felicis Promo Card
description:
This promo card was handed out during GenCon 2019.

This Item carries the following ability:

Choose odd or even. Then reveal the top card of the Classroom deck. If its value matches your choice, gain 2 [ATTACK]. Otherwise, gain 2 [LIFE].
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Take That
publishers: KOSMOS, Rebel Sp. z o.o., REXhry, The Op Games

name: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – Defence Against the Dark Arts: Golden Snitch Promo Card
description:
This promo card was handed out during GenCon 2019.

This Item carries the following ability:

If you have 2 or more Allies in play, gain 3 [INFLUENCE] and draw 2 cards. If not, gain 1 [ATTACK] and 1 [LIFE].
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Take That
publishers: KOSMOS, Rebel Sp. z o.o., REXhry, The Op Games

name: The Split
description:
You've managed to pull off the Heist of the Century. A fortune in gems, gold, paintings and more sit before you and your crew. The only question is how to divide the loot? The Boss suggests one final card game before you go your separate ways. It's time for... The Split.

Based on a modified version of the classic card game Blackjack, players will try to bluff and outwit each other to claim piles of loot cards. Collect cards and get your total value as close to 21 as possible - closest gets first pick of the stacks. Use your Bonus cards to manipulate your total, but don't play too safe... with one fewer stack on the table than there are players, you're never guaranteed a prize.

Each round sees one player act as the dealer, passing regular playing cards out to all players. Your initial aim is to score as close to 21 as possible without exceeding that number - special one-use Bonus cards can help you get closer to the target. Only players with the highest value scores can claim from the stacks of Loot Cards, containing different items such as gold, gems, valuable paintings and more. More loot is added each round, and the game continues until the Loot Deck is depleted. Each loot type scores in a different way, and the player with the most Loot at the end of the game will win. Play with the Disguise cards for a trickier version of the game, where you can't win without a way to escape!

With various difficulty modes, The Split offers an interactive, easy to learn experience that will appeal to a wide range of players. So, settle in, keep a straight face, and see how much you can walk away from the table with.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, End Game Bonuses, Push Your Luck

name: Last Resort
description:
In Last Resort, each player is the proud new owner of a defunct space station, which they plan to turn into the galaxy’s trendiest space resort!

Each round (or ‘season’) players will select one of their four advert cards to play, broadcasting it across the galaxy to attract tourists! These advert cards also dictate which parts of your station guests can check out of (generating income) and what kind of tile you can build this round. But beware – playing the same advert as another station will generate interference, causing Malfunction tiles to crop up on both stations!

When players are done checking out tourists and buying new tiles, rockets packed with new tourists will arrive! In the Arrivals phase, players draft tourists to visit their stations, with the players whose attractions and amenities most align with current trends getting to pick first (which usually means they will also get extra tourists, as arrival numbers are rarely an exact multiple of the player count!) If a player does not have a suitable spot for the type of tourist they wish to draft, the tourist is ejected into space, negatively affecting your station’s ratings!

At the end of the game, the winner is the player with the most QUID – or Quantum Universal Intergalactic Denomination, the accepted currency of all space resorts. QUID is generated not only by checking out tourists, but also competing to be the highest in each of the four ‘Prestige’ categories – Thrills, Entertainment, Relaxation and Inspiration!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Expedition: The Future
description:
The Future expands the Expedition universe into space with a new Tech ability class, Synth enemies, and Skills for your adventurer to master both in and out of combat.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Flames of War: D-Day – The Campaign for Normandy June-August 1944
description:
D-Day is the first Campaign Book, covering from D-Day, 6 June 1944, to the liberation of Paris on 25 August 1944. It contains no army lists or specific unit descriptions but it does contain the following:


History of the Normandy Campaign
Rules for amphibious assaults
Rules for bocage fighting
Hit the Beach mission
Utah Beach scenario
Sword Beach scenario
Rules for Hobart’s Funnies
The Bréville Gap axis of attack campaign
Cutting the Cotentin axis of attack campaign
Normandy Modelling tips and ideas
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Cuyuyuy
description:
Cuyuyuy simulates a wheel of fortune. There are 12 numbered box cards, arranged in a circle. A random guinea pig is placed on the box with its number.
