In competitive play, players attempt to solve the same grid as quickly as possible, all at once. You must play all the grids in one magazine, one after the other, from the first to the last (in multiple rounds), with the same group of players. When a player completes their grid, they earn as many points as the number of players who haven't finished their grids yet. A player who announces the completion of their grid can no longer add modifications to it. When there is only one player left who hasn't finished their grid, all players verify the accuracy of the completed grids. In case of an error on their grid, the player loses 1 point. When all the grids in the magazine have been completed, establish a ranking of players based on the number of points earned by each player.

—description from the designer

name: Revenge
description:
Revenge is a collection of rules specifically written for warfare in the Middle Ages. From the Dark Ages to the rise of gunpowder, war was the sport of nobles who knew that virtue, leadership, and courage were the only principles of war.

Revenge contains three sets of rules each emphasizing a romanticized view of an aspect of medieval battle: Deus Vult is for field battles, Into the Breach for sieges and Sluys for naval warfare.

Deus Vult is designed for 15mm miniatures, each model representing 20 men, but can be easily scaled for use with 25mm miniatures. Meanwhile, Into the Breach is designed for 25mm miniatures representing 5 men each. Sluys is intended for 1:100 scale ship models and 15mm miniatures.

There exists also a supplement, "The Normans", which contains several scenarios for Revenge, but no new rules.

name: Robotico
description:
Robotico is the rethemed and reworked version of Politico, Small Box Games' first released game, and more than just the name has changed.

In Robotico, players are in charge of factories and are attempting to manufacture the latest and greatest robots to work in their factories. Players have two actions: Manipulate or Fabricate, and the number of actions they get for the round depends on what the other players secretly choose to do. There are a limited number of robots available, and all players need them for their factories.

Differences between Robotico and Politico:

The number of players has been streamlined

The Manipulate action (formerly the card action) hinges on a card combination system, nearly doubling the original number of unique special actions.

The game now ends when all of the current model cards have been revealed, with players earning points for the robots they Fabricated OR when a player has acquired 13 robots, with at least one of each type, whichever comes first(which eliminates the back and forth drag found in Politico).

Robotico is not compatable with Politico, they are two separate games that share a common mechanic system.

name: Battle of Anegawa
description:
"燃えよ！姉川の戦い (Burn! Battle of Anegawa)"

The issue game covers the early important battle of Oda Nobunaga, with his ally Tokugawa, against the Azai-Asakura alliance.

The game is a grand tactical combat game. It emphasizes on initiative and army morale. The mechanics accelerates the collapse of losing army dramatically.

Game components:

8 page rulebook
150 counters
1 map

name: Cam
description:
Cam is a small but not tiny game of sudden death. This little abstract ends as soon as one player gets any one piece to the single goal space at the opposite end of the board. To do so, one has to get past the opponent's pieces.

Each player has two types of pieces which mostly move similarly. One can jump one's own pieces or jump to capture an opponent's. Multiple jumps in any direction are allowed. So, sudden reversals and leaps to victory are not uncommon. Since only one piece in the goal is needed to win, this game can be unforgiving. Still it's quick and many games can be played in one sitting.

Cam, released by Parker Brothers in 1949, is a down-sized version of Camelot.

Cam is different than Camelot in the following ways:

The Cam board has 67 squares. The Camelot board has 160 squares.
Each side in Cam has two Knights and five Men. Each side in Camelot has four Knights and ten Men.
The object of Cam is to get one piece into the opponent's Castle. The object of Camelot is to get two pieces into the opponent's Castle.
Victory in Cam also occurs if one side, even with only one remaining piece, captures all of the opposing pieces. In Camelot, if the side capturing all of the opposing pieces has only one remaining piece, the game is a draw. Victory in Camelot by capture of all of the opposing pieces occurs only if the victorious side has two or more remaining pieces.
Stalemate in Cam is impossible. Stalemate in Camelot is possible, and is a victory for the stalemating side if it has two or more pieces.
In Cam, if both sides have only one remaining piece, the game continues until one piece captures the other, or one piece enters the opposing Castle. In Camelot, if both sides have only one remaining piece, the game is a draw.


Re-implements:

Chivalry
Camelot
publishers: Parker Brothers, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Town Center: Lower Manhattan / Paris La Cité – St. Louis
description:
Town Center: Lower Manhattan / Paris La Cité – St. Louis comprises 4 double-sided player boards, with the Lower Manhattan expansion map (previously published separately as part of Town Center: Expansion n°2) on one side, and the Paris La Cité – St. Louis expansion map (previously published separately as part of Town Center: Expansion n°1) on the other. There is also an A5-sized rulesheet that explains the special rules of each map.

The Lower Manhattan map simulates the construction of the densest part of New York City, and the limited space is a challenge for even the most experienced players.

Paris La Cité – St. Louis with its bridges and islands on the river Seine is another challenging map, where players have to carefully consider the connections between the various areas, especially in the construction phase.
categories: Abstract Strategy, City Building, Expansion for Base-game

name: Cine Write and Trade
description:
You are a group of film screenwriters working in the era of the increasingly large film industry. In the next year, your job is to be the most productive screenwriter like the producer wants. At the end of every quarter of the year, you will face a producer to earn your income. However, writing is not an easy job, so you have to help each other and deal to find the right words of inspiration. Earning a lot of money may not necessarily be the road to your success because at the end of the year it's the most important reputation in the industry that determines your victory.

In Cine Write and Trade, players will: Write words... Sell words... Buy words... and Guess Words...

In the process, players will write words then sell it to another player, so every player will buy and sell words from each others. This process will build deductions and create sense of progression so finally every player can guess another players secret words. Player with most reputation point will be the winner of the game.

name: Weird Little Elf
description:
Weird Little Elf is the little bitty holiday game that’s a little bit weird. Players take turns being Santa, who poses a question for the others to answer. The other players are Elves, although one is secretly an Imp who follows a special rule that could give it away. The first player to accuse the Imp correctly three times wins!

-description from publisher

name: Final Score
description:
The Design Specification for Final Score demanded a quick-playing game (15 to 20 minutes per match), accurate results (of course), an exciting and smooth-flowing play system and the feeling that individual players were just as important as the overall team performance in arriving at the result.

For speed of play the game has to be a 'highlights' system. We decided on a deck of Fast Action Cards to provide the smooth flow, and we rejected a playing pitch [board] as being unnecessary. The basis of the system is the re-creation of the potentially decisive duels, between individual players, team strengths and tactics, that punctuate every soccer match.

The game includes team and player cards for sixteen prominent postwar English league teams.

From the "design concept" section of the rulebook:

name: Premier Table Soccer 2000
description: This soccer game is played on a large felt pitch. It is a real time game with well-made pieces that can push or lift the ball. Standard rules of soccer apply. The game comes with an instruction video. The men are picked up to use for passing and shooting. There is no flicking involved. The men can be used to shoot the ball long distances, as well as put spin on the ball. This game is very accessible to young and old, as flicking is not needed.
publishers: Action Games and Toys Ltd, T.A.F. Sports Games Ltd., WP Sports Games Limited

name: Action Front! Watchtower
description:
ACTION FRONT! Watchtower is the first in a projected series of DTP microgames covering tactical combat in WWII. The game's expandable system is reminiscent of the venerable Panzerblitz/Panzer Leader games, with a feeling of the Five-Star series thrown in. Each game is played on 4 x 8 inch semi-geomorphic maps, with a fast, furious sequence of play that minimizes bookkeeping and maximizes the action. Players may play the included scenarios or create their own using the provided rules.

Watchtower comes with 20 US and 20 Japanese units, allowing players to recreate the epic struggle of the 1st US Marine Division on Guadalcanal in September and October of 1942. USMC Raiders and Paramarines square off against Chi-Ha tanks and leg mortars. Special rules are included for Henderson Field and banzai attacks.

In a small series with the Action Front! Hakko Ichiu.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Warhammer: Armies of Antiquity – A Supplement for Ancient Battles
description:
From the publisher:
Armies of Antiquity contains army lists for use with the Warhammer Ancient Battles rules. The lists cover all of the most famous armies of the ancient world, from the chariot armies of ancient Egypt through to armies of crusading knights.

New rules to use in your Warhammer Ancient Battles games.
22 new army lists, including:
Sumerian, Egyptian, Hittite, Trojan Wars, Assyrian, Persian, Ancient Greek, Alexander & His Successors, Ancient Indian, Republican Roman, Carthaginian, Late Roman, Cataphract, Byzantine, The Nomad Hordes, The Saracens, Saxon, Viking, Norman, Crusader, Chinese, and Samurai.

Special tribal variations which can be used with the Barbarian army list included in Warhammer Ancient Battles.

Please note: Armies of Antiquity is now out of print, but many of the lists are available in the new edition (version 1.5) of the Warhammer Ancient Battles rulebook and more detailed lists in the many sourcebooks made available since this book's release.

Expands:

Warhammer Ancient Battles
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Panzer Grenadier: Alaska's War
description:
From the APL website:

In June 1942, Japanese troops landed in the western Aleutian Islands of Alaska, the only large-scale foreign invasion of American soil since 1815. In May 1943 the Americans invaded Attu Island, sending 15,000 troops against about 2,500 Japanese defenders. The Japanese fought with suicidal determination: 28 fell into American hands as prisoners with the remainder killed in action.

Two months later the Americans launched an even larger invasion of nearby Kiska Island, only to find that the Japanese had evacuated three weeks before and the Americans captured an uninhabited island.

Alaska's War is a supplement based on the Japan's lone invasion of the Western Hemisphere and the American response. The supplement features 10 scenarios.

This game is part of the Panzer Grenadier series
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Siege: The Castle-Crashing Card Game of Medieval Mayhem
description:
Siege is a fast-paced card game of skill, luck and strategy in which 2 to 4 players engage in medieval warfare. Using various attacks, defensive measures, enhancements and the abilities of those garrisioned within their castles, the players battle to see who will be the last one standing. As players are defeated, they become the Plague and still influence the outcome of the game.

The game is played using a deck of 135 cards and a pair of dice. Wall cards are also used to keep track of damage dealt to each player. Two plague cards are used by players defeated first in three or four player battles. Suitible for ages 10 and up.
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), (Self-Published), The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Dark Age: Apocalypse Core Rules
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Welcome to Samaria... an abandoned planet, a ruined world, a place where few still remember! The world of Dark Age is a world of contradiction. Plasma rifles meet crossbows, laser torches meet horse-drawn ploughs, and future philosophy meets ancient religion. However, the inhabitants of Dark Age share one, simple trait: the instinct for survival at any cost!

Featuring art from the inimitable Brom and Dark Age's own in-house artists, the Dark Age: Apocalypse Core Rules contains everything you need to play Dark Age, a fully scaleable, skirmish-level wargame using 28-33mm scale miniatures. Within these pages you'll find rules for campaigns and scenarios, as well as information on terrain interaction and weather effects to liven up your game, plus 13 playable Forcelists, complete with fantastic artwork and intriguing storylines.

Re-implements:

Dark Age: Core Rules

name: Deus Vult: Wargaming in the time of the Crusades
description:
Deus Vult are a set of miniatures rules designed to recreate battles during the period of the Crusades. The rules are designed to be played with 25-30mm miniatures on a 6'x4' table (but can be adapted for different figure and table sizes). They not only contain the principally d6 based rules (although d4 to d12 are used for duels between leaders) but also army lists for the Early Crusader States 1100-1128AD and Arab Dynasties 945-1150AD (plus some other sample units) along with several battle scenarios.

The game features:


A pre-battle reconnaissance and deployment phase with options for subterfuge
Alternating leader activation based on an initiative roll
Leaders can give orders to multiple units based on their command rating
Multi-figure stand based units
d6 based combat
Points based army lists
Seven battle scenarios with rules to create your own

name: Terrible Lizards
description: In Terrible Lizards you build your own dinosaur and fight against the reptile of your opponent. All actions including the dino parts are represented in the play of cards.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Table Air Combat: Ju-87B Stuka
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each player has a flight of fighters, represented by two-sided counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set contains the Ju-87B Stuka, a German dive-bomber which was used in the Battle of Britain.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Word Domination: The Designer
description:
Word Domination role promo card given away at Gen Con 2017.

"Let's be honest...you never really stood a chance of beating me at my own game."

Ability: Technical Loophole
At the end of your turn, spell a second world up to four letters long. The tiles used in your second word must be different from those in your original word.

Cost: 6 tiles

Weakness: Feedback
As the creator of Word Domination, the Designer is immune from virtually every alphabetic or strategic attack thrown at him. His only weakness - negative criticism.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building, Word Game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Spelling, Tile Placement

name: Mini WWII: Arctic War Promo Postcard
description:
Arctic War is a promo postcard for Mini WWII. Cut the map from the postcard and place it in the center of the game board. Put one neutral Army unit in Finland.

UPDATE: Any unit moves into or through the expansion map needs additional one OP. When Axis or Allies team controls the Arctic area, two countries in this team can discard one card and draw one card respectively in the next Strategy stage.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: Warhammer Armies (Fourth Edition): Dwarfs
description:
Warhammer Armies: Dwarfs is an expansion to the 4th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 112-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Dwarfs faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Nighthaunt
description:
The Nighthaunt are malevolent spirits cursed to an eternity of suffering and enslaved to the will of Nagash, Supreme Lord of the Undead.

Bring terror and despair to the battlefields of Warcry with this card pack! Combined with the Core Rules and your miniatures, this set lets you bring the spectral Nighthaunt to your skirmish battles. An abilities card lets you unleash deadly in-game tactics and powers, while a set of fighter cards provide profiles for Chainsrasps, Grimghast Reapers, Glaivewraith Stalkers and Spirit Hosts.

This set contains an abilities card in English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, and Russian, as well as several fighter cards. Please note that a copy of the Warcry Core Book is needed to use this set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Munchkin Warhammer 40,000: Cults and Cogs
description: Munchkin Warhammer 40,000 returns with two more new Armies to add to your games! The Genestealer Cults manipulate DNA to infiltrate worlds . . . when you realize they're among you, it's already too late. Adeptus Mechanicus has a more straightforward approach, sending their soldiers in intricate mechanized armor to lay waste to everything that opposes them.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Une décennie dans les tranchées: Guerre Iran-Irak 1980-1988
description:
On August 20, 1980, Iraq invaded its neighbor Iran for a limited war with multiple objectives that was promised to be rapid: recover territories that the two powers were fighting over, counter the influence of the Iranian revolution and its leader Ayatollah Khomeini.
But the offensive quickly bogged down and territorial gains were minimal.
In 1981, Iran counterattacked and liberated most of its territory in early 1982. Despite a ceasefire, it was Iran's turn to invade Iraq in order to overthrow Saddam Hussein. For another six years the two regional powers would clash for minimal gains.
A Decade in the Trenches lets you replay the entire war with a simple system, one-year turns, units representing brigades and divisions, and 80 km hexes.

Published in VaeVictis #159

–description from the publisher

name: Mutton Bustin
description:
Experience the excitement and thrill of Mutton Bustin, a beloved rodeo event, from the comfort of your table!

In this fast-paced game, each player will take on the role of young cowboys and cowgirls as they compete to see who can stay on the back of a bucking sheep (played by everyone else) the longest.

Riders must quickly roll their dice to meet certain criteria to advance along the score track, earning more points the longer they can stay on. But be careful – all of the other sheep players are simultaneously rolling their own criteria to try and knock the rider off. But there’s a catch for the sheep...they will have to do a series of crazy antics before they can lock in their dice.

The rider with the most points is declared the winner and crowned the Mutton Bustin’ champion!

With colorful graphics, silly simultaneous gameplay, and a fun Wild West theme, Mutton Bustin' is the perfect board game for gamers of all ages. So gather your friends and family, grab your cowboy hat and boots, and get ready to ride!

-description from publisher

name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – The Gleaming Spiral Asylum Pack
description:
The Gleaming Spiral is the fifth Asylum Pack in the Rituals of the Order cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game. Lucy sees the horrifying consequences of learning secrets that are best left alone as she witnesses the fate of Dr. Cooke.

The Gleaming Spiral is a fixed 60 card Asylum Pack that contains 20 different never-before-seen cards based on the dark mythos of master horror writer H.P. Lovecraft, designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Call of Cthulhu metagame.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based

name: Fallen Frontiers
description:
THE GAME

In the universe of Fallen Frontiers different factions fight for control of both planets and their strategic resources in order to proliferate in a galaxy that holds lots of secrets. The players assume control of an army faction that can be shaped by choosing troops, characters, and cards that best adapt to their game style.

Fallen Frontiers is a battle game based on combat squads. The squads offer protection and firepower to the characters. Characters that are the ones that define the game style because their attributes change the characteristics of their squad. In this way, each squad acts differently depending on the character that leads them. However in Fallen Frontiers characters are not superheroes, they are weak and easy to eliminate when they are not with their squad.

Besides the miniatures that represent their army, players will also have a deck of cards assembled by them. Strategy is not revealed at the beginning of the game, as a player can secretly set up the deck of cards allowing them to change the game style in such a way that opponents will not be able to guess their strategy at first sight.

The factions and the cards use up resources to carry out certain actions. The main resources are moral and Krithium. Players gain moral by achieving targets and causing losses to their opponent's army while their army suffers as little as possible. Using moral points will make an army more powerful but will exhaust it in the process. Krithium is a resource that must be collected during the game. It is the source of energy that enhances a team's weapons and cards. The player will have an armory, a separate deck where the player purchases equipment, that can be used during the game and consumes Krithium. The contents of the armory is also set up by the player just like the deck of cards.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Age of Towers: The Dark Elves
description:
An angry and ambitious chorus rises from the darkest subterranean depths… Your mines—already weakened by previous assaults—are now the target of an attack led by Matrone Malizia, Queen of the Dark Elves. Archers, assassins, and dark priests are rushing toward your city under the supervision of the Tremonas, the black queens.

This expansion contains:

60 monster tokens (10 per player)
6 boss tokens (1 per player)
1 boss board
5 cards per language
1 rulebook
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Movement, Network and Route Building, Worker Placement

name: Glory: A Game of Knights – Promo Pack 1
description:
A Promo Pack consisting of 5 cards (with no title/description):
2 Romance cards
3 Tournament cards
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Re-rolling and Locking, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: Espinosa
description:
"Espinosa" depicts the battle of Espinosa de los Monteros on November 10th and 11th, 1808. Fought high in the Cantabrian mountains in Northern Spain, between Lt-Gen Blake’s Army of Galicia and Marshal Victor’s I Corps. The battle was fought during Napoleon’s massive second invasion of Spain and although Blake’s starved troops fought the victors of Friedland to a standstill it was all in vain, as the Army of Galicia could not escape the jaws of Napoleon’s grand plan.

Napoleonic Brigade Series playtest kit is a free download from Multi-Man Publishing.

Napoleon Brigade Series (NBS)
- scale = 180-200 m/hex (197-219 yrd/hex);
- time = 30 min/GT (60 min/Night-GT);
- strength = 150 inf (100 cav)/SP
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: Pocket Tactics
description:
From http://www.illgottengames.net/pocket-tactics.

Pocket-Tactics is a 3d print-and-play strategy boardgame in which fantasy forces battle for control of a hex tile-based map. The game is fast-paced (most games lasting between 10-30 minutes), designed for ease of printing, and the entire game is small enough to fit in your pocket. The system is dynamic though resolution is quick and there aren't a ton of rules to track or memorize, making it ideal for advanced and casual gamers alike.
categories: Fantasy, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Die Legenden von Andor: Chada & Thorn – Narkonna: Der vergessene Hafen
description: Mini-expansion, consisting of one card that can be added on third position to any adventure.

name: Tricky Billy
description:
Tricky Billy is a trick-taking game with 5 suits. Each suit has a card which represents a special rule change (e.g. if the Billy suit rule is in effect, the lowest ranked card will win the trick).

The start player may lead any suit, at which point the card for that suit is marked to indicate it was the lead suit. Subsequent players must play either the lead suit or the suit marked with the special rule card.

For each trick, the first player who cannot follow either of the marked suits may play any suit, and the special rule card marker moves to this suit.

At the end of the game, the player with the second most points wins.

name: FUSE: Game Boy Geek Promo Card
description:
Promo from 2017 Game Boy Geek Kickstarter Campaign.

Simply mix this card in with the rest of them and proceed as normal.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Pattern Building

name: Coronel & the Falkland Islands
description:
Dreadnoughts & Battlewagons provides a low complexity ship-to-ship combat system allowing players to explore historical and hypothetical encounters during the age of the super dreadnought.

Each counter depicts a single ship or the information markers required to denote a ship’s damage, special ship movement, or configuration. Ships are rated for weight of fire, range, structural integrity, maneuver, speed, and special capabilities.

The Battle of Coronel simulates the 1 November 1914 meeting engagement off the coast of Chile between the German East Asia Squadron of Vice Admiral von Spee and the British 4th Cruiser Squadron under Rear Admiral Cradock. The historical outcome was the loss of Cradock’s largest ships.

The Battle of Falkland Islands simulates the encounter between von Spee’s squadron and a much more powerful British naval force on 8 December 1914. This time the British exacted a heavy revenge, virtually obliterating the German squadron.

—description from the publisher

name: Novice Novice TRPG Sword
description:
The newest editions of the Novice Novice ("Nobi Nobi") TRPG series are Sword and Magic. The Sword set focuses on characters that fight with their hands or weapons, such as Warrior, Thief, Samurai and Martial Artist, but a with a few more unique additions like Baker.

Novice Novice TRPG Sword may be played by itself, or integrated with Magic for a more exciting Sword and Sorcery themed Fantasy RPG. It's also possible to integrate with other games in the Nobi Nobi series.

Compared to the previous iteration of the game, Steampunk, there are no new mechanics, but the box has been made smaller for more ease of portability.

name: Kaosball: Ringer – Apocalypse & Hoots Mon
description: Expand your favorite Kaosball team's roster and boost their scoring potential with these brand new Kaosball Ringers. Ringers are powerful, all-star players that can fight, steal, score, and even use unique special abilities. Combine the right Ringer with your favorite team and unleash an unstoppable force onto the Kaosball field.

name: Cartoon Network Crossover Crisis: Dee Dee Promo Card
description:
The Cartoon Network Crossover Crisis: Dee Dee oversized character card was initially available as a promotional card for First Edition versions of Cryptozoic Entertainment's Cartoon Network Crossover Crisis Deck-Building Game. This card can be mixed with any of Cerberus engine games to give players one more of choice of starting characters.

As with every other character, Dee Dee grants a special ability to the player, which in this case is: "Once during each of your turns, you may destroy an Equipment in your discard pile. If you do, draw three cards"
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Warhammer Armies (Fourth Edition): The Empire
description:
Warhammer Armies: The Empire is an expansion to the 4th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 104-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect The Empire faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Stasi: Over and Out!
description:
Let's take a look into East German History and the end of the former socialist state, the GDR. November 1989. Under pressure from the civil rights movement, the GDR leadership has to retreat. The dictatorship is in an overt crisis, from which it will not recover. This affects the Ministry for State Security as well. On November 6th, a few days before the Wall came down, Minister Erich Mielke orders the destruction of documents.

For the card game Stasi: Over and Out players change their usual perspective and work for the Stasi. The goal of the game is to destroy as many documents as possible. Every destroyed document earns points. At the end, the player with the most points wins the game. Civil rights activists will try to stop the players. The game ends when five or more citzen cards are revealed. Players have to choose between distracting the citizens or destroying more documents. Like during the original events in 1989/90, the Stasi will lose the game to the citizens.

Players take turns. Every turn they have to draw and reveal three cards from a draw pile. These cards represents documents of different values (0 - +4), citizens of differnet values (-1 - -4), and special actions, representing historical artifacts, events and a way to break the games symmetry. Players can then play two actions, two different ones or the same one twice: Destroy one document, distract one citizen, take one special action. Destroyed documents are placed face down in front of the players, citizens that were distracted come back face-down underneath the draw pile, special actions are discarded and maybe shuffled back in the draw pile later.

The rules of the game are explained during the course of the game. Cards with rules text are sorted into the draw pile. Players learn the rules as the game proceeds. Cards are numbered, so the order of the cards can be restored. In addition to this there are cards, that explain the historical background. There is no booklet. The game starts the moment the box is being opened.

Stasi: Over and Out was developed by Playing History, a company that is specialized in creating games with historical background, games that are educational. This game was designed to be played not only in educational environments, but also at home, by smaller play groups and by people who are not used to learn game rules and play games.

—description from the designer

name: Tetreats
description:
Delivery people look for the best routes to deliver delicious customer orders on time. Optimize your deliveries well if you want to become the best delivery man.

Tetreats is a light roll & write game in which each player will be a food delivery boy who will have to find the best combinations, using Tetris figures, to deliver the food in the most efficient way.

—description from the publisher

Los repartidores buscan las mejores rutas para entregar a tiempo los deliciosos pedidos de los clientes. Optimiza bien tus entregas si quieres convertirte en el mejor repartidor.

Tetreats es un ligero juego roll & write en el que cada uno de los jugadores será un repartidor de comida que tendrá que buscar las mejores combinaciones, utilizando figuras de Tetris, para entregar la comida de la manera más eficiente.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

name: Kingswood: Kickstarter Promos
description:
Promo items during the Kickstarter campaign:
1) Kings's Favor Starting Player Coin
2) Dock Location
3) Panzoo Tapestry (Druid) character guild card and scoring banner token
4) Card with instructions for the Dock Location

Note: For backers of the regular edition, the promos come packaged in a separate bag and shipped with the game.
These items are included inside the Royal Edition box.
mechanics: Rondel, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Whistle Stop: Surveyor Crew Promo Tile
description:
A new upgrade tile for Whistle Stop

Surveyor Crew - Play the face-up tiles as if part of your hand

Given out at GenCon 2018
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Trains
mechanics: Action Points, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Whistle Stop: King Me! Promo Tile
description:
Originally available from the Game Boy Geek Season 6 Kickstarter.

A new upgrade gear tile.

When you join up your own trains through normal movement rules, they move together and you get double the benefit when landing on a stop.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Trains
mechanics: Action Points, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Ladybohn: Manche mögen's heiss! – Mutterböhnchen
description:
Latest Addition of the Bohnanza-series for 2-6 players. Only playable with Ladybohn: Manche mögen's heiss!
The set consist of 33 new cards:
8 babies
24 special male cards (2 of each kind)
1 counter card

The cards can be used to exchange and "spice-up" the base game as the male beans (such as the Chauvinist Pig or Slacker) bear conditions on them which can alter the game play.
2 regular cards are replaced with "mama's beans".
For Example: The Chauvinist Pig (a Saubohne, of course) only lets the lady beans be below the bean field. The metrosexual lets them get up front immediately.
The Bachelor discards all babies to the discard pile.
Those cards can really alter the gameplay.

...and then there's the Attack of the Little Rascals!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Humor, Negotiation

name: Ultimate Soldier
description:
The game is for 2-6 players and is played in rounds. There are usually 3-4 rounds in a game. Game play lasts 20-40 minutes. It is a quick paced game involving strategic combat. Outwit and outmuscle your opponents to become the Ultimate Soldier.  

To begin each player will start with 1 Soldier card, a Reference card, and eight Common cards. The first player to draw a Common card begins. They can make one of three moves during their turn.
Play a Training Academy card (When the equivalent of four Training Academies is met, they earn another Soldier card).
Mount an assault against another soldier, which can include enhancements from Weapons and Intensity cards (If your soldier dies and you do not have another one trained, you cannot mount an assault).
Discard because they are unable to make another move.

The game is played in rounds; the first player to either earn or have four soldiers alive, or win in three separate combats, wins the round. Players then get to draw Victory cards for winning the round or surviving the round with a Soldier card. The first player to earn seven Victory cards wins. If a player loses three or more battles during a round, they must surrender a Victory card. 

The game is designed to keep everyone involved throughout the game even if it is not their turn. For instance, during combat, a player can use a Deflection card to send the assault to someone else. During combat, if a player doesn't have cards to retaliate, but has a Radio for Help card, they get to draw two cards from anyone not in combat. There are also plenty of surprises, so don't leave the table for anything:  

The Sniper: a card that can be played at any time even when it is not that player's turn. The sniper takes out a soldier without recourse. However, if the player being shot by the sniper holds a Mirror card, they can use it to reflect the light into the sniper's eyes and survive. 

The Bomb: a card that can be played at any time, even when it is not that player's turn. The bomb kills one soldier in every player's hand, unless they hold a Dud or Super Dud card. The Dud card saves the soldier of the player that holds it. The Super Dud saves all the soldiers on the table. If you are on the way to victory, you might want to just hold onto the Super Dud and watch your foes explode.

name: Pitchstorm: Awards Season
description: A very prestigious expansion for Pitchstorm. "This deck introduces Awards, which are a totally new type of card to the game. At the start of each round, the table draws three awards cards. Then at the end of the round, the table votes to give these awards to the movies that were produced that most earned the award (or who sent the nicest gift basket)."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Cutterland: Cartridge Pack – Classics
description:
Recharging fun!

In this box, you'll find a balanced set of 80 Landscape cards for the game of Cutterland. Keep creating fabulous lands and enjoying the classic gameplay!

Note: This is not a stand-alone game! The base game is required.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Puzzle, Territory Building, Video Game Theme
mechanics: I Cut, You Choose, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: 1-2 Punch
description:
A highly strategic boxing game for 2 players. Predict your opponent's moves to get the KO!

1-2 Punch is an easy-to-learn strategic boxing card game that is easy to learn, but difficult to master. Similar to other abstract strategy games, 1-2 Punch rewards experienced players as they continue to play and hone their skills.

Both players strategically play two cards per round; one for their first action and another for their second action. Reveal and resolve the cards played for each action based on timings shown on each card. Execute your plan to land the perfect punch to exhaust your opponent and break their guard.

With only 24 cards and no board, 1-2 Punch can be played anywhere!
mechanics: Action Queue, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, King of the Hill, Programmed Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Zone of Control

name: Tartarus: Longo Itinere
description:
Tartarus: Longo Itinere combines a Dungeon Crawler and a Card Game with PixelArt graphic.
Dive in the Underworld, where some heroes are invited by the Devil himself to test their abilities in exchange for their most deep desire.
Fight hordes of ruthless monster, choose your path wisely and use your abilities to get to the final boss and overcome the other heroes.

In the game each player chooses a hero, each with different features and abilities. Monster's and object's cards compose the covered field in which the players will have to move choosing the direction they see fit the most.
During the game they can use abilities both defensive and offensive towards the other players, but unlike other games Tartarus features a balance between the need to weaken the opponents and keeping them alive.

Mephisto himself can come into aid during the game but be careful since the Devil can be tricky! He gives you a chance but he eventually wants your soul and you'll need to focus on finding a way to overcome his last challenge!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Maze

name: Nefertiti: La Barque Solaire
description:
Nefertiti - La Barque Solaire is included in Plato magazine No. 31.

La Barque Solaire is the French name for the Khufu ship.

This is an intact full-size vessel from Ancient Egypt that was sealed into a pit in the Giza pyramid complex at the foot of the Great Pyramid of Giza around 2500 BC. The ship was almost certainly built for Khufu (King Cheops), the second pharaoh of the Fourth Dynasty of the Old Kingdom of Egypt.

name: History of War: Africa Edition
description:
The Africa Edition has at present the best pre-constructed starters for History of War which are really a recommendation for new customers.

Although the Africa Edition consists of two pre-constructed decks for two players, the cards can of course be combined with all the other expansions of History of War. So the game - and all its expansions - can be played in multi-player sessions. The number of players may range from 2 - ?. There is no real limit, but the available place on most tables and the handling of some game mechanics usually do limit the player number to 6. Official multi-player rules don´t clarify that. It is recommended to play in two factions (axis and allies) with even player numbers - so 2, 4 or 6 players is best.
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: LOGacta Chart Soccer
description:
Using charts, dice and cards, you can create league and cup competitions for British clubs, and also the European championships and World Cup for international sides.
There are 8 season charts that allow you to play 6 club competitions

16 team Super League
F.A. Cup
League Cup
European Cup
European Cup Winners Cup
UEFA Cup

Each match is played by rolling 2 dice, one for each team, from the seven different colored dice with the game, using the Dice Selector Chart to determine which dice each team rolls. Only one roll is needed for most matches with the number on each die (range 0-5) the amount of goals scored for each side.

name: Donetsk: Battle for The Airport
description:
Description from the publisher:

Donetsk: The Battle for the Airport is the feature magazine game included in Yaah! #9 by Flying Pig Games.

Donetsk is not like most tactical level games on the market. First, it differs in scale - while units are relatively small (squads,individual teams and vehicles) the hexes are relatively large(approx. 150m). This was done to simulate the relative emptiness of the modern battlefield as compared to earlier conflicts. Modern combat units move slower and more cautiously due to the increased range and lethality of modern weapons. These factors explain why leg unit movement factors are low and there are no ‘close assault’ rules like earlier conflict period tactical simulations.

Second, even though the battle was called Little Stalingrad, unlike the forces involved in that pivotal WW2 battle, the forces in these battles were very brittle. It did not take many setbacks and casualties before a side lost their aggressive spirit and will to fight. The central game mechanic that depicts this, which the player needs to manage, is initiative /Hesitation. Protecting your Initiative Level is critical to keeping your tactical options and chances for victory open. Initially the player with the highest initiative normally gets to activate first - especially if in a close quarters battle in the Terminals the ability to fire first or withdraw from a bad situation before the other side can fire can be critical. Later, if your initiative level drops to your Hesitation Level then your options become very limited. If on the Offensive, the player is left with ranged fire hoping to attrition the defender to victory. If on the Defensive, then the other player can be more aggressive and it becomes very hard to hold important objectives in the face of a determined assault. Therefore,being sensitive to casualties is critical to winning.
publishers: Banana Games, Flying Pig Games, Tiny Battle Publishing

name: Munchkin Crazy Cooks
description: The munchkins have left the dungeon for an even more treacherous place — the kitchen! In Munchkin Crazy Cooks, 3 to 6 foodies cook up delicious schemes to get ahead, and the plastic standies and gameboard included help them track their progress. Food tokens give you a "Balanced Meal", which is a fresh and exciting way to win! The game includes the classic Munchkin races along with four new classes.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: The Late Unpleasantness: Two Campaigns to take Richmond
description:
“Two Civil War Campaigns to take Richmond”

In the spring of 1861, Richmond, Virginia became the capital of the Confederacy. Being a manufacturing powerhouse only 120 miles from Washington DC and the Confederate capital, it became the focus of Union attention. The threat of capture by Federal forces was constant.

The Late Unpleasantness covers the two major attempts to capture the Confederate Capital City. Gates of Richmond covers the Seven Days Battles with Robert E Lee facing down George McClellan. If It Takes All Summer is Ulysses S Grant’s overland campaign of 1864, which added the names of Wilderness, Spotsylvania Courthouse and Cold Harbor to Civil War history.

Each game stands alone, but share the majority of rules. Simple enough to learn and play in an evening, but enough twists and turns to make you want to replay it until it is worn.

The maps use a point to point movement system, rather than hexes to simulate the campaigning over the road networks and river crossings, rather than mass movements cross country. Combat is integrated into the movement, making coordination of large bodies of troops difficult.

The Gates of Richmond map covers the area from Richmond in the west to the White House on the Pamunkey, and from Mechanicsville south to Harrison’s Landing. Key features such as Malvern Hill, Beaver Dam Creek, and the bridges over White Oak swamp and the Chickahominy are highlighted. Will the Union army fail to attack the Richmond works as a result of “Prince John” Magruder’s antics?

If It Takes All Summer covers most of Central Virginia, from Brandy Station and Culpeper to the Cold Harbor north east of Richmond. The Wilderness features prominently in the campaign with a special table to create some of the confusion as a result of fighting in this tangle.

The basic units are divisions (a bit larger than usual for Civil War, but right in this case). Each unit is listed for strength and overall leadership/morale quality. Stacks are hidden for limited intelligence. Corps and Army leaders are available to modify the die roll in an attack as well as to help coordinate attacks from more than a single stack.

Sequence of play is straight forward with supply first. Units out of supply suffer movement and combat penalties and those with a continued lack of supply will suffer attrition. Confederate supply is a simple trace to either Richmond or a railroad, while the Union needs to relocate his base to keep his offensive moving.

Units move, then attack as a part of the stack’s movement. Terrain, strength and leadership are all die roll modifiers, in combat. Combat losses are in terms of strength points, but a third die is rolled to determine if the combat ends in a retreat or continues. If it continues, you count it up and do it again. (and possibly again) If your leaders are good enough, they may be able to break off a losing battle.

Thrown into the mix are random events cards, but the game is not card driven. Each player can hold a hand of up to 10 cards, which can be played in nearly any combination and at any time (except during combat continuation). You use the cards to enhance your units or mess with the other player (ie. Grant steals a march - all Union units +2 MP this turn, or Rain - 1 left shift on all attacks) Others are one time events (Sedwick gets killed, Jackson falls asleep) that will ruin your perfect plan.

Each game can be picked up and learned in under 30 minutes, and played entirely through in 4 hours or less. The cards, leaders and Wilderness/Magruder tables add a level of chrome and history to the games without making them difficult. Combined with the hidden strengths and dummy counters, no two games are ever the same.

Complexity: 4 out of 10
Solitaire Suitability: 5 out of 10
Time Scale: 1 turn = 2 days (IITAS)
1 turn = 1/2 day(GOR)
Map Scale: Point to point movement
Unit Scale: Divisions
Players: 2 players
Playing Time: 2-4 hours

Components:
Two 22 X 34 inch maps- One for each game
Three Countersheets
Two decks of 55 playing cards (1 for each game)
Two Rulebooks (1 for each game) with examples of play
Player Aid cards with Charts and Tables
Three 6-sided dice
One Box and Lid set
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Uradalom
description:
The game takes place in the medieval Europe where the players lead their estates as landlords. They must hurry with afforestation, regulation of rivers, and cultivating the fields to build a nicer and richer manor.

Each player rolls his 6 dice, then chooses one of them and draws the area corresponding to his number/colour on the map, then passes the other dice to the left neighbour using the dice holder and chooses one of the 5 dice he has, then passes this one and so on. When you run out of dice, the round is over and the next round begins in the same way. The game ends when all players have completed their map, i.e. filled in all the squares.

The player who scores the most points from building ponds, plough, forest, river, house wins. Each area has a different scoring system.

There are 2 variants of the game, one is a more tactical while the other one is faster. During the game common and hidden goal cards can be used optionally.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Stampede
description:
Stampede is a set-collection auction game themed around stamp collecting.

On a player's turn, they reveal 1 to 4 cards from a prepared deck to auction. The players then choose how many dice to roll. The player who rolls the highest amount is the winner, but will pay the value of the second highest amount rolled. The players pay their bids in dice, with each 6 coins (pips) they need to pay consuming 1 of their dice.

The end of the game is triggered once a certain card is revealed near the bottom of the deck. The player with the most points from the cards they've collected wins.

name: 4 X 4
description:
4x4 (aka Vier mal Vier) is an abstract 4-in-a-row variant in which 2 players use 16 grooved cubes to erect a wall between them, aiming to be the first one to create a sequence of 4 identical shapes in their own side of a wall, or of all 4 different ones. This row can be horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. The cubical building bricks are all unique, come in 4 colours, and the only placement restriction is that each colour is only allowed once in each level or column. When the last brick is added, the completed wall will be 4x4.

On 2 opposing faces of each cube, a groove has been carved out. There are 4 distinct grooves, and the twist is that these grooves rarely mirror each other on either side of a cube. Therefor the wall face will look completely different to each player. The grooves are paired in such a way that within each group of 4 identically coloured cubes, only one cube has an identical shape on both sides (a different one for each colour). The other combinations are unique for that colour, and each combo occurs only one other time within the entire set.

At the start of the game, the cubes are placed on coloured supply strips which show the 4 'footprints' of all the blocks that exist for each colour. The wall is build on the table surface between the players. Players can only see the top cube of each column and the shape of the groove on their side of the wall of the cubes below it. Forward planning, memory skills and deduction all come into play to some extent, as players above all need to prevent that the opponent gets the sequence of 4 first. The supply strips serve as gentle reminders of what is out there.

The pro-version introduces the rule that an opponent can force a player to take back the last played cube if it would prevent the wall from completion, and instead insist on the placement of a cube that would result in a wall with the maximum amount of bricks. It also suggest the removal of the reminder strips.

name: The Summer of 1863
description:
Point-To-Point movement, with a subtle system that portrays the political and economic underpinnings of the Gettysburg Campaign.

The game is operational in scope. The players are cast in the roles of Lee and Hooker/Meade. The map covers the area from Fredericksburg VA to Harrisburg PA

Beginning on June 10, 1863 with the Federal and Confederate armies concentrated near Fredericksburg, Virginia. Formations move on the map using point-to-point movement, with roughly 12-15 miles between map points. There are up to 10 turns during the game, and each game turn represents 3 days.

The formations in the game are Confederate Divisions and Federal Corps, and also include Army HQs, Cavalry Divisions, and Federal Departments. Each formation has a number of Command Points reflecting the skills of its leader.

Formations spend Command Points to move, forage for supplies, destroy bridges, and cut or repair rail lines. As formations move on the map, enemy formations may attempt to evade, intercept, or screen.

Battles occur when Federal and Confederate formations occupy the same map point. Battles can last up to 3 battle rounds. Battle movement can take place between battle rounds to reinforce the battle from adjacent areas.

Victory Conditions provide players with multiple strategic options for pursuing victory.

Components

22 x 34 inch map
98 die-cut 5/8 inch back-printed counters
12 pages of rules
one 8-1/2 x 11 inch player aid card
ziplock folio format

name: Baltimore & Ohio: Robber Barons Expansion
description:
Eddie Robbins' Baltimore & Ohio: Robber Barons expansion, which consists of industry moguls and a Robber Baron card deck, adds a completely new dimension to Baltimore & Ohio by means of special cards that can be auctioned off which give their owners special benefits.

Baltimore & Ohio: Robber Barons is one of the two games and seven expansions from Winsome Games released at Spiel 2011.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Stock Holding

name: Super Dungeon Explore: Kasaro To
description:
Kasaro To has no love for heroics. Lord Nozuki has corrupted the Super Dungeon Explore code, allowing his most favored servant to invade the Consul's dungeons. Kasaro To is prepared to wreak carnage and destruction upon the hapless heroes of Crystalia.

Contents:
Kasaro To Mini-Boss Model
50mm Base
Game Card
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures

name: 21 Mutinies: Treasures of the Empire
description:
The 21 Mutinies: Treasures of the Empire mini-expansion consists of five treasure counters that are shuffled with those from the base game to offer more variety during play. These counters give you:


Gold, either 1 or 3 coins depending on which you draw
One victory point
A jewel accompanied by two bottles of rum
A wooden leg, which is worth nothing but a fun prop at parties
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Kaosball: Ringer – Nibbles & Dis Assemble
description: Expand your favorite Kaosball team's roster and boost their scoring potential with these brand new Kaosball Ringers. Ringers are powerful, all-star players that can fight, steal, score, and even use unique special abilities. Combine the right Ringer with your favorite team and unleash an unstoppable force onto the Kaosball field.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Sports
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management

name: Talisman: Legendary Tales – Druid Launch Promo
description:
Pegasus Spiele has made a special character to add to the 6 archetypes found in the base game of Talisman: Legendary Tales.

The Druid(ess) limited edition promo features both male and female versions of the character and is available at Gen Con in August 2018 as a special bonus, or as part of the Launch Kit version (which includes 6 copies of the base game, 6 promos and a special advertising poster) which is available to Bricks & Mortar stores only.

The Druid is one of the 14 starting characters from the base game of Talisman (Revised 4th Edition) that has been transferred to the new game.

The character will also be made available for the German language version of the game, Talisman: Legendäre Abenteuer, at Spiel Essen in October 2018.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Dreams of Tomorrow: Awaken
description: This mini expansion includes 8 new cards with four of them adding in no resonance to your dream sequences, but being worth a large number of points and four of them adding in resonance to all dream sequences but being worth very few points. They also add in four new abilities, including one that combines with other abilities!

name: Battlestar Galactica: Starship Battles – Heavy Raider (Captured)
description:
The Heavy Raider is a Cylon multifunctional spacecraft, used to attack colonial ships and transport Cylon fighters on boarding missions. Like a Cylon Raider, this spacecraft is sentient and self–flying. It can also be piloted by Centurions or human–form Cylons, but its lack of windows forces the pilot to rely on electronics only to navigate.

The Heavy Raiders can be controlled by human pilots. Caprica’s Sharon (Boomer’s clone) stole a Heavy Raider to rescue Starbuck from a Cylon base and escape to Kobol. This pack includes cards to represent her when she became a Colonial pilot, with the callsign “Athena,” and the ship cards to play the model as either a Colonial or Cylon ship.

Contents:
1 Ready–to–play model
1 Gaming base
1 Ship card
Maneuver deck
Set of pilot cards
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Tack
description:
Out on the open sea, a small boat navigates the temperamental winds. Summon a powerful gust of wind to push your sails to victory.
In this short strategy game, players will move dice up and down within a grid to equal the required dice total. Block your opponents, line up your dice, and activate the wind to earn one point per dice. The first player to harness 9 points wins!

—description from the designer

name: Lagoon: Land of Druids – Mytreia's Glory / Cosmic Vault
description:
This is the second promo tile for Lagoon: Land of Druids, introducing a new site type (Totem) with special rules given below.

Mytreia's Glory (Side Numbered 2A)
Site type - Totem
Energy - Elemeen/Vowelon/Deonin*
If Mytreia's Glory is in play at the end of the game, seeds of the dominant energy are worth 2 Destiny Points instead of 1.
- The infinity action type is new. It mean that the tile has end of game effects.

Cosmic Vault (Side Numbered 2B)
Site type - Totem
Energy - Astral*
If the invoking druid's site is not a haven, gain 1 seed of that site's energy and move the invoking druid to any haven.

Triple Energy Rules

A site with all 3 energies provides 1 energy of your choice for unraveling. A site with all 3 energies can be unraveled using 3 of any other single energy — either 3 yellow, 3 red, or 3 blue.

Astral Energy Rules

Cosmic Vault is a site of the astral energy, identified by purple seed icons having a crystalline shape as well as a purple tile border. The astral energy is cosmic in nature — powerful, mysterious, and beyond human understanding.

The energy provided by occupying an astral site cannot be used to unravel any other site. However, an astral site can be unraveled. The required energy to unravel an astral site is three of any other single energy — either three yellow, three red, or three blue.

Astral sites also have the Astral keyword appearing in italics at the bottom of their text boxes. Whenever a player summons a druid, if any sites with the Astral keyword are on the board, they may choose for the summoned druid to enter play on a site with the Astral keyword instead of on a haven site. Sites with the Astral keyword do not count as havens in any way, however.

Totem Site Type Rules

When a totem site is unraveled, its tile is not removed from play like all other sites. Instead, when a totem site is unraveled, flip that site tile over to the site on the other side. The new site occupies the same position on the board as the original site. Additionally, all druids on the original site, including the unraveling druid, are transferred to the new site exhausted. The unraveling druid is not returned to its owner’s supply.

Note that, like any locked site, a locked totem site cannot be unraveled.

Promo Tile Setup Rules

To use the promo tile in a game of Lagoon, setup the game in the normal way. Then add the promo tile to the starting tile setup, adjacent to the two non-haven sites. Either side of the promo tile can begin face up.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Masters of Maple Syrup
description:
It's sugaring season on the Canadian Shield! Tap trees, boil sap into syrup and develop your tiny acreage into the finest maple farm in the province. Bound by the code of neighbourly conduct, the actions you take will also help your opponent but at the end of the season, there can only be one Master of Maple Syrup.

In Masters of Maple Syrup, players develop their property tableaus by adding trees to harvest sap from and utilities to improve their syrup production. On their turn, the active player determines the action both players will take, with a slight advantage in their favour.

The game ends at the end of a round where any player has placed 10 cards on their property (tableau). Scores are tallied from the value of cards on each players’ properties and any additional scoring bonuses the cards offer. The player with the highest value on their property wins.

Time your actions and develop a property to best benefit from your neighbour's actions in a cozy cabin game for two.

name: Space Marine Battles
description:
This book Space Marine Battles is a supplement for 2nd edition Space Marine. It is a compilation of articles from White Dwarf Magazine split into four sections:

Tactics
Battle Reports
New Rules
Modeling Workshop


The new rules introduced in this book included Daemon Engines of Tzeentch, Epic Personalities (Unique Characters for the game), Additional Titans & Garguants (these rules were superceded when Titan Legions was released) and Assult (rules for attacking fortifications)

Expands

Space Marine
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Panzers East Solitaire: Army Group Center, June-August 1941
description:
"Panzers East Solitaire" is a simulation wargame that covers the advance of Germany’s Army Group Center, starting on the first day of Operation Barbarossa and potentially extending to the last day of August later that same summer. The design supports both strict historical and alternative history explorations. That is, at the end of July, when the AGC offensive was historically shut down in favor of supporting extended drives by the flanking army groups, it’s possible that, if you’ve done better up to then than your historical counterpart, Hitler may authorize a continued and immediate advance on Moscow. You command the German forces while the system directs the handling of Soviet forces. You win or lose based on the timely seizure of key areas on the map.

Each game turn equals one-third of a month. Each hexagon represents 16 miles (24 km) from side to opposite side.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 280 counters

World at War Magazine #45, DEC 2015 – JAN 2016
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Arena: For the Gods! – Xenomorph
description: A promo card for Arena for the Gods
